The sofa bed was a life saver! Pool is small but fun and water temp was warm enough. Valet parking was helpful. Staffs were supernice and helpful. They noticed we were a bigger group and provided more shampoos/conditikners/lotions. The location was a bit tricky to find and it is close to coastal hwy so a bit noisy during late night and early morning time. Overall we were happy to stay and will visit them again!
Manager Response: Dear cr277,  Our goal is to be the home away from home for all of our guests while traveling for leisure or business and hope you enjoyed your holiday road trip!  Thank you for sharing your comments about our spacious guestroom suites and the authentic hospitality you received from all of our associates.  We truly value your review and look forward to welcoming you back to Orange County on your next visit.  Happy New Year!

Summary Heading: One Night Stay in Dana Point
Summary: Joseph at the from was so welcoming and accommodating during my recent stay at this property. He goes above and beyond to assure the satisfaction of his guests. After forgetting a phone in the room after check out, he made a temporary copy to allow me enough time to get into the room and retrieve the forgotten phone.
Manager Response: Dear Matt M,  Thank you for acknowledging our all star associate and thrilled you were able to retrieve your phone.  We will be sure to recognize and reward him as a result of your feedback.  We truly appreciate you staying with us here at the Doubletree Doheny beach in beautiful Dana Point!  Happy New Year!

Summary: Do not believe the hotel Internet and it says the hotel was recently refurbished because it certainly was not the case in our stay hotel staff is not very good they do not work as a team and this hotel is definitely not what I expected from a Hilton property
Manager Response: Dear RAYMOND K,  Our sincere apologies you did not have a positive impression of our hotel and take your comments extremely serious.  We assure you all of our guest room suites were remodeled just under two years ago and were updated with the most current design packages the Doubletree brand had available at that time.  We are truly sorry this isolated experience has tarnished your image of the Hilton brand and promise to deliver an enhanced guest experience on your next visit.

Summary Heading: Great hotel for a weekend getaway
Summary: We used to live in the area and come back every few months for a visit. We've stayed at the high end hotels before but wanted to try this hotel because of its location to Doheny Beach.  Everything was awesome. Room was clean and nicely appointed. We looked out over the pool with a peekaboo view of the ocean.  This location was quiet  (I'm a light sleeper and was able to sleep well). It was a quick walk to the beach for fun and some food at the beach shack. I love that theubhave bikes to rent there too.  The staff was very attentive and genuine.  Stop in the rooftop bar at sunset for a great close to your day. We will definitely be back on our next trip.
Manager Response: Dear rmalsop,  Thank you so very much for your glowing review and compliments of the Doubletree Doheny Beach!  We are elated you enjoyed all aspects of our clean guest room suites, friendly associates, quiet location and close proximity to the ocean.  Already looking forward to welcoming you back to the neighborhood in the future!

Summary Heading: Great location, cute inside and beautiful view!!
Summary: My husband and I were looking for a place to stay since we were attending the Dana Point Harbor Boat Parade of Lights. The location was absolutely perfect. We were able to walk to the harbor (20 min one way). The hotel is older but updates have been made, plus the hotel grounds and room were very clean. The room size was ample with separate living room and bedroom spaces and a balcony. Our room had a beautiful view but I could see how some folks could be disappointed with the views overall. We don't mind seeing the road as long as the beach is visible, and I am not sure all rooms have a beach view. The rooftop bar has a lovely view and an overall modern relaxing atmosphere. Continental breakfast does have room for improvement. I could tell they tried their best while the kitchen
Manager Response: Dear Greedy4Adventure,  Thank you for visiting our incredible city of Dana Point and attending one of our most unique events of the year, the boat parade of lights!  We are ecstatic you enjoyed our ideal Pacific Coast Highway ocean side location just minutes south of Laguna Beach.  Our convenient access to Interstate 5 allows guests to enjoy the best of Los Angeles, Disneyland, San Diego and everything else Orange County has to offer.  We truly appreciate your glowing endorsement of our hotel as you mentioned everything that makes the Doubletree Doheny Beach the only hotel to consider when visiting the Orange County Area.  Happy Holidays!

Summary: Nice hotel walking distance to the beach.  Stayed here before but experience not as pleasant as before.  Front staff could be friendlier and seemed to question my service dog way too much which was uncomfortable and wasted my time trying to find a “pet” form for me to fill out that they were out of.   Continental breakfast was ok but could be improved.  I have had better at a Best western.  Did not get the upper floor I requested being a Hilton honors member.
Manager Response: Dear Jennifer K,  Happy belated birthday and truly appreciate you being a return guest to our hotel!  We profusely apologize for your arrival experience and the manner in which information regarding your pet was obtained.  We are one of very few pet friendly hotels in the Orange County area and welcome all of our four legged guests!  We will definitely utilize this as a coaching moment and retraining opportunity for all of our associates to improve the overall guest experience moving forward.

Summary: Very disappointing hotel, especially for the Hilton brand. This place is old and run-down and in desperate need for upgrades. The location is convenient for close walk to the beach and nice ocean view, but that's where it ends.
Manager Response: Dear jsak099,  We are truly very sorry you were not impressed with our $8 million dollar guest room renovation that was completed two years ago and assure you we do our absolute very best to not only meet, but exceed all current Doubletree brand standards.  Your feedback is invaluable to us and we wish you happy holidays

Summary Heading: Great litte hotel by the beach
Summary: The staff is extremely responsive the site is very clean it's like a boutique hotel but it's a large chain operation right next to the beach what else could you want. The restaurant is small but perfect size for guests and the quality is above average. Small indoor/outdoor bar overlooks view of Pacific Ocean
Manager Response: Dear Eric N,  Our mission here at the Doubletree Dana Point is to be the cleanest, friendliest and to spread our authentic hospitality to all of our guests and proud you were able to experience that first hand.  You identified the exact ambiance and atmosphere our hotel offers with our laid back Southern California beach vibe combined with the Hilton brand name makes us the ideal choice when visiting the Orange County area.  Our rooftop bar offers incredible sunset views along with a fire pit for nights when the ocean breeze kicks in.  Your five circle review and endorsement means the world to us and thankful you shared your feedback with us!

Summary Heading: Great Value for Money - Very Comfortable Bed
Summary: This hotel is easy to reach from the free way or PCH and right on the ocean. The spacious rooms with very comfortable beds, high speed internet, large desk, good lighting makes it perfect for business travel. The service was at the level that one sees at hotels in a higher price category. I will definitely choose this hotel again for travel to this area.
Manager Response: Dear G548EWyvonneb,  Our hotel offers a little bit of everything to the family leisure guest on vacation to the most frequent business traveler and is an amazing temporary escape from day to day life!  We are delighted we exceeded your expectations during your stay with us and thrilled we will be seeing you again on your next visit to Dana Point!

Summary: First and foremost, this hotel basically has all your looking for.  They have a really nice roof top bar open every night.  Breakfast in the morning.  Valet and self park.  Great easily accessible location.  The room we has was big with a nice little fireplace.  Now a couple of things to know.  There is a little bit of a walk to get to the beach through a State park.  Also, this hotel sits in the middle of two very busy roads so if you don't have a beach view room, expect a lot of noise from passing cars, motorcycles, and trucks.  The bed was very comfortable and the staff was extremely helpful.  The one area that is unacceptable is the internet.  SLOW, SLOW, SLOW, and terrible trying to log into.  Otherwise, I would stay here again, you can get anywhere in the area very easily
Manager Response: Dear Batt2,  We are elated you enjoyed everything Dana Point has to offer during your recent visit with us at Doubletree Doheny Beach.  Thank you for sharing your feedback with us about your internet experience and will look into to ensure it is functioning properly.  Please accept our apologies this impacted your stay with us.  Your endorsement of a return visit means the world to us and appreciate you sharing your experience with us.

Summary: Good location for a variety of activities. Many good restaurants nearby.   Great bed and clean room. Will be nice when restaurant reopens as it was closed for renovation. Rooftop bar was nice and had several tv’s for sports.
Manager Response: We couldn't agree with you more about our ideal Pacific Coast Hwy location with gorgeous ocean views and convenient beach access.  Longboard our rooftop bar definitely offers the best of all worlds watching your favorite sports teams while enjoying a spectacular day in Dana Point!  We look forward to welcoming you back as our guest in the future and appreciate you staying with us!

Summary: My organization ran a three-day training at the hotel and it was a very good experience. All of the staff were extremely helpful, and we had no major issues with catering, AV, or setup. They accommodated us for lunch as well since there were no nearby restaurants or cafes. Specific mention goes out to Sergio our banquet manager. He provided great service with a smile and an awesome can-do attitude.
Manager Response: Dear Wilhelm E,  Thank you so very much for hosting your recent event here at the Doubletree Doheny Beach!  I appreciate you acknowledging our incredible banquet team and giving a shout out to Sergio.  We truly value your business and hope to host future meetings in the future.

Summary: Cute beachy hotel with large rooms but so close the freeway that its a little loud.  We really loved the hotel and location to the beach and it was in walking distance to restaurants and the harbor.  Only downside was the road noise on the back side of the hotel.  Maybe the rooms on the ocean side are quieter, i am not sure.  Parking is $25 per day in an underground structure. Overall, a nice stay.
Manager Response: Dear Merlot D,  Thank you for recognizing our all suite and Southern California beachy hotel vibe.  Our most sincere apologies the sounds of Pacific Coast Highway impacted your stay with us and hopeful our beachfront location and gorgeous sunset views from our rooftop patio bar, Longboard made up for that aspect of your stay.  We truly appreciate you being our guest at the Doubletree Doheny Beach

Summary: As a Hilton team member traveler that offers luxury level customer service to our most loyal diamond members, Erin showed me great hospitality and service, she created a memorable experience, and showed HEART! I came here with high expectations, but Erin exceeded even those. Erin is truly an amazing Hilton team member that exceeds MIR and I cannot wait to see how far she goes. KEEP IT UP! TWO THUMBS UP!
Manager Response: Dear Einnob N,  Thank you for making our day by sharing such a rave review of our superstar associate!  We have a beautiful hotel and location, but it's our associates that bring the building to life and truly impact the guest experience.  We all look forward to seeing you again on your return visits to the Dana Point/Laguna Beach area!

Summary: Remove machine from guest locations. Daily maid service without our complaint. Full breakfast which we had in the past. We were disappointed that our family couldn't sleep due to the noise and disappointed ourselves. We always look forward to the experiences we have had every year, and very frustrated by our unexpected experience this year.
Manager Response: Dear P8988YGthomasm,  We greatly appreciate you being a return guest to the Doubletree Doheny Beach and deeply regret you were dissatisfied on your return visit with us.  Our oversights you mentioned will definitely be utilized as training topics for all of our hotel departments to improve your future visits and can assure you this was an isolated experience.  Thank you for taking your valuable time to share your experience with us.

Summary Heading: Average hilton, old bathrroom, very poor breakfast
Summary: I stayed two nights in this hotel during a businesstrip. This hotel is rather old and in need of renovation. It is located just accross the street from the beach but there is a road and railtrack in between. In addittion, the hotel is also adjacent to another road in the back. The room was big but rather old. The bathroom was very old and worn out (in urgent need of renovation). I did not get any special treatment as HHONORS Diamond Elite member. Breakfast was terrible: no scrambled eggs, no salads, no fresh bread (only toast or junkfood such as muffins etc), no espresso or capucino coffee. They charge for parking. There is no executive lounge for hhonors elite members. The rooftop bar (which charges for drinks) is nice after sunset. All in all a very average Hilton hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Vincent D,  We are equally disappointed you had an average stay with us especially when all of our guest rooms were renovated less than two years ago.  Our restaurant kitchen is also in the beginning stages of an upgrade and due to local health codes we are temporarily unable to prepare hot food items during this time period in profusely apologize this impacted your guest experience.  Thank you for being a loyal  HHonors member and providing us with your valuable feedback.

Summary: Have stayed at this hotel several times.  Each time I remind myself what a nice hotel this is.  Nice room, nice people, great location. And don't forget about the hot cookies. Can't wait for our next concert at the Coach House to stay at this hotel.
Manager Response: Dear 923Maggiea,  We truly value you as a repeat guest at our hotel and hope you had a phenomenal time at your concert at the Coach House!  Our convenient location to Laguna Beach, San Juan Capistrano, Doheny Beach and mid way point between LA and San Diego makes us an ideal destination for all guests.  Thank you so very much for sharing your experience with us and thrilled you are a member of the Doubletree Dana Point family!

Summary Heading: Very clean, excellent location and ultra friendly staff
Summary: very clean, excellent location and ultra friendly.  Bright and comfortable pool area with 4th floor lounge over looking the area. The front desk staff and BJ, the valet, were very helpful. Continental breakfast was laid out well with quality food.
Manager Response: Dear DavideV5956RF,  We are absolutely thrilled you enjoyed your vacation here in Dana Point and truly appreciate your kind compliments regarding our beautiful hotel.  Our goal is to be the cleanest and friendliest destination in South Orange County and delighted you were able to experience it for yourself.  Thank you so much for allowing us to be a part of your vacation

Summary Heading: Would love to give a better review but can't.
Summary: Went there for a little vacation and have mixed reviews. The location close to doheny beach is wonderful. We enjoyed the balcony looking out to the campground and beach. The bathroom is extremely small and not well thought out. There is no counter space and the sink splashed all over us unless we had the water at a tiny trickle.  Had a terrible run in with the cleaning lady about changing the sheets on one bed after my grandson had gotten sick. I did talk to check out about this when we were checking out and the gentleman was extremely helpful and very upset by this.
Manager Response: Dear Lisa C,  Thank you so very much for sharing your vacation with us and thrilled you enjoyed our amazing location at Doheny Beach and gorgeous ocean views in beautiful Dana Point!  Our most heartfelt apologies for your interaction with our housekeeping associate and the overall design of the bathroom.  We truly understand your disappointment given the circumstances of your service encounter and will utilize your feedback as a training opportunity for all hotel associates.  We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back as our guest in the future and confident we can exceed your expectations on your next visit.

Summary: Hotel is poorly maintained - elevators were out all weekend and the hotel was 100% booked for four wedding groups.  The property is tired, outdated and poorly maintained.  Don't stay here if you expect Hilton quality.
Manager Response: Dear jaylW2274IC,  Please accept our most sincere apologies you were not extremely satisfied during your recent visit at the Doubletree Doheny Beach.  We can assure you we did everything possible to repair the elevators in a timely manner, but did not have access to the necessary parts on the weekend and understand the frustration this caused our guests.  Our team is extremely committed and working diligently to make sure the property is maintained in accordance with all current Doubletree standards and will continue to strive for perfection in our daily efforts to minimize the outdated perception of our phenomenal hotel.  Thank you so very much for taking your valuable time to share your feedback with us as it allows us to improve the guest experience moving forward.

Summary: Stayed here to attend a wedding at the ocean institute.  Great location. The room smelled funny, but was clean. Service was great. The restaurant was closed for renovation so they offered free continental breakfast which was nice of them, although we didn't wake up in time!
Manager Response: Dear Guadalupe P,  We are thrilled you enjoyed your weekend and our unbelievable location here at the Doubletree Dana Point!  Thank you for sharing your experience with us and look forward to welcoming you back as our guest in the future.

Summary: No jet tub. Toilet not working. Locked out of the room. No communications. 2 elevators, very slow. Not much of a hotel. The room was not expected, with the ocean view, the train noise, palm trees, small swimming pool. Slow Internet. The door chain was an danger, not safe, hard to put it in, and of course, very difficult to get it out. We didn't use it, since we do not want to be trapped
Manager Response: Dear 261chic,  Thank you for sharing your experience with us and genuinely apologize we did not exceed your expectations during your recent visit with us.  We will share your feedback with the appropriate hotel departments and utilize it as a training topic for our entire team to prevent it from recurring in the future.  Please do not hesitate to contact me directly if you are interested in discussing your experience further and truly value your feedback.

Summary: Exceptional value, wonderful staff, close to beach, breathtaking view. 2 queen beds with a shared patio. Heated outdoor pool. Rooftop bar. Parking options of valet or self. Fitness center with filtered water station.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Everyone was so helpful and polite..service was perfect and we all had a wonderful time staying so close to beach and many things to take in at Southern Calif...Thank you for great time..we will visit again
Manager Response: none

Summary: Execellent weekend with friends. I'd stay there again.  Great location, clean, renovated, fire pits, and an awesome lounge for sunsets. Fantastic continual breakfast. Valet attendants were awesome. This double is worth the stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary: the location is great with the beach and state park right across the street. I will say the street to get to the hotel is kind of a poor setup, but I would blame that on California not the hotel. The room was bigger than expected with a seating area and was very clean. The hotel had a free breakfast and all the staff were great.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is a great hotel in Dana Point for solo and family travelers. The hotel staff is very helpful and friendly. The location is perfect to visit Dana Point Harbor and all of the shopping in the area.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Traveling for business is never easy, even when you are sent to Southern California to throw a beach party. The staff made me feel at home and the servers in the bar, albeit half my age, even appreciated the music I referenced without using the term classic rock once. Great spot for business, a great spot for families, a great spot to stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Staff were extremely helpful and polite. Arranged to get us to the wedding venue when Uber was not available.  Great location. Wish we had more time there to enjoy the hotel.  Saw they had bikes available to ride. Would have been fun.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My wife and I are residents of Dana Point and have always thought a "staycation" at the Double Tree would be a great time, so for my birthday we finally booked a night and now will definitely be returning. We booked an ocean view king suite and upgraded to the higher floor option (we couldn't pass it up). From the moment we checked in we were impressed with not only the hotel itself, but also by the level of service we were provided. Carlos A, was especially accommodating and friendly from the second we walked in. Shook my hand, welcomed us to the hotel, and even remembered my first name from when I had called to check on our reservation. He even comped us a round of drinks for my birthday. The rooftop bar was excellent as well - we spent most of our time either there or on our
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Stay at the Marriott, skip thus hotel.
Summary: Air conditioner was not working, room temp never dropped below 74. Breakfast was NOT the hot breakfast typical for Doubletree Hilton.  Location and customer service was great, but the rooms need updating.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Staff was friendly, helpful, gracious, efficient and kind.
Summary: It was the perfect location for our needs. The bell and valet staff were friendly, helpful, gracious, effficiant and kind. We were only there the one night, but it was lovely. We would definitely stay there again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: No room service, due to restaurant closure grease fire.  Was there only 2 nights and my room never got cleaned.  I got back too late.  Just fell asleep and had to check out the next morning. Musty smell in hallways and room.  Windows are old.  AC smelled, couldn't sleep very well.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Very clean and well maintained. Appears to have had a recent remodel and it really shows. Great view as well! Pool was closed as they worked on tile issues so that was a bummer but it is temporary. Their restaurant is closed as well, but they are giving a free continental breakfast to compensate which is nice. Very convenient location!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I absolutely loved this hotel. I was there the last week of September on a business trip and enjoyed my stay. Hotel was very clean  Carlos, the receptionist, was awesome. He was very friendly and very informative. I plan on going back soon but next time it'll be a pleasure trip with my family.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Room with a view but no restaurant
Summary: Being a business traveler I book hotels with restaurants and room service, because my room is my office.  So l was very disappointed not to have been informed before I arrived that the restaurant was closed and there was no room service.  However, the room was large, clean and had a great view.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great view, not very walkable to restaurants
Summary: Good staff, infuriating elevators, nice lobby and rooftop lounge. Meeting rooms are ok, WiFi is sketchy depending on your room location. Food staff was outsourced due to a kitchen fire, but did a great job.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Super clean, fresh linens, bright rooms!!!  Made me want to stay in the room the entire stay!  Had conference to go to!  Friendly, helpful staff at the front desk!  Everyone from the valet workers to the housekeeping staff was super friendly and made me feel important!  Outstanding service, best room ever!  No issues whatsoever!  Would stay here again without hesitation!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Beds were very uncomfortable, hard as a rock. Parking is $25 per night. Rooms are $249. We were here for a wedding and the hotel blocked out a group of rooms at the "heavily discounted" rate of $209 per night. There kitchen burned down a few months ago so they serve a cold "continental" breakfast to try to make up that they have no kitchen
Manager Response: none

Summary: I had a week long meeting and stayed here. As you know, these meetings can at times be stressful but the meeting turned out great with the assistance of the following awesome DoubleTree Hilton Team: Cara Young, Wesley Oplustic, Sergio Jimenez, and Lucy Rubio. The customer service I received was amazing, they were available at any time I needed. I feel so thankful that I had the great hotel team to work with which made my meeting flawless. Trust me when I say, I will be back.   But let's not forget the AWESOME bartenders, "T" and Luis. After hours when some much needed down time was needed, they made it fun and easy - their customer service was impeccable!   Thank you DoubleTree Hilton TEAM for being so awesome!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I have stayed at this hotel for business reasons several times.  Every time I stay here, I am impressed with the quality of service I get from the staff.  The hotel is very clean and in an excellent location near the beach and quality restaurants.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We have been staying at this hotel for over 10 years and return the same time every year. There is always something interesting, this year there had been a fire so breakfast was delivered from outside the hotel. We laughed and still had a great time. It at the beach and the hotel has wonderful views. Wesley has always taken care of us while we are there. The other staff is equally helpful.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Came here on business, stayed for the weekend for leisure.  The Hotel overall is nice.  The beds are comfortable and the rooms are roomy and clean.  This place is very close to the beach.  Staff is friendly and helpful.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Open Container of Hard Liquor in our Room with our 2 Little Kids!
Summary: The bathroom needs a new toilet (we had to pour water in it to make it flush), new faucet and toilet paper holder (both are rusted and old), and you can hear the AC when you take a shower- weird. The fridge we had to play with to get it cold enough. The screen slider was broken. The couch bed was very uncomfortable. The noise level was very loud at night til 11pm (on a main road and the bar on top of the hotel attracts drinkers). WE FOUND AN OPEN BOTTLE OF HARD LIQUOR ON THE FLOOR WITHIN REACH OF OUR 2 and 6 YEAR OLDS! We told a front desk gal and the manager was in the office and she told her, but she did not come out and apologize. All they offered us was free parking ($75) and 40,000 Hilton Points for one free night's stat later. They did not seem too alarmed which was very
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed for a full week for business and then a little getaway and was very pleased with the DoubleTree at Doheney Beach.  While the facility is a little older, the hotel was clean and very well taken care of.  Amenities were fine.  Unfortunately, the restaurant was limited to a continental breakfast due to a recent kitchen fire but the food was just fine.  The biggest plus is the actual location.  You are walking distance from the famous Dana Point Harbor and all of the restaurants and shops that it includes.  We had a 4th floor ocean view that was great.  The room was clean and while a bit small, it was very comfortable.  The staff across the board was very friendly and helpful.  I would stay here again and would recommend the same...
Manager Response: none

Summary: If you are a long time Hilton honors gold or diamond member you are used to being offered something a little extra during your stays. The DoubleTree my way offering is fairly boring but room upgrades are the primary attraction. The reviews of this hotel lead you to believe that room upgrades are not offered and my personal experience was the same. We had to ask the front desk staff for an upgrade as we they were not going to bring it up. Then they were only going to offer a better view but then you would have to settle for 2 small beds. I overheard the same being offered to any guest checking in asking for a view so status did not seem to make a difference. The rooftop lounge has a lovely view but no hot food to go with your drinks. Everyone gets free breakfast here. I inquired
Manager Response: none

Summary: Always a great place to hold a training event and the location is just a plus. During the year we have over three hundred managers attending a three week program and this hotel provides the best platform for conducting the training and relaxing after.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great stay at Dana Point beach
Summary: This is a great location, the staff is great, the hotel is very nice, I wish the pool was in a different location maybe on the roof. I had a beachfront room the view was good but the trees block some of the views, but all in a great place to stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here one night while in town for a wedding. Our bed was comfortable. The room was clean. The sitting area was larger than I was expecting which was a pleasant surprise. The bathroom was very small and it had a sliding door that I didn't like. The hotel was convenient for getting to and from the freeway while still being close to the beach. However, it is situated in an area that doesn't allow for ease of walking to anywhere other than the beach. The hotel staff were friendly especially the parking attendants. It was great for a quick overnight trip.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here for two nights. Don't expect to get any sleep, the walls are paper-thin (I was awoken by someone unwrapping candy in the hallway thin! Not sure if it was the room I was in or the entire hotel) T.his is a 3-star hotel at best, but I gave it four stars for the hardworking and buttoned up staff which you have to appreciate. Everyone was excellent especially the valet and bar staff who really hustled. The bar was busy both nights and they handled the crowd really well with the manager stepping in to help. The free breakfast was a nice touch although nothing special and the staff was on top of it to make sure it was clean and fully stocked at all times.  I would definitely stay again when in the area.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great people but a rough room experience
Summary: I arrived after midnight and had a very early wakeup so I just wanted to get into the room and go to sleep.  The woman who checked me in was the absolute highlight of the visit. She was friendly, animated, engaging, and made me very optimistic about the property.  And then I got to the room.    I opened the door and, although the smell of cleaning fluid was very strong, I was pleasantly surprised to see how big the room was. Then I looked at the desk and saw 6 golf tees on the desk - I thought, oh, that's interesting, we're in a resort area, that's kind of a cool marketing/branding idea.  But when I got closer I saw that they weren't golf tees, they were very long screws, partially covered in plaster dust.  I immediately looked around and saw that there was a vent cover missing
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great location - Great hotel if you can deal with ants
Summary: There was an absolute ant farm in our rooms.  Both our original room and the room we had to move to both had trails of ants in several locations.  After we brought up the issue to the front desk for the third time we were told "my manager said that we had a problem with ants in that room yesterday"  soooo they knew about the problem and assigned us the room anyhow.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had an amazing stay at the hotel! The rooms were clean, the beds were comfortable and the views were gorgeous. They have very fun, friendly staff who helped us with all of their needs. I am extremely picky and this hotel met all of my standards!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We work hard to find great properties near the beach, and DoubleTree doesn't disappoint. Offering a low-key vibe, and staff who have a great orientation to service. We loved the views, the pool, the roof-top bar, and the continental breakfast.   This property is truly a gem on the PCH.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Clean room with very nice view
Summary: Everything was fine except the limited food choices in the bar while restaurant is under renovations. Oh and Internet was slow and kept disconnecting.  Otherwise, bed was comfortable, room was clean and view was awesome.  Valet parking is $25 a day.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I have been to many hotels much batter than this for less money. It is a motel. No food or restaurant till maybe January . Not suitable for longer stay than over nigh. Very basic breakfast.Site keep asking to add more I don't know what else to say so I can post this.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We enjoyed our stay from the moment we walked in. The colors and decor, as we walked in, left us feeling happy... lending an ambience of the sea. Staff was friendly and accomindating. Room was very nice, clean and cozy. Location was prime, for us.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Double Tree Inn and Suites by Hilton, had no room or resturant service because the kitchen was out of service since July 2017. Room was clean upon arrival but when we requested housekeeping, 2nd day of stay, they never showed. up
Manager Response: none

Summary: Check-in poorly handled, room upgrade not managed properly, valets killed battery 2 nights in a row (@$25/night). For a two day stay they ran $1900 (finally to arrive at a $601 total!) in transactions on my card completely obfuscating my transactions, card balance, and total charges.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Very beachy vibe at this hotel. It's probably a great hotel for families. Upon arriving we noticed fruit flies in our bathroom .... and tissue in the toilet. We were eventually switched to another room. One disappointment is the fact that they advertise the bedroom is separate from the living area in the suite .... it is not, it's built like a studio the bed is in the same room as the living room just FYI if you want to invite friends over and have a separate bedroom you won't get it here.....
Manager Response: none

Summary: this is the 3rd time I have stayed here and love it more each time  the people working here clearly have a good time and enjoy what they do which makes it great for guests the location is perfect and the room is always clean & quiet
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great location, you can hear and see the ocean Many great restaurants near by Very clean and modern and specious Excellent service from the valet to front desk to bar Enjoyed this hotel which was near the wedding venue we attended. Would come back and highly recommend to all. Pet friendly!!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: The location is one way street, very inconvenient. Homeless people all around in the park. The hotel staff are wonderful but the restaurant was under construction. There was onsite parking which was nice.
Manager Response: none

Summary: For the price it was a great fit for us. Being retired and non-weekend travelers it worked well for us. My wife fell in love with the mattresses in our room. They were great for sleeping and resting comfortably for a quick nap. The highlight was having a dog drinking dish at the main entrance. Truly showing it was a pet friendly place.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great service and very relaxing location
Summary: This is the 2nd trip I've made to this hotel and this was to celebrate my 30th anniversary.  Great choice and I had a very relaxing time.  I told the Front Desk Manager, Michael, the occasion and he did a great job and made the trip special for my wife and I.  The hotel has a view of the ocean and you can walk to the beach.  They also have a nice bar on the top floor and it has a great sunset view.  The hotel was very quiet even with families there.  I have stayed at another resort hotel nearby and I have to say it was not as relaxing.  This is a great place to vacation or for a special occasion.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Eh... I expected better from a Hilton property
Summary: We stayed here for one night on a road trip up the coast of California. This hotel is quite pricey - mostly because it's in Dana Point, and there are not a lot of other hotels in the small beach-town. We arrived late on a Saturday evening (after 11:30 PM.) There was no self-parking available, when we arrived, and valet parking was an additional $20+. The room we were given appeared as though it was not thoroughly cleaned; the bathroom had a used bar of soap sitting on a filthy sink. That night, we heard gurgling coming from the bathroom and realized the junk in the sink was from the plumbing backing up and bubbling up the drain. Upon check out, the front desk could not find my reservation to check us out, and consequently the stay was not properly credited to my Hilton rewards
Manager Response: I appreciate you bringing this to my attention and I am very sorry for the service failures that you experienced with us during your recent stay. I would like  to investigate this matter immediately and if you would be willing to give me a call or email me information of the name on the reservation, arrival date and room number it would be most helpful. Again I want to apologize and hope to hear from you soon. Thank you.  Bill Reider General Manager Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 949-234-4500

Summary Heading: A lovely stay close to the beach
Summary: Enjoyed two nights at this hotel which is within walking distance to Doheny State Beach. A free continental breakfast was included, but the restaurant was closed due to refurbishing. Housekeeping was busy on Sunday so my room wasn't clean when I returned at 5 pm, but they took care of it when I requested it.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Not as nice as your average Doubletree
Summary: Also, the kitchen caught on fire so there is no restaurant (August, 2017).  Nearest restaurant is about 0.8 miles.  As a Diamond member, I don't expect a room overlooking the freeway, but that's what I got.  Hotel is not on the beach but it is walking distance.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback and for your loyalty to the Hilton brand. We apologize for not meeting your expectations. Our kitchen is currently recovering from a recent fire and in the mean time we are offering free continental breakfast to all guests. Additionally, we do have our roof top bar open for lunch and dinner with a sandwicha nd salad menu. We hope that you choose to stay with us again in the future.

Summary Heading: Great Location - Worst staff - Tired Facilities
Summary: Used points to send my wife and her sister on a vacation. There was no bell hop availability, no staff to assist the two women with their luggage (one of them uses a walker). The kitchen was out of service so there were meals on site and of course no room service. No compensation offered. They also reported that the rooms seemed smaller that usual for this level of hotel. Normally I would have booked another hotel in Coronado for this annual trip but they wanted to do the art festival. The water view they reserved meant leaning out and craning your head so you could see some water. would NOT recommend this hotel if this is how it is during the August vacation season.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to provide constructive feedback. We have an amazing valet staff on duty  from 6:00am-11:00pm daily and I will look into why your wife and her friend were not offered assistance.  As you mentioned, our restaurant was closed due to a fire in our kitchen and we are offering all of our guests complimentary continental breakfast until the restaurant can be reopened. We apologize for the inconveniences you encountered during your stay and would hope that you will give us a second chance in the future. If I can be of any further assistance please feel free to contact me directly. Thank you.  Bill Reider General Manager 949-234-4500 Bill.Reider@Hilton.com

Summary: It's a great hotel to stay if you already have plans to be in the area.  It doesn't have great views or attractions but it's a nice hotel. The rooftop bar is great.  There is an RV park and camping right across the stress from the hotel, so you have that option as well.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Very inviting entry and lobby, large and comfortable suites, super ocean view from balconies (not all the suites), walking distance to beach and Dana Point harbor, close to lots of restaurants and stores (Costco, etc). Friendly and helpful staff. Only concern: expensive parking $25/night.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The stay was average. Not the most pleasant I have had. A good night sleep is one of my priorities. I was not able to get one. I was difficult to have a good night sleep with the perimeter security lights shinning in your bedroom window. The location is walking distance to the beach. There are several eating places that are also in walking distance.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Getting to the hotel was odd! I requested a suite, however the room was on the small side for being a suite.  We had four people in our room and, we were cramped. The worst part of it, the bathroom had a barn door that fell short on both sides leaving an opening on each side of the door. NO PRIVACY!
Manager Response: none

Summary: If you can get a room facing the ocean, its definitely a plus.  Rooms are good size, clean and modern.  Cookies upon check-in.  Onsite restaurant has a super breakfast buffet on the weekend and a menu during the week.  Breakfast is included if you are a Hilton premier member.  Easy walk to Doheny beach. Great value for the location.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Older facility that is OK.  Staff was very friendly and professional.  Made great recommendations for dinner.  Great location across the street from Doheny Beach State Park, short walk to the beach.  Also short drive for food options.
Manager Response: none

Summary: One of the slogans for DoubleTree is, Niceness Matters Above Everything, and it's true here.  My family with three rooms had a great arrival experience by the Bell Team, Robert & Scott, check in with Carlos was perfect and ending it at the rooftop sitting area overlooking the beach with barman Tareq.  Our standard room had two TVs, a couch sitting area, great lighting and plenty of outlets, a mini fridge and in our room (although I know it is not in every room) had those trendy barn doors leading into the bathroom.  Not all rooms had a view which was ok for us.  If it does matter to you consider the upgrade.  The amenities were Crabtree and Evelyn which was perfect scent for the beach.  Any request such as a late check out, extra towels, toys or umbrellas for the beach which the
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel was recently remodeled and the rooms were average.  The upgraded ocean view I paid for was not at all what expected since there was a camping ground right in front of the hotel on the beach obscuring the view and diminishing the whole reason to stay in a beach hotel.  The other disappointment was that the hotel's restaurant had a fire and therefore there was no food in the hotel and nothing within walking distance.  Overall, if you wanted a hotel on a beach to just unplug and relax, this would not be one to choose.
Manager Response: We want to thank you for your feedback.  I can imagine how you feel about the location of the hotel and understand your frustration.  We apologize for not meeting your expectations during your stay.  Unfortunately, there was a fire in the kitchen causing us to close the restaurant.  We made arrangements to provide a food option to all of our guests.  Again, I apologize that we failed in meeting your expectation.  If you would like to discuss further please feel free to contact me at 949.661.1100.  Sincerely, Bill Reider General Manager

Summary: Great hotel with friendly staff. I highly recommend this hotel. If we come out here next year hopefully we stay at this hotel. I loved that you could walk to most restaurants and beaches. Restaurant in hotel was closed but did have a very simple complimentary breakfast
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: I enjoyed my stay at the Doheny Marriott and being by the beach made my stay even better.
Summary: The rooms are small but cozy and the staff was accommodating. I would stay here again. They welcome you with water and cookies which helped ease the time it took to check in.  The only disappointment is that there isn't a resturant at the hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The room was small and the bathrooms are even smaller. The faucet in the bathroom was coming apart. There were stains on the pillow cases. The hotel is right across the street from the beach. Overall, this hotel reminded me more of a motel. It needed a lot of maintenance.   We left early since we did not feel comfortable with the cleanliness and upkeep of the hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know how your stay was.  I sincerely apologize that you had a bad experience.  We provide ourselves on giving our guests an exceptional stay and in this case we failed.  I have spoken with both the Housekeeping and Engineering teams to address your concerns as I take them seriously.  Again, I appreciate your feedback and if you would like to discuss further I can be reached at 949.234.4500.  Sincerely, Bill Reider

Summary Heading: Nice location, Rediculously bad rooms and high price
Summary: Price was over inflated for the poor condition of the rooms and dysfunctional small bathrooms.  Save your money and stay elsewhere.  Embarrassment to all Hilton Honors members.  We thought this was going to be a nice experience for our 12 y/o grandson's first trip to southern California.  The Dana Point community was nice, but we could not wait to check out of this cramped hotel.
Manager Response: I appreciate your comments and glad that you liked the area and apologize for the experience you had.  We certainly take your comments seriously and are looking for ways to enhance the guest experience.  If you would like to discuss please feel free to contact me at 949.234.4500.    Sincerely, Bill Reider

Summary: I had a meeting elsewhere in the area.  I made the decision to attend relatively last-minute, and other hotels in Dana Point were either insanely expensive or sold out.  I was excited to find an affordable room at the DoubleTree.  I had a nice stay.  It was nothing fancy, but delivered on the DoubleTree brand promise.  My room had a terrible view (a construction site on the side of the property), but was large, clean, and had beachy decor.  It was a bit of an unusual layout for a suite, with the bedroom in the front room and the seating area in the back, but the ocean view rooms may appreciate having the seating closer to the view.  The bathroom was very small, but had good water pressure.  Across the street from the hotel is the beach and a park.  The park is a campground, and
Manager Response: none

Summary: I spent two days here for a work trip. And by far this is the worst hotel and customer service I've experienced. I couldn't wait to get out of here. I recently had a pleasant stay at Doubletree in La Jolla so I was so disappointed here at Dana Point Doubletree. Here are my gripes with this place.  -Poor customer service: They're not rude but they're all stoned face and robotic. Even when they have 2+ people waiting in line at the front desk, their little chit chat among themselves is far more important than helping the customers. So we all patiently waited 5 minutes for one of them to even acknowledge the 1st customer in line. -Common area: The fire pit in the front by the pool looked very promising. But it ran out of propane so was not working. When we asked the staff, he said
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments and sincerely apologize for the horrible experience that you had.  This is certainly not how I expect our guest to be treated.  I have spoken directly to the Housekeeping and Front Desk Manager and expressed my concern in how their teams treated you during your stay.  Since the fire we have taken appropriate action of posting information on our website and pre arrival confirmations to notify guests that the restaurant is closed.  I apologize that this information was not made available to you.  Our training efforts have failed and we are in the process of re-training the entire staff on providing great customer service and guest room cleanliness.  Please feel free to contact me with anytime to discuss further.  949.234.4500.  Sincerely, Bill Reider General Manager

Summary: Check in easy.  Location good.  Just a short walk to Doheny public beach.  Pool small and located outside just off the main entrance.  We selected valet parking for same daily charge and the guys were very efficient and helpful.  Restaurant was closed so hotel provided free continental breakfast which was ample and delicious.  Received cookies and bottled water upon arrival and request.  Room was spotless and all the staff was very kind and helpful.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We visited in early July 2017 with 2 young elementary age kids.  It is a nice hotel situated on an odd corner of merging highways - across from the beach.  It has a nice view of the beach and you can walk there from the hotel... it is not a super easy walk with all your gear but it is not bad.  The guys working the valet are always so helpful and told us about beach items to use for free from the hotel - they have boogie boards, surf boards, chair, umbrellas, sand toys - you name it.  That is a great perk for visitor at the hotel.    We are diamond members and have stayed and Hilton brand hotels all over the world.  The service, other than the valet, was really poor.  There are really no significant perks for diamond members other than free breakfast for 3 mornings.  You are not
Manager Response: We appreciate your comments and understand your frustration.  Yes, there was a fire that did cause damage to the restaurant and affected the morning of July 10th and apologize you were inconvenienced.  We did our best to provide shade, water, and food items for those that were effected in the evacuation area throughout the emergency.  Since the fire we have reviewed our emergency plan and have made changes to ensure that we are providing the best possible service to our guests.  I will pass along you positive comments to the valet team.  Thank you for your loyalty and business as a Diamond member.  If you would like to discuss further please feel free to contact me at 949.234.4500.  Sincerely, Bill Reider General Manager

Summary: The hotel was remodeled.  The location of the hotel is awkward because it is on a loop. No cookie was given at this location and the restaurant located  in the hotel was closed. No microwave given. For the rate they charge, you get an ocean view but you need to overlook the RV 's camped on the other side of the beach area.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had an ocean view suite with a small patio that had no view because of big palm trees. Room had a sectional couch, decent sized and upgraded bathroom and 2 tvs. The room was nice.   The pool was tiny. And it got lots of afternoon shadows. Not the best for sun tanning or horsing around too much with kids.    Location is the best!  Just 5 minutes and you are on the beautiful Doheny state beach. We rented a trike bike the first night to take there. That thing is heavy!  Major leg burn!!!   The hotel is upgraded. Parking is in lower level garage. Our room wasn't ready in time; almost 2-hours late. They were nice about it but still 2-hours is a long time. Especially because I cashed in my Hilton points to stay here for 2 nights.   The restaurant for breakfast is regular Standard
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nice location walking distance to Doheny beach.
Summary: Older hotel located within walking distance of Doheny beach.  First night was disappointing but staff moved us to a more suitable room the next day.  Stay was good after that.  Request a room away from highway 5 if you are sensitive to road noise.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was a very nice hotel with super close beach access in a beautiful spot.  Staff was very nice and the manager was great.We got the fourth floor, which I understand was the first one most recently renovated and it was very nice.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Wonderful location, thumbs down to everything else
Summary: Where do I start...on our drive out received a voicemail from the hotel stating that the "restaurant and rooftop bar would be closed" during our stay.  No explanation on the message but I later found out it was due to a fire a day or two prior.  As with all Hilton brands I use their mobile app frequently.  This was a family trip, but I have gotten used to checking in online and selecting a room on their app.   The app allowed me to check into a second floor room on an end away from the lobby elevator. We arrived late put our stuff in the room, which had the sliding door open bringing in a nice coastal breeze.  We returned late and went straight to bed.  After a couple hours of sleep I realized the AC was not working in this room and perhaps that is why they had left the deck
Manager Response: I appreciate your feedback on your stay.  I know the fire caused an inconvenience to you and other guests of the hotel.  It caused damage to electrical system and was repaired as quickly as possible.  We tried our best to accommodate all the guests that were effected by the fire and apologize we did not meet your expectations.  I am glad to here you were compensated as you deserved to be.  We have reviewed the emergency plan and have made changes to ensure that all guests are provided with a high level of service.  If you would like to discuss further please feel free to contact me at 949.234.4500.  Sincerely, Bill Reider General Manager

Summary: The overall stay was OK, but there were just too many little things wrong with the room(s) to be satisfied.  A fire in the restaurant was an inconvenience because I had to change rooms, but that is not the fault of the restaurant.  Unfortunately, both rooms had issues.
Manager Response: Thank you for the feedback and apologize we did not meet your expectations during your stay.  Although there was a fire you should still expect a high level of service.  I have met with the team to ensure that we are providing the best service possible.  If you would like to discuss further please feel free to contact me.  Sincerely, Bill Reider General Manager

Summary: If I wrote this review on day one of my visit, it would be glowing.  But since I was there for five days, I had mixed experiences.  The location is odd, but great for folks interested in visiting the beach.  It is across the street and a very short walk.  If this is why you are visiting, you hit a home run on location.  The hotel restaurant was great for breakfast.  Food and options were plentiful and good. The staff was professional and pleasant.  The hotel top floor bar was also great.  The view is awesome and the service was fine.    Unfortunately, there was a fire on the second day of my visit and the restaurant and bar were closed.  So I had no reason to do much but sleep and leave each day.  The staff was efficient and professional.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Beautiful Location but Painful to Stay.
Summary: Great location, the rooms are small, they charge you for $25 parking per vehicle, per night.  Don't pre-book your room, you will over pay instead calling the hotel for open rooms at a discount rate.  This hotel is way over priced for what you are getting in return.  Side note, all the food ordered for room service and the restaurants was surprisingly good.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great room, very clean and spacious for a family of four.  Good breakfast with very helpful restaurant staff.  Rooftop bar/restaurant was awesome with great views.  We found another back side area we brought our children to run around and bring our own snacks after a day at the beach/pool.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This place gets it. Everything was as good as it gets. When we left the hotel for the beach the employees said see you later and when coming back they said welcome back. It made us feel completely welcome
Manager Response: none

Summary: The room worked for us, there were some check in issues and cleanliness issues.  I would stay again but I would be a bit more forceful and request an inspection.  If you are expecting things to look like the photos on the website they are nothing like them.  In the photos everything looks brand new and this hotel is well loved.  It is not horrible it is just not like the photos.  The staff that clean the rooms are very nice.  The check in is not consistent and needs to be worked on.  I would have someone walk up with me and inspect and wait for someone to take care of the issues before I accepted the room keys.
Manager Response: Thank you for providing us with your feedback.  All of the photos you see on the website were updated this year and apologize you were not satisfied.  We would be happy to assist anyone wanting to inspect a room prior to check-in.  I have spoken with the Front Office team to ensure that they are providing guests with a high level of service.  If you would like to discuss further please feel free to contact me at 949.234.4500.  Sincerely, Bill Reider General Manager

Summary: When I reserved the room online was told it was a separate bed room suite but on arrival was given a studio type room  I snore ad and my wife can not sleep in the same room with me.  The front desk said the manager would contact me to settle the problem but he never showed up. The hotel had a partial restoration but the major things like lavs, tubs and especially the old worn out patio doors were not changed.
Manager Response: I appreciate your feedback about your stay.  I apologize that your were given incorrect information and the room you had did not have a separate room.  I have spoken with our Engineering team to ensure that they are providing preventive maintenance in each guest room.  If you would like to discuss further please contact me at 949.245.4500.  Sincerely, Bill Reider General Manager

Summary: Location against the freeway not ideal for noise.  Ocean views obscured.  Issues with bathrooms (leaks, toilet constantly running, drains backed up).  A/c issues.  Valet service was worth the extra and the valets are great.  They seemed a bit stretched thin, but were the best part of this trip.  Small pool.  Bar upstairs good, breakfast good.  The hotel Needs a renovation and update because the price / value ratio is low.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to comment about your recent stay. I apologize for the issues with your room and appreciate you bringing them to our attention. While we do have an ongoing preventive maintenance program at the hotel we obviously have some work that was not completed here. On the bright side. I was happy to read  your comments on the valet team, Longboard Rooftop Lounge and Breakfast. We will continue working on improvements and hope to see you again in the future.   All the Best  Bill Reider General Manager 949-234-4500

Summary Heading: Nice hotel very close to the beach
Summary: This hotel although not the biggest is a very nice property across from the beach. The rooms are nice,and rooftop bar is a nice touch.  It is conveniently located to many destinations in the area. Our room was a mini suite, with 2 televisions and a sitting area that converted into a couch. The bathroom is small but everything was very clean and thought out well.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Doheny Beach is literally across the street and access on foot is assisted by a crosswalk with signal light. Very quiet rooms even when people are having fun on the fourth floor patio. Spacious bathroom. Our room also had a deep tub with a handheld shower attachment. Beautiful rooms done in a surfing motif to support your "at the beach" attitude. Valet park! It's the same price as self park so save some steps. Staff is very friendly and helpful. They have handicap assisted rooms and a lift to help disabled people into the pool. We will stay again because it's good value for the money.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The location was great. The hotel is very nice. However the check-in process needs to be better. Also room cleaning needs the be tracked better. Also the balcony is part of the room and not ignored in the cleaning process.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Was excited to go on vacation with my family, only to be disappointed by this property.  Bathroom doors were broken, internet weak, and loud an noisy guest.  Also hotel rooftop bar was extremely slow, food was served cold and over cooked.  Not enough staff to meet the demands.  Even staff complained that the kitchen was backed up over an hour and they did not have a large enough kitchen to support the hotel guests.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback and it is appreciated.  I take all of your concerns seriously and apologize you did not have a good stay with us.  I have spoken with the F&B team about the lack of service provided and expressed my concern.  We want all of our guests to have a good time during their stay and if other guests are being disruptive we politely request that they be considerate of others and if they are not are asked to leave the property.  We failed to act in a timewly manner and will be reviewing wit the team to avoid this in the future.  Please contact me if you would like to discuss further.  949.234.4500.  Sincerely, Bill Reider General Manager

Summary: This hotel is in a great location and was affordable; right across the street from Doheny St. Beach.  Plus the outdoor bar has a great view of the ocean.  The bar at this hotel is perfect for Happy Hour and loved their appetizers.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Staff were very friendly and efficient. Great room. No complaints. Had problem with room service but it was immediately resolved to my satisfaction. Great rooftop bar. Will definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I attended a clergy gathering in this hotel. Wonderful staff, keen and accommodating . Wonderful location and accessible to many natural and touristic scenes. We enjoyed our stay. And enjoyed the vicinity around. Looking forward to come back again .
Manager Response: none

Summary: Beds are ridiculously small. Check in staff poorly prepared. Poolside rooms awakened by staff moving tables and chairs at 7 am Farther's Day morning. Digital check in did not work. Did not get into my room until 2 hours after confirmed check in.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments.  We certainly failed in providing the service you deserved.  There is no excuse.  I have met the team to discuss your stay and are working with them to ensure that these items are addressed in the future.  If you would like to discuss further I can be reached at 949.234.4500.  Sincerely, Bill Reider General Manager

Summary: My biggest beef with this hotel is that they charge hotel guests $25 to park in the parking garage. Additionally, the check-in and check-out process are frustrating because there's no place to pull your car up to the door for loading and unloading. Expect to walk a long distance between your car, the front desk, and your room.   Also, for the price of the hotel, I expect more. The room had double beds. The Internet was slow. The pool was small and unimpressive. Our ocean view was blocked by a tree. Somebody left a towel hanging from a lamp in our room, which was there from the minute we checked in until the minute we left. The shower squirted water at the ceiling. The bathroom door was difficult to operate.
Manager Response: I appreciate your comments and apologize we did not provide with great customer service.  The Housekeeping team was notified about your comment and are in the process of a new training program to ensure this will not happen in the future.  If you would like to discuss further please feel free to contact me at 949.234.4500.  Sincerely, Bill Reider General Manager

Summary: Hotel is good and the staff is excellent. Disappointed in sleep quality as there is a lot of road traffic in the area as well as a train that runs right by the hotel. Beach access was good. Hotel had a convention with lots of little kids so glad they accommodated us in a room away from the main area. Cannot say enough good things about their staff who really enhanced our stay at this hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We went on motorcycle ride to get out of the heat inland and had lunch in Dana Point then decided to spend the night. Checked my Hilton Honors and discovered this gem and made reservations. The great experience started right away with the valet escorting us to a spot next to the elevator and from there it just got better. The hotel is right across the street from the waterfront State Park with clean facilities and outdoor showers, so very family friendly.  Our room was on the fourth floor near the bar/restaurant which made it easy for evening cocktails and tasty comfort food. Guys you might not want to tell your wife that there is a very nice outlet mall near by, was the most expensive part of the trip !
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Our first time to the Pacific
Summary: We were looking for something affordable near the beach for one night. The view was decent  The rooms were different. Definitely not Hilton like. They were clean and quiet. We had the double double. They are not queen beds but the old doubles. There is a living room area. Two TVs in a smallish space. The bathroom is small with the barn door style door. Our tub didn't drain properly so you stood in water while showering. The shower thing was broken when you turned on the water the shower automatically hit you in the face- cold. We made do. To access the beach you had to cross the street and then go down the beach to the park. Nice area. Lots of surfers. There is a $25 a night to park. I think should be forgone to Hilton honors members. Clean and quiet and some what quirky. Don't
Manager Response: none

Summary: Perfect getaway!  Just across the street from beach access or right down the road from more beaches and shopping.  If you need anything for our beach visit they probably have it available as well!  Fun time!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Very Nice stay the room and hotel was very nice clean. Staff were very helpful and accommodating. I would stay there again when in the area for business or leisure. Close to nice  restaurants. Parking attendants were helpful with directions and local services.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The staff was excellent (especially Carlos at front desk and the 2 gentlemen who valet your car). The roof top decks are very nice. Rooms were comfortable and luxurious. Location was conveniently located to the ocean and to bike trails.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Friendly helpful staff. Banquet food and service was exceptional. Would definitely stay here again. Very close to the beach and plenty of restaurants and food nearby. Pay extra to get the beach view!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We were so looking forward to our stay at Doubletree Suites-Doheney Beach as we had stayed here 14 years ago for the night of our wedding reception. Upon first look, wow it has been remodeled.  But then downhill- ac didn't work, glass shower door not operable, no soap and our view was a wall.  The next morning a roach was found in the bathroom. The front desk was understaffed-only 1 person and took quite awhile to check in. Bathroom was tiny and had toothpaste from the previous guests on wall and floor.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great place to stay for beach access. Clean, basic suite-style rooms. Quite self-contained, very good food served at the roof terrace bar. Confusing hotel room plan so don't trust the hotel map on the Hilton website for choosing your room. If you need quiet, not sure this is the place.
Manager Response: none

Summary: If you're a Hilton or Hampton veteran guest, might want to look elsewhere? More like a Days Inn stay. There appears to be a void between brand standards and actual product and service delivery. Maybe a team in transition? Very hard to get into the parking lot from street due to confusing entry from one way street. No valet or luggage assistance available 24 hours. No acknowledgement if you're an HHonors member.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is a nice hotel with suites for rooms.  The ocean views are much better than the regular rooms.  We had an ocean view, but our brother-in-law had a regular room with a view of the freeway.  Don't get a regular room here.  The rooms are nice size because they are all suites, but the bathrooms are very small.  It looks like this hotel was built back in the 60's or 70's.  It is very clean and the 4th floor open air bar is nice with a great view of the ocean.  Be aware, this hotel is not on the beach.  You have to walk across the street and then negotiate an RV park to get to the beach.  It is in a very strange location and kind of hard to access, but that being said there is very little traffic in front of the hotel.  The regular rooms are noisy because of the freeway traffic
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Pleasant staff, could use more attn to detail with housekeeping, not as close to the beach as pictures appear
Summary: The cookies at arrival & departure are delicious! The staff were very nice& helpful.  The cleanliness needs improvement.  The train track & camp ground is right by hotel.  Within walking distance to beach.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Beds are old and service mediocre. For the price they don't include breakfast or shuttle to main shopping Street. Rooms too small, no refrigerator, no input for TV to plug computer, overall not organized well and guest is not Priority.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Nice location across the street from the beach.  Friendly staff and clean rooms.  The Hilton Honors Diamond Breakfast was outstanding.  Parking on site was simple as well.  Bike & surfboard rentals were available from the valet attendant.  Sunset on the roof at the hotel bar was cool...views of the ocean and a nice fire pit.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nice get away right across from the beach
Summary: Lovely hotel, great atmosphere love the view and cocktails at The Longboard Bar. The staff is very helpful and willing to go the extra mile to make sure we had everything we needed. A little confusing to drive in and out of but good location.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We are Hilton HHonors members and have stayed at this hotel many times over the years when we come home to visit.  Clearly it has gone down hill as suggested by other reviewers because we did not receive housekeeping for two days. When they finally did come, it was cleaned poor at best -- no towels or shampoo, trash wasn't emptied, etc. To make matters worse, the front desk staff could have cared less and did little to make it right.   Will never stay here again!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: a must for Doheny Blues Fest
Summary: Very short walk to Doheny State Park and thus the Blues Fest. Staff are polite and friendly. We got a last minute room and missed out on oceanview but it was comfortable huge king bed. The restaurant is open late. There is a place upstairs to sit and a nice bar lounge but we did not get to enjoy either because we were gone all day. They were kind enough to store our bags early morning though when we returned we were surprised to find we were not checked in yet even though they took our info in the morning when we left for the concert. We understood rooms were not ready that early but we thought they would assign one as soon as available but we had to do so at night after the concert.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Wow $25 a night to park (they gotcha-there is no other place you can park).  $20 per person breakfast buffet.  The food was ok, and it was sure packed with guests but expensive in my opinion.  Remodeled room was not thought out; pretty but not functional.  On a positive: great staff, clean room, centrally located.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel has been "redecorated", but not remodeled.  The rooms are small, the bathroom extremely tiny, it's very noisy, the door into our room fit so poorly that light leaked in from one corner all night long and the mattress on the bed was totally worn out.  Having said this the staff was wonderful and the restaurant that is attached had a very nice breakfast.  We were with a large wedding group and to a person everyone hated this hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The location of the hotel from the freeway led us to feel nervous!  Once we entered the hotel, staff greeted us an eased our nerves.  The valet crew is on it!  Want to know where to eat, or go play- those guys have it!  The rooms are comfortable and very clean.  The morning restaurant staff is pretty slow- but kind, so patients is key.  The best beach in the area is literally across the street, where you can rent bikes, surf boards, boogie boards, umbrellas and chairs.  We would highly suggest this hotel to anyone heading to Dana Point area!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We've stayed here twice, with little dogs.  Lots of places to walk them, and hotel is very dog-friendly.  it's walking distance to a beautiful, sandy beach, and ocean views from some of the rooms.  Bed was amazing! Nice suite area, and our room had a huge patio.  Very clean, and very gracious staff.  We are Hilton Honors members, so the room was purchased with points -- worth every point!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Didn't know it was the Doheny Blues Festival when booking a Girls Getaway, but we got a great room and the best service ever despite the influx of guests. Nice room and view from the balcony. Outstanding housekeeping. The Longboard Rooftop Lounge with sunset and ocean views and outdoor firepits in the tables--wow! So fun and festive and charming. And right across the street is the Doheny Beach and Dana Point Harbor...both sensational for walks and a long day with beach chairs and a picnic, all with no need for parking. The onsite restaurant has good food, a good bar and EXCELLENT service in Jacqueline and Gloria. Wow, they both are gifted at service, making guests feel welcome and taken care of, they both have genuine, engaging smiles, and both have warm, caring natures. The
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Loved every minute of my stay!
Summary: Everything was perfect from the property to the staff.   The room was comfortable and the staff was welcoming and responsive.  The breakfast was exceptional with a nice variety of options to choose from.  Cannot wait to come back!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great rooms, friendly staff. The breakfast at the restaurant is very good. The view of the ocean from our room was beautiful. There are great restaurants near the hotel and the valets are so helpful in directing how to get there the easiest way.  Stayed there twice now. Will go there again
Manager Response: none

Summary: My family LOVES this beautiful hotel. It's our favorite part of visiting California. The hotel itself is gorgeous AND it's right across the street from Doheney. It's like a dream. We can't wait to visit again!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Place was great for a family, but also could be a nice couple get away. The location is good, but not great. Not too much to walk to other than the beach, Zack's Surf Shop and a Denny's. It was easy to drive to San Juan Capistrano or San Clemente though. Perfect for a 1 or 2 night stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nice break from the stresses of life
Summary: We came into town for my aunt's funeral service.  I never told the hotel staff about the reason for our trip, but they were as kind and compassionate as is humanly possible.  They gave us the space we needed to decompress from everything.  We used to live in San Clemente a long time ago, so hearing the fog horn was super cool and nostalgic.  Thank you to the crew at DoubleTree Doheny Beach!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I've stayed here a few times and done multiple meetings, but this past stay was certainly my best. The staff remembered me and were so friendly and accommodating. Because of my gold status I was upgraded to a nice room with partial ocean view. Rooms have been updated with a fun and modern surf aesthetic. There is a nice little restaurant near the lobby with simple food but nice staff. Jacqueline was super!  The fourth floor has a fun bar with great views. Overall a wonderful stay with great service!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Beautiful room and view. Can't​wait for the rest of the weekend. Great service at check in. We are having a blast in this area. There is a lot to do around here. Highly recommend this hotel for the location.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Disappointed in the service! Hotel just ok !
Summary: As a HILTON Honors diamond member I have come to appreciate and respect the treatment we receive when traveling. This hotel however had very rude desk employees, we had to move rooms because the 1st one smelled of smoke and the second had bugs all over the balcony which made it unusable. The rooftop bar had a great atmosphere but was a mess with stained and dirty furniture. Very Disappointed to say the least. We won't be returning here if management/ ownership does not make changes ! SAD because this could actually be a very nice place !
Manager Response: Good morning Peter W. First of all I want to thank you for loyalty to the Hilton Brand and at same time apologize for the condition of the facility and treatment by our staff.
