I would greatly appreciate a chance to talk to you personally in order to get more details about your recent stay and am leaving my contact information below. I appreciate you bringing these issues to my attention and look forward to discussing further in order to make up for letting you down. Thank you.  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Doheny Beach - Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com

Summary Heading: overcharged, horrible services, lied to us about late checkout. rude front desk staff.
Summary: I booked 2 nights at this hotel because I was getting married close by. I made the reservation over the phone, and they gave me a "great rate!" The man who helped me gave me a confirmation number and said I'd be charged upon checkin. Turns out, he LIED ABOUT THE RATE. Rather than $130 dollars for Friday and $180 for Saturday (I upgraded our room for the wedding night), it was $240 and $285. And there's "nothing they can do to change it." I plan on contesting with my credit card company.  But there's more. The week before my wedding I called and asked about late checkout for both days. On Saturday, I explained, my bridesmaids and I would be getting ready in the room and wanted an extra hour, and on Sunday, I wanted to have breakfast in bed with my new husband and have a leisurely
Manager Response: Good morning Liz, it was good talking yesterday. I want to congratulate you and your husband on your recent marriage and at the same time apologize for all of the issues that you mention above that did not go according to plan.  I take your comments very seriously and will get to the bottom of the rate confusion as well as the service issues immediately and as promised, contact you next week to resolve. Thank you for reaching out to me and look forward to talking again soon. All the Best!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree by Hilton Doheny Beach-Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com

Summary: I really enjoyed this property, and the beach location made a great backdrop. The outside is well groomed and beach-like. I was pleasantly surprised to see the underground parking and easy access to the lobby. Inside, there are both elevators and lobby accessible stairs. The decore was modern and spacious. My room had a nice slider door and balcony, which made a nice place to sit in the evenings. Past the campground across the stereotype is the beach. Close enough to see, too far to hear the waves. The bed was average. It is a suite? Looks like the just put a partial wall down the middle of a normal room. But admittedly it was a comfortable room. The only challenges was the property is on a one-way street and a bit of a pain to get in and out of. Regardless, I will return to
Manager Response: none

Summary: The Hotel has a great curb appeal beautiful Lobby. But lacks the amenities once you check in. Possibly a Jacuzzi would be suitable since its located in ocean front. Hotel needs some interior inspections since I found mold in my room.The mattress is not comfortable at all I tossed all nite so did my husband.  The A/C units do not work as strong as the hallways or conference rooms.
Manager Response: Thank you for recent stay with us and comments about the beautiful lobby and curb appeal. I apologize for the condition of you bathroom and we will have our team locate this room and address immediately. If I can be of any further assistance please feel free to contact me directly.   All the Best!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Doheny Beach - Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com

Summary Heading: Tired of employees passing the buck.
Summary: For starters, all GPS devices map you to a dropoff point on the highway that doesn't exist. You'd literally have to jump off of the side of the freeway to get to the hotel if you followed Google Maps or Waze. Front desk lost our first credit card authorization, then told us they had the second form and would process a credit. Two weeks later and four phone calls later, nothing but voicemails unreturned no credit. Dinner was not that good in their only restaurant, upstairs bar was closed. If you wanna eat, you'll need to leave. Phone in the room also didn't work. Spend your money elsewhere and save yourself the headache.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments and I apologize for the Waze and Google Maps confusion. I will work with the Hilton Digital Team to address and have corrected. If you are still having issues with billing please contact me directly so I can help. Again I want to apologize for these issues and let you know that that I am here to help resolve. Thank you!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Doheny Beach-Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com

Summary Heading: Great location and a good price tainted by maintenance lapses
Summary: I brought my family here as we wanted to check out the adjacent Doheny State Beach while still enjoying the comforts that come with a nice hotel stay. I found this DoubleTree to be a recently remodeled hotel with a laid-back beach vibe at an affordable price point for a holiday weekend (Memorial Day 2016). Based on what I observed during this stay, the hotel seems to be popular with families and groups staying in multiple rooms. Depending on your point of view, this may be a positive or a negative, but there were a few too many room doors propped open with coolers and back-and-forth hallway traffic for my taste. Its great location directly across the street from the campground at Doheny State Beach put the beach, picnic areas, and firepits within easy reach. I found it to be a
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to critique your  stay with us last year and glad to hear that you would like to come back in the future. I apologize for the GM who was here last year not getting back to you but if I can be of any assistance in the future please feel free to reach out to me directly using my contact information below. Thank you and hope to see you again soon!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Doheny Beach-Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com

Summary Heading: Great Location, Walking to Beach and Marina, Food & Bar onsite!!
Summary: This is a Great Location in Dana Point for Walking and Biking to Dahoney Beach, Dana Point Marina and other locations like Restaurants, Bars and Pizza.. Hotel has a Bar on the top Floor with Great Views and Drinks, Service could be faster and better!!  Onsite Restaurant on main floor for Food at Breakfast (Omelet) is good. Check on $25/Day parking-could be Free Parking!! Ok on Up-grades for HHilton Diamond!! Could be better!! Refrigerators are Too Cold.. Freeze Beer and Food!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is an older Hotel with small rooms, but everything has been remodeled so no complaints there. The location is fabulous, with an easy walk to the beach. The pool is small and they don't have a spa, but they have a decent workout room. They have a full breakfast menu in addition to a nice breakfast buffet. On the rooftop is an additional restaurant/bar with beautiful ocean views.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed at this hotel as it was recommended based on where I was working for the week.  I loved that it was in walking distance to the beach, had an excellent gym for a hotel and fantastic food!  I hope I have the opportunity to go back.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed at the DT Suites at Dana Point during my May 2016 California coastal road trip.  It was a one night stay, and it was not what I had hoped for.  The hotel has been renovated and the property and rooms look pretty modern. I hoped for a room upgrade as a Hilton Diamond, but was told that the better rooms were all sold out. That was odd since the better room types were all still for sale, but I was told that was overbooking. Fortunately I had booked an ocean front suite, or I guess I would have had an undesirable room (see some of the other reviews.)  My room's air conditioning worked well enough, but was noisy at startup. I reported this to the staff and even sent a video so they could hear the noise, but they didn't seem interested. I finally turned it off and left the
Manager Response: none

Summary: If you want to be by the beach and that is your primary concern, this will serve its purpose.  However, it is old and my room at least in ill repair.  My sink was shattered and the air conditioner worked when it wanted,  When it was trying to work it made loud noises all night.  For breakfast I had scrambled eggs, two pieces of sausage and a glass of cranberry juice: 22 dollars.  If I am going to pay that kind of money, the hotel best be someplace I want to return to..  In my business travels I will never stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I cannot begin to express how poor the service and quality of this property was. As a longtime Hilton honors member we were treated like dirt during our stay here for family reunion and birthday celebrations.
Manager Response: Hello Mr. Norris and glad I was able to reach you by phone earlier this week. I appreciate your business and glad I was able to make up for the short comings that you experienced during your recent stay. Hope to meet you when you come back to visit your daughter in college. Have a great week and All the Best!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Doheny Beach-Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com

Summary: Great location with an ocean view.  The breakfast selection was impressive.  The hotel staff was helpful and friendly.  The only disadvantage is having to cross the street to get to the beach.  Parking is $25/ night.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Check in was fine was explained to me that there was a $25 parking fee was unaware of it so they advise me I would be comped for my three days upon checking out they try to give me somebody else's room service bill and then tried to charge me for the party excellent facility highly recommend it but make sure you get everything in writing up front
Manager Response: Dear Bradley M, I appreciate your comment about "excellent facility highly recommend" and thank you for letting us know about the communication of parking fees. If there is anything else that I may assist you with please feel free to contact me directly. Thank you and wish you all the best!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Doheny Beach-Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com

Summary: Rooms were clean, comfortable and well equipped. Parking was $25 a day...I've been in jacuzzis bigger than their pool...worst internet ever, we couldn't even watch a movie on their own HBO channel...check-in at the hotel, u can't go up the elevator from the parking lot because you have to have a quest key card to access it so u have to walk up the ramp because there were no signs of stairs anywhere. Our room faced the freeway and you could hear it all night!
Manager Response: Dear Norma V, thank you for your comments and appreciate hearing that our rooms were "clean, comfortable and well equipped". Thank you for letting me know about the internet. This is the first that I have heard guests are having trouble streaming but will be looking into this today. If I can be of any further assistance please feel free to contact me directly. Thank you!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Doheny Beach-Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com

Summary: Nice property nestled in a corner between the PCH and off ramp right across from beautiful beach/bay. Great customers service and friendly staff. Comfortable rooms, all suites with sitting area and fridge, most with balconies, many facing the ocean. Rooftop bar a plus, and restaurant on premises. Would go back.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed here for business in April 2017. The hotel is decent, the location is right across the street from Doheny Beach.   The room, a suite, was just okay. There were regular issues keeping the room cool, which for April should not have been an issue. The bed was sufficient, comfortable but on the firm side. The mini fridge barely worked, kept things cool but not cold. The bathroom was small, and need of an upgrade. Overall, the room was just okay.   For an upscale beach area, the hotel was sufficient, but was definitely missing any level of "wow" factor.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Hotel does not advertise that rooms are pet friendly.  Our room had not been cleaned well and it was obvious someone with a pet had been in the room before us.  Staff said the room had been "deep cleaned" yet there was still someone's old food in the fridge.  It took talking with 3 different staff members to finally get someone to move us to a different room.
Manager Response: Dear A Charnow, Thank you for letting me know about your experience during your recent stay and I apologize for the condition of your room and that it took you speaking to 3 different team members to get resolution. I will be reviewing this with our team so that we make sure this does not happen to other guests. If I can be of any further assistance please feel free to contact me directly. Thank you.  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Doheny Beach-Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com

Summary: DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Doheny Beach is a fantastic place to relax. Across the street from world famous Doheny Beach. Surf's up dude. We had a great time. Close to Legoland and Disneyland plus you can walk to the beach or Dana Point Harbor. My 7 tear old had a great time swimming in the pool. We had great breakfast. Our room had a fantastic view. We will return.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great location. Close to EVERYTHING you need. Rather it be a mini weekend getaway or a vacation. Parks with a view (Pines Park) San Clemente Pier. COSTCO! Great staff. Great food. Pet-friendly. Comfy beds. Sofa bed is pretty decent. (Great for littles). Couldn't ask for more.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Thin walls, smelly rooms, staff who don't care about your bad experiences much, and broken AC in the middle of the night....not worth the trouble and irritation. There are other hotels in the area, so I'd check out a different one next time.
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know about your recent experience and I sincerely apologize for the trouble and irritation that we put you through. This should not happen to any guest and I will be looking into your comments directly so that we do not allow this to happen to others in the future. If I can be of any future assistance please feel free to contact me directly. Thank you.  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Doheny Beach-Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com

Summary Heading: In town for the horse show
Summary: My daughter & I recently stayed here again for the Blenheim horse show. We arrived early evening on Thursday & check in was smooth. Sadly, we spend all our time at the horse show, so I cannot speak to extra amenities. With a location directly across the street from the beach, this hotel is ideally suited for families on vacation looking for some sand time. Nearby Restaurants are great. Checkout was simple. Will definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My husband and I stayed at this hotel overnight. We did nothing but sleep and have the buffet breakfast. I would recommend this hotel. Check in was quick, the room was nice and comfy. My only dislike was the bathroom had no counter space for our toiletries. The omelette was pretty good, but the rest of the breakfast buffet was just ok. The taxi ride from the Santa Ana airport was just over $70. We were accidentally charged a $25 parking fee for a car we did not have. The front desk adjusted the fee immediately when we called after check-out and complained.  This hotel was also pet friendly, but very clean. When we left this venue, we went to our conference hotel at the Monarch Beach. That taxi charge was about $15. This is a very nice area and we felt safe the entire time. It
Manager Response: none

Summary: Dirty, Moldy smelling Room with NO AIR CONDITIONING and couldn't care less attitude from hotel and Hilton.  Michael Flowers, Manager, never returned phone calls.  I was told that my credit card for this room would not be run until a reasonable compensation could be worked out, yet it was run 2 hours after checkout while we were on a plane on the way home.  This was a family reunion and we were very disappointed in the room and the hotel's response to the obvious issues.
Manager Response: Thank you for bringing this to my attention and I apologize for the events that occurred during your recent stay with us. I will be discussing the utmost importance and urgency with following up on guests needs with Mr. Flowers. Again, I apologize and If I can be of any future assistance please contact me directly.   Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Doheny Beach-Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com

Summary: Had a great stay here. Room was very clean and staff went above and beyond to be accommodating. The rooftop bar is lovely, definitely recommend checking it out. Rooms were quiet and very comfortable. You do have to pay a daily parking fee.
Manager Response: none

Summary: It was nice, clean, quiet, and convenient for our stay to attend a wedding/weekend in San Juan Capistrano.  All went well.  Room was well maintained, pillows were not stinky, bathroom was well equipped and thought out. On the minus side: No buffet breakfast, not even coffee and a bagel, or at least they did not inform us of any such breakfast...and the car park fee, was steep at $25/night.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel is very nice and the rooms are modern. The bar was recommended at check-in to have a nice view of the sunset, but it didn't. A very nice view of the ocean, but no sunset and the drinks where over-priced as well, their Happy Hour is only Sunday/Monday thru Thursday. The location of the hotel is a little isolated away from shopping and restaurants with most places were a min 10 min walk. FYI: Parking was also $25 per day. Lastly, opt for spending a little more to get a view, otherwise you will be staring at a blank wall from your window.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Second visit to this hotel for work and the room was awful. No AC, light out in the bathroom, and great view of the transient camp outside the room. Reported issues, and staff tried to change the light but it just wasn't happening. Rooms are in need of some remodeling.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Not your standard Doubletree hotel, not sure if it was another chain prior to a Doubletree?   Arrived early, warmly welcomed by reception staff and upgraded to a sea view room.  Room was ok, with a separated seating area, really small balcony with chairs.  The room seemed a bit tired and could do with a refurb.  The rooms are also poorly insulated, we could hear pretty much everything from the guy in the room above our room. Location is handy for the beach.  We walked in to town on the night for dinner.....wouldn't recommend doing this, on,y took 20 minutes but it wasn't well lit and there was one or two dodgy characters knocking about. Used the pool, which is small with a few loungers. Breakfast was ok, although when we arrived (before 9am) a lot of items appeared to need
Manager Response: none

Summary: Hotel is great for my two teenage grandsons who enjoy surfing.  The breakfast buffet was delicious, and the happy hour on the upstairs deck was really great.  Pretty view of the ocean at sunset.  Doheny Beach is nice too in the summer when one can rent bikes there.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Low end, needs work, staff training
Summary: So I booked this hotel for a few days for business, and I actually regretted it.  When I walked in to see if they had a room, (walked in) I was given a price which was the lowest price available. I then showed them the price on hotel tonight, they couldn't meet it, I mean really. So with my iPad I booked it right in front of them.  It went through in about 1 minute, then I was given a room overlooking an alley/ freeway, with sliding doors with so much space in the top, because they didn't close, that theses tiny black bugs took over the room
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments on your recent stay. I apologize that we were unable to match rates. Because of our contract with Hotels Tonight we can not match the rate that they are offering without breaking our agreement with them. I understand the frustration of having gnats in your room due to the gap in the door and is something that I will be addressing with our Director of Engineering. Please feel free to contact me if I can be of further assistance and have a very nice weekend.   Bill Reider General Manager Bill.Reider@Hilton.com

Summary: Yet another great Hilton property. We arrived early and were able to check in well ahead of our scheduled checkin. Our original room ended up with a view of the freeway. But luckily we were able to get a room with a view. The staff from the front desk to the restaurant and housekeeping was great. Overall the room was nice. The beach is right across the hotel. Good place for couples and kids. Thanks again for a great weekend.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I'm a Hilton Honors Gold Member. Did an e-check-in the day before arrival and have an estimated time of arrival. When we arrived our selected room was not ready and we had to wait for it to be cleaned. Desk clerk have us 2 chits for "extras".  When it was finally ready the room was average. Picture a '70s vintage room redone in the '00s but only finishes. The tiny bath had no vanity space and the lighting was dungeon-like. Tested than a shower curtain the shower/tub had a half glass wall and door, making ingress and egress difficult.  The maid tried entering twice after we occupied the room without using the doorbell or knocking.  The desk phone didn't work, which wasn't an issue except to try and pick up messages.  The only decor in the room was 3 prints that were supposed to
Manager Response: none

Summary: Really, you can't get much closers to the beach without having an RV or boat.  This hotel offers a great location as well as access to the beach & Dana Point. Very friendly & helpful staff.  Unfortunately, you do have to pay for parking.
Manager Response: none

Summary: the management staff was great. However the service we received at breakfast and at the bar was Horrible. the employees did not leave us feeling welcome or come across as people who needed to be working in the Hospitality industry. I will not stay at this hotel again. Location and Hotel were beautiful. front desk manager cared and showed concern, however the general manager never made an attempt to contact us after our poor experience
Manager Response: It was good talking over the phone a minute ago and greatly appreciate your feedback. Once again, I apologize for the service issues that you and your family experienced during your reunion visit with family.  I will be discussing this with the Food and Beverage Team for immediate improvements. Thank you for the very kind words about Michael and Scott as I will be certain to share with both of them as this is truly what Hospitality should be. Expect a letter from me shortly and look forward to meeting you personally when you return to the area. All the best!   Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree by Hilton Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary: Our daughter selected this hotel to house her wedding party after being treated rudely at the Dana Pointe Marriott. The wedding venue was close by and the Hilton property appeared to meet most of her criteria for overnight accommodations. Traveling from Oregon, I wasn't exactly sure what to expect. My concerns grew as I worked long distance to organize a welcome reception at the hotel. Very poor communication and extremely overpriced. Upon arrival, and after calling ahead and making the same request to have a room close to our daughter's, they put us in a room that backed to the FREEWAY! You could tell they tried to remodel/upgrade, but the low ceilings and aging building make improvements difficult at best. The location might be good for the beach, but a hike to the town and
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great vibe, friendly staff, amazing location. Rooms are amazing. Food is good. The view is great. Can't wait to go back. I already booked another stay. We stayed here before for our daughter's wedding.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Friendly staff, excellent location. You will love this place, we highly recommend it. You are directly across from the beach and the ocean views from the rooftop bar are excellent. The staff were all exceptionally friendly.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great family friendly, close to the beach
Summary: Great price and location for our family spring break trip. Hotel was clean and accommodating. They had surf boards and beach chairs that we could use. The walk to the beach was so easy and quick! Which isn't always the case with 3 kids!!!  Loved our stay here and would go back in a heartbeat!
Manager Response: none

Summary: My friend and I had so much fun vacationing here. We just did a single night stay, but it was fantastic. We have already started planning a longer visit for next year! We can't wait to come back! The location is walking distance from the beach and marina and the hotel's staff was very helpful! 10/10 would recommend!!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: The rooms are not what we had expected.  The bathroom is small, has no countertop space, and has a sliding barn door which allows no privacy.  We had to ask for more blankets for the fold out couch and they were flimsy.  The gentlemen that parked our car went above and beyond to be helpful as well as the cleaning staff.
Manager Response: Thank you for providing your valuable feedback. I appreciate hearing your kind words about our valet and housekeeping staff and will pass on your kind words on to the team.  I will be using your comments regarding the bathroom design for attention with future renovations. If I can be of any further assistance please feel free to contact me directly. Thank you and wish you All the Best!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree by Hilton Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary: We had a great view. The room was clean, staff was friendly and helpful. The room was a great price for such a great location. Highly recommend!!!  My only complaint would be the door on the restroom. The bathroom light is very bright in the room with a door with opaque glass on it.
Manager Response: none

Summary: It was a fun walk over to Doheny Beach to watch the surfers and paddle boarders.  It was a convenient location to go to other sites.  A ten minute drive to the Harbor area for shopping or dinner.  It was pleasant to receive a bottle of water and a cookie when we left.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great location, if your a surf bum or just a traveler and taken in the sites a great spot to stop. Nice clean hotel,some rooms have a view some not so much. Front desk and hotel staff do a good job. BJ the valet is great! this guy goes all out.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My family and I were in Dana Point for a funeral and made the most of it with dining at the spots that our loved one had visited. All locations were within 10 miles. So the hotel location couldn't have been better. The staff was exceptional and the hotel amenities were great. Clean and comfortable and well appointed.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great room with everything you need! Hotel has great facilities, restaurant, pool, bar and gym.   The hotel looks out onto Doheny Beach for great views and is a short 1-2 minute walk down to the beach.   It is close to the Dana Point harbor/marina, where there is a vantage point accessible by road to offer great views of Dana Point and the marina.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The accommodations were just ok.  The area was excellent.  My biggest issues were: First, i had been hit by some kind of insect that caused moderate to sever welts front he bite.  The staff was helpful in treating my symptons.
Manager Response: Glad to hear that our staff was helpful rendering help and sorry to hear that what ever it was that "hit" you, created a less than enjoyable stay. We pride ourselves on maintaining a clean safe environment for our guests and will research this incident further. If I can assist in any way please feel free to contact me directly. Thank you.  Bill Reider General Manager Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary: This hotel is located in a great location, but you can't put lipstick on a pig...the recently remodeled rooms smell and still feel old.  The lobby had peeling paint falling from the ceiling.  I would not recommend staying here, I don't care if it is across from the beach.
Manager Response: Although you noted that we are located in a great location I am very sorry to hear that you felt our recent renovations did not meet your expectations. The lobby ceiling was damaged by the recent rains in California from the roof top deck. The good news is that the deck has been replaced and the lobby ceiling now dry and repainted. If there is any chance of regaining your business, please feel free to contact me directly any time in the future. Thank you!  Bill Reider General Manager Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary Heading: An older property with distant views of the ocean
Summary: Our room did have a sitting area with a couch and a desk and an area with a king size bed, but they were pets of the same room, not two separate rooms.  The bathroom had some unusual features:  The door to it was a sliding "barn door" and and its inside handle was a recessed area with semi-sharp edges the made it mildly painful to use.  The glass door to the shower - tub combination was constructed in such a way that one had to enter the tub before turning on the water to adjust its temperature.  The counter space was insufficient.  One result was that the Kleenex was hidden on a lower shelf in the bedroom area.  We paid $50 extra for an open view room, but discovered that the view was one of roads and parking lots with the ocean in the distance.
Manager Response: We appreciate your comments and they will greatly help us with planning future renovations. If I can be of any future assistance please feel free to contact me directly. Have a great week and All the Best!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree by Hilton Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary: I had a great view, the room was much bigger than I expected, the short distance to the ocean was a big reason I chose this location, but going forward the Double Tree will be my first choice! I loved every minute of my comfy stay!
Manager Response: Very Happy to hear that you had a great stay and we appreciate your valuable feedback. Please let me know if I can be of any future assistance and we wish you All the Best!   Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree by Hilton Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary: We stayed here for two nights on a little getaway.  The rooms have been updated and we upgraded to a balcony room on the 4th floor.  Nice view!  Room was clean and though a little smaller than most Doubletrees it was comfortable.  Well, except the bathroom - smallest I think I have ever had in a hotel.  Even my husband said something and he never says anything about hotel bathrooms.  If we stay again we will upgrade to one of the rooms that have upgraded bathrooms which are much larger.  Hotel bar was closed during our visit for renovations - they kept changing the opening date on their website.  But once finished it looked like a nice place to enjoy the view and a drink.  We would stay again but would definitely upgrade to a larger bathroom.
Manager Response: Thank you for your business and taking time to review your recent stay with us. The deck renovation is complete and I apologize that we were not open while you were here this visit. If I can be of any assistance with your return visit please feel free to contact me directly. All the best!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree by Hilton Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary: Like the title says. my room had no microwave. The "free" Wi-Fi is only if you are a Hilton member and they expect you to pay 13 bucks a day for it. It's also a fraction of the speed as you mobile data which is terrible. Another problem is the bed had one blanket that doubled as a bedspread. That might not bother most but I feel there should be a blanket with a bedspread on top of it so that the blanket that has been collecting dust all day that you might sit on in your clothes or put a suitcase on for a min isn't the same blanket you will be sleeping with. I find that kinda gross. I asked for a room with a view and was charged $50 more for it and got the same room as the one that was advertised for $50 less. The front desk said the extra cost wasn't a different room but just to
Manager Response: Thank you for providing us feedback on your recent stay.  I sincerely apologize that we did not meet your expectations.  Our room attendants work hard to ensure that the rooms are clean upon guest’s arrival.  I will be speaking with the Housekeeping team to address your concerns about the alarm clock and bedspread   I certainly want to make sure that our guest have an enjoyable experience during their stay.  I’m happy to hear you had a nice view from your patio and enjoyed the two televisions in the room.  I would like the opportunity to discuss further if you would like.  Please feel free to contact me at any time. Thank you!   Bill Reider General Manager Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 949-234-4500

Summary Heading: Great place to stay at in Dana Point
Summary: We met in this hotel for a quick Sunday get-a-way and had a great time. The hotel lobby is very tastefully decorated, staff was very pleasant, valet parking a breeze. Can not speak for room service or other amenities as we did not use them.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to comment on your recent stay. I appreciate hearing that the staff you encountered was "very pleasant" and that valet parking was "a breeze".  We hope to see you again soon you can try out our other amenities!   Surfs Up!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree by Hilton Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary: Excellent staff, especially K from the Philippines at the front-desk, who provided us with an outstanding service. Breakfast was surprising good. Our suite was specious and very comfortable. I'll give them 5 stars when they get an Espresso Machine for cappuccinos etc., and update worn down parts of the hotel. It's also a bit noisy due to proximity of the highway.
Manager Response: Thank you for your business and especially for your comments about your recent stay. The espresso machines are coming soon and we have also recently completed the deck renovations to the roof top lounge. If I can be any help with future bookings please feel free to reach out to me directly. Thank you again and All the Best!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree by Hilton Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary: Great experience! Every store and restaurants were close by with a mile distance. Love how the hotel was right in front of the beach! My girlfriend and I had an amazing stay and would recomend 100% ! The only problem we had was our toilet would make a lot of noise but we closed the restroom door.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to comment and we appreciate knowing about your "Great Experience". We hope to see you again soon and please feel free to reach out to me if I can assist in any way. All the best!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree by Hilton Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary: Wonderful low-key boutique hotel.  It's out of the way but close enough to everything. Perfect for a romantic getaway with the beach across the street, an immense array of restaurants to choose from, and tons of outdoorsy type things to do.  You can rent bikes right on the property.  Some people have complained about the price but if you compare it to elsewhere in SoCal right on the beach, you're paying for location and the size of your room, nothing else.  The train can be a little annoying if you are on the backside and you spend your entire time in your room, but I highly suggest you spring for an ocean view room. Overall, we loved it!
Manager Response: Thank you Michelle, we appreciate you taking time to comment and recognizing what a "wonderful location" we are for that "Romantic Get Away". If there is anything else that we can assist with in the future please feel free to contact me directly. Hope to see you again soon!   Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree by Hilton Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary Heading: I would not stay here again.
Summary: Looked at mixed reviews and stayed here. Very disappointed. Worn rooms but clean. Felt it was overpriced for the quality and felt decidedly unwelcome by the staff. It was difficult to get back out of the location
Manager Response: Thank you for providing us your feedback on your recent stay. I am disappointed to hear we did not meet your expectation. I will be meeting with our team to discuss your comments about how we made you feel  during your visit. As General Manager it is my responsibility to ensure that every guest is greeted with warmth and kindness each and every day and apologize for letting you down. If I can be of any further assistance please feel free to contact me directly. Thank you.  Bill Reider General Manager Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary: Straight to the points: 1.  Very, very good customer service.  Front desk does a great job! 2.  Room was not what I choose using the Hilton app.  BEWARE: some who decides to remain in that room for an extra day gets to keep that room. 3.  Very spacious room for someone like me who travels for a living.  Maybe the best thing about the hotel. 4.  Fitness was good.  Plenty of weights and cardio. 5.  Restaurant.  Breakfast was simply ok.  6.  The hotel is doing some updating.  Not anything that will cause one to lose sleep or hear very loud sounds.  Hopefully they have plans to do the same for the restaurant.
Manager Response: Thank you Ed for your business and for taking time to comment on your recent stay. Great hearing that you enjoyed the spacious rooms, fitness center and staff. We are about to roll out new Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner menus shortly and this will help especially with the breakfast offerings. Thank you again and wish you all the best!   Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree by Hilton Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary: They didn't seem to care about us the customer or our experience.  We were put in the farthest room away, not offered the option to upgrade to a view room even though the hotel was virtually empty, no complimentary coffee service in the morning, no "hope you had a nice stay" at the end and basically a pretty disappointing stay.
Manager Response: I appreciate your feedback and am very sorry to hear that the experience was unacceptable. I will be sharing your comments with the team as this is not how guests should be treated. I apologize that you did not receive an upgrade or coffee. If you would like to discuss your stay with me in more detail I would be grateful.  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree Suites Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary: Nice stay. I love the location. Did not bother to ask for an Ocean View and it was fine. Easy check in and was surprised that in addition to our cookies we were give a nice lemonade to take to our room.
Manager Response: Nothing better than Lemonade and a great DoubleTree warm chocolate chip cookie!  Thank you for your business and hope to see you again soon.  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree Suites Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary: This was such a great, convenient hotel.  Right near the beach, the rooms were clean, the staff was incredibly helpful and everything was just easy - from the USB port in the wall next to the bed all the way to the wash cloth actually in the shower.  Highly recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: So happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay in Dana Point. We pride ourselves on making every stay for every guest a memorable one. We appreciate your business and hope to see you again!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree Suites Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary Heading: A word for Paradise that starts with D.
Summary: This Doubletree at Dana Point is the crown in the chain of Doubletree hotels.  The view and the closeness to the Pacific are an absolute dream.  The rooms are quite nice, but I preferred the actual 2 room suites you used to have there.  It's location is lovely, the rooms are quiet and the fact that it's hard to find only lends to it's charm.  Great place to go with your sweetie and an even better place to go by yourself to think and just be!
Manager Response: I'm so glad to hear you had such a great stay with us. It makes us all feel good to hear about how special a location this is and we are fortunate to call it home away from home. We look forward to seeing you again soon to enjoy the fabulous location here in Dana Point!   Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree Suites Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary: Unless you want to be conviently close to doheney it's not worth coming unless you just need a place to stay... no views... expensive overnight parking (25 bucks a night) even for honors members. There's a highway between the beach and the hotel so very limited views from the lobby and restaurant... lounge chairs by the pool are super awkward and you can't lay on your stomach... rooms and beds are nice however... really enjoyed the bedding and very clean. Staff was ok, but seemed to be lost when I asked questions and just made stuff up that later I found out was not the case... wasted money asking people questions that they didn't know the answers to (like parking I was told was free over the phone) breakfast buffet is not always offered apparently.., this was a Saturday
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to comment on your recent stay and I apologize that we did not meet your expectations. I am happy to hear about the cleanliness of your room and comfortable bedding. We pride ourselves on giving guests a valued experience and will use your feedback to improve on the above mentioned concerns. Thank you very much and please feel free to contact me if I can be of any future assistance.   Bill Reider General Manager Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary: Beautiful hotel! Will be returning back soon! Room 204 is great the decorations are great and modern! The digital key feature is excellent! Definitely a great choice when looking for a "beach" feel hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for providing us with your feedback and appreciate your business. Glad to hear that Digital Key was such a hit and enjoyed the newly renovated hotel. Surfs up so come back soon. All the best!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree Suites Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary: Hilton Honors app. gave us through digital check-in, a room in back of hotel without a view, but the gracious staff offered us an upgrade along with our friends who were also staying at the hotel. Great front office staff!!
Manager Response: Thank you for providing us with your feedback and appreciate your business. I will pass on your kind words to the team and hope to see you again soon!   Surfs Up  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com  310-420-0146

Summary: I booked two rooms in September. When we checked in it was suppose to be a balcon room with ocean view but it was a room with no balcony over looking the alley behind the building, we were told they had nothing left to move us to.Then we didn't get room service,said they don't know why so we went down and got clean towels. When I got my credit card bill I was over charged 374 dollars by the hotel. I started calling the first of October to get it fixed and no one would call back. I left a message for the manager, no call. I calledHilton corp and was told they would call back by 72 hours, no call. Then I can't get Hilton points because I booked online. Finally tonight, December, they call and see they screwed up and are going to fix the over charge. After two months I should at
Manager Response: I want to apologize for the billing and service issues during your stay in September as well as the time that it took us to finally get everything straightened out. After researching I am happy to see that Hilton has issued you a Be My Guest Certificate for this incident. I want to thank you for bringing this to my attention and if for any reason you have not received this compensation certificate by now please feel free to contact me directly so I can help. Thank you.  Bill Reider General Manager Bill.Reider@Hilton.com

Summary: I love their cookies!!!!!  Great room at great property.  Highly recommend this place.  Beach/Surfer theme and very clean. So, they say I have to say more.  The picture in the lobby is very special.  To the naked eye, NOTHING.  Just a design of post-its or paint swatches.  Through the lens of my iPhone, just looking at it, turns it into a picture of .... (you have to see it for yourself)  AMAZING and fun
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking time to comment on your recent stay and recommending us to others! Glad you were able to experience the very special picture behind the front desk only  seen through the lens of your phone. Pretty cool! Hope to see you again soon!  Surfs Up!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree by Hilton Doheny Beach - Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary: Enjoyed the facility and staff was extremely friendly!  The ocean views were an added bonus.  This was my first time to Dana Point and I thoroughly enjoyed the entire area!  I recommend Coastal Kitchen for dinner!
Manager Response: So glad to hear that you enjoyed everything we have to offer in Dana Point. Thank you for your very kind words about the staff and we hope to see you again very soon. All the Best!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree by Hilton Doheny Beach - Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary Heading: Say NO to Doubletree, Dana Point
Summary: Not a quiet room in the hotel. One side looks over a loud highway, the other over the train tracks- with trains hurling by. $25 day parking for guests.  $$$$ restaurant/bar prices. The front desk could not have been more unhelpful, They suggested a drink on one of their patios, then charged us $100 for 4 drinks, saying it was actually "room service".
Manager Response: I truly apologize for the disappointing experience you received during your stay.  This certainly is not how guests should be treated and does not fall in line with the culture  we have set.  We will be following up with the team to address your concerns and will be reviewing our universal standards of service.  Please feel free to reach out to me to further discuss.  Thank you  Bill Reider General Manager Bill.Reider@Hilton.com

Summary: The hotel's not perfect but I thought it was well worth the cost and we had a very relaxing stay.  There's a public campground between the hotel and the beach but the view is still great and we had a comfortable balcony to look out over the ocean.  Dana Point Harbor is just a few minutes away.  Dinner at the Charthouse and hung out at the harbor having coffee during the day.  Laguna Beach isn't far, either.  Really enjoyed my stay here because of the people like Ingrid and Michael (the Front Office Manager).  We had an issue with a barking dog the first night but just called Ingrid and she and Michael immediately took care of the issue and we didn't hear anything the next two days we were there.  The restaurant is great for breakfast and the lady who served us was very friendly.
Manager Response: So glad to hear that you had a wonderful experience during your recent stay.  We are in a great location with quick access to the beach and walking distance to the harbor.  We are a pet friendly hotel and I’m delighted to hear Ingrid and Michael reacted and resolved the situation you encountered.  I will be sure to share your comments with them.  We look forward to seeing you in the summer when it has warmed up.   All the Best!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree by Hilton Doheny Beach - Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary: Our hotel stay was an amazing experience and the staff was outstanding! The hotel location is ideal and even though the weather wasn't the greatest, it still did not damper our stay. If your looking for a good value and great service than this is the place to stay!
Manager Response: I’m glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay.  Although we recently had some much rain, I am happy that you did not let this ruin your stay.  I will forward your positive comments to the team as I know they will appreciate.  I look forward to seeing you at hotel again in the future.  Surfs Up!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree by Hilton Doheny Beach - Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary: Some facilities not available.  Room decor was nice, but lacked housekeeping.  Did not get towels or coffee, and supplies.  Internet only works if you go downstairs to the lobby.  They do have free WiFi, if you sign up with their website.  Their lounge was closed and we were not able to go upstairs to see the ocean view.  We were told to go across the street, onto the highway to see the sunset.
Manager Response: We appreciate your feedback and take your comments seriously.  Certainly you did not have a good experience and for that I do sincerely apologize.  We did not meet your expectations and rest assured I will be meeting with team to address all of your concerns.  It is unacceptable to be told to go across the street to watch the sunset.  I have spoken with the team about this and made it clear that that is not the correct response and we should be providing options.  Again, thank you for the feedback and if I can be of further assistance please feel free to contact me.  Bill Reider General Manager Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary: Doheny Surf. Breakfast Buffet. They remodeled recently. I always really enjoy their breakfast buffet. Fresh juices good coffee. You can order an omelet and the server will bring it to you. Never crowded. The servers are always really friendly and ready to help. Been here for the breakfast buffet a few times. Had a groupon which makes it a good deal.
Manager Response: Thank you for providing us with positive feedback on your recent stay and especially your experience at Doheny Surf Restaurant.  We pride ourselves on providing a great product and giving our guest a rewarding service experience.  We will pass on your comment to the Culinary and Food and Beverage team as I know they will appreciate it.  We look forward to having you back at the hotel soon.  Surfs Up!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree by Hilton Doheny Beach - Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com

Summary: This is a great option to stay in dana point.  The beach is across the hotel, great just for a stroll and the harbor is only a few blocks from the hotel if you want to whale watch or just take a boat cruise. There are great restaurant along the pch and great for relaxing.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your positive experience on Trip Advisor.  We are glad you had a wonderful stay and look forward to having you back for another great experience.  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree by Hilton Doheny Beach - Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com

Summary Heading: Basic hotel at a great location
Summary: Great location. Walking distance to the beach. Small beds in double bed suites. Small rooms. Hotel allows pets in room. We had a dog barking on and off through on of the nights. Overall good choice for location.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback and apologies for any inconvenience that the barking dog caused.  We are a pet friendly hotel and make every effort to minimize noise and when issues are brought to our attention we address immediately.  Again, we apologize for any inconvenience.  We are lucky to have a location with the beach right across from the hotel.  We look forward to you return visit in the near future.  Bill Reider General Manager Bill.Reider@Hilton.com

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for the money!
Summary: The hotel is located near the beach and within walking distance to the harbor shops and restaurants.  Other than the train and the freeway right behind the hotel- the room was nice, the beds were super comfortable, and we had a great experience there.  Will go back for sure!
Manager Response: We are glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay and the proximity to the beach and local attractions.  We are aware of the train and freeway and are making efforts to help minimize the sound.  Thank you for your comment and look forward to your return.  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree by Hilton Doheny Beach - Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton,com

Summary: They need to step up the so called remodel No Hot tub,No steam room.No Vanity Mirrors in the room...They took all the beautiful art out and replaced it with very cheap decor..The rooms where a bit dirty..They must clean the filters .If you suffer from allergies this is not the place to stay...I have never visited this place and not had rave reviews until now...I hope they fix these issues .The hotel sits on a beautiful non- congested piece of property I hate to see it going down hill...
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback and appreciate your comments.  We apologize for the condition of your room and will be following up with Housekeeping and Engineering to address your concerns.  We are thrilled that you like the location and are working to make sure that all guests have a great stay.  We look forward to seeing you in the future.  Bill Reider General Manager

Summary: The overall was good. However, the Bathroom size and lighting left room for improvement. Some of most professional and courteous staff that we've ever encountered. The restaurant was clean, and the wait staff was also professional and courteous and made us feel welcome indeed.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and taking the time the provide us with your feedback.  We will relay your positive comments of the staff to the restaurant team.  We wish you a Happy New Year.  We looking forward to seeing you again in the future.    Bill Reider General Manager

Summary: Super nice and friendly staff.  We stayed in a beautiful room with sitting area and two TVs.  Would definitely stay at this hotel again.  We had an ocean view and enjoyed the Continental breakfast in the morning.
Manager Response: We are thrilled that you enjoyed our beautiful location and taking the time to provide us with your positive feedback.  Your favorable comments about the team is appreciated and will be shared with them.  Happy New Year!  Bill Reider General Manager

Summary: We have stayed at this hotel several times. It's a great location. Across from Doheny Beach and a short drive to the harbor. San Clemente is an easy drive from this location. The hotel recently has had a beautiful remodel.
Manager Response: We appreciate your kind remarks very much.  Thank you for your continued loyalty and for pointing out the hotel's ideal location and proximity to the beach.  We look forward to seeing  you at the beach again soon!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Doheny Beach - Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary Heading: Lovely hotel. Really enjoyed my stay.
Summary: The staff went over and above to make sure my visit was comfortable. From a friendly and efficient arrival to drinks and dinner at the rooftop lounge to my breakfast and departure, everything was top notch. (Breakfast was especially good. My poached eggs were cooked to perfection.)   The room was clean and comfortable, the shower had great water pressure and the pillows were awesome!!!  The location is a bit tricky to get to, but well marked, so just follow the signs.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your positive comments.  We are very happy that your overall experience, including the room and food, was top notch!  We hope to see you at the beach again in the very near future.  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Doheny Beach - Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary Heading: Poor service noisy bar bad sleep
Summary: Avoid hotel. Open air bars blare music till 10pm disturbing rooms next to it. Staff don't appear to care. Restaurant indifferent - hotel outside Dana point boundary - but close to local park. I asked if music could be stopped no luck.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us.  It is important that all of our guests feel that their concerns are taken seriously so I apologize that you didn't feel the staff addressed your issues.  I have spoken with the team members in the bar regarding the volume of the music.  Please contact me directly with any other concerns that you may have.  Bill Reider General Manager Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary: This hotel was SUPER disappointing. I would say the only thing good about this place was the staff. That is why I gave two stars.  The room I booked was two double beds but they were tiny, The room also smelled like mold. The bathroom was old and disgusting, the tub drain was draining slow so you stand in water while you shower YUCK! When getting ready for bed there was loud music playing, but I confronted the front desk and it was taken care of. Parking per night was $22 PLUS we were charged some kind of "tourist fee" and they didn't tell us about the beach or anything. I would choose another hotel if I ever return here.
Manager Response: I am very happy to hear that the staff provided such good service.  However, I am displeased to hear that you encountered so many issues.  I will address your concerns with our maintenance and housekeeping departments. I will make sure that the front desk staff is diligent in informing our guests about the area around the hotel and what it has to offer.  Please feel free in contacting me directly.  Thank you for taking the time to provide your comments.  Bill Reider General Manager Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary Heading: Hard to get to  this hotel!!!
Summary: The hotel itself is great but parking is expensive and inconvenient... same price for self park and valet !!! The staff is really nice and ready to help... overall it has been a good experience for me and my family!!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review.  We are thrilled that you, and your family, had a good experience.  I will let the staff know that you appreciated their level of service.  We look forward to seeing  you again soon.  Bill Reider General Manager Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary: We expected a Hilton quality hotel but we got a motel 6. Phone did not work. Towels and linen were dirty. Phone was not working. Shower was clogged and water would not drain. Overall a sad experience. Air conditioner was not capable of keeping temperature down.
Manager Response: There is no excuse for the lack of service to your phone, the dirty linens and towels and issues with the shower.  We pride ourselves in providing a clean, comfortable, and functioning rooms.  I apologize that we weren't able to meet these expectations.  If there is any way that we can make this up to  you please contact me directly.  Bill Reider General Manager Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary: Service was average, not including the super stars I have previously mentioned in this survey.  I would not recommend this hotel to a friend or enemy.  Location is awful, homeless people living in the campground across the street.  Not cool.  Parking fee is almost rude.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments.  I apologize that our beach front location was not to your satisfaction.  The hotel is located across the street from Doheny State Park which include a campground which is patrolled by the State Park Rangers 24 hours per day.  Our goal is to make every stay a stellar one and we regret that we weren't able to accomplish this for  you. If I can be of any further assistance please feel free in contacting me.  Bill Reider General Manager Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary: Overall the hotel is a beautiful ocean front hotel.  The dining room offered a delicious, varied breakfast with efficient friendly service.  The room we were offered had the smallest hotel bathroom I have ever experienced.  There is absolutely no counter space around the sink. The glass shower door cracked loudly each time moved. There is a nice desk and chair in the bedroom where I laid out my cosmetics,  but there is no mirror. I did inquire if one was available, but no. After checking out my bill showed a $22.00 parking charge. However,  I never parked a car.
Manager Response: Thank you for informing us of your positive stay despite some of the issues that you encountered.  You have brought up a great point about having the availability of a cosmetic mirror and I will be looking into this option.  If you have not received a credit for the incorrect charge please contact me directly to that I can take care of it for you.  Bill Reider General Manager Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary: These rooms are inconveniently laid out with door to bathroom 2 feet from side of bed. Train runs through the room. Housekeeping was non-existent and when reported nothing is done. Parking overpriced and even as an Honors Member no complimentary breakfast. Parking overpriced.
Manager Response: I regret hearing that your stay was less than satisfactory.  I can understand your frustration when calling for services that are not taken care of.  Rest assured that I take your comments extremely seriously and will be addressing your concerns with the housekeeping team.  As a valued Hhonors member we strive to provide the best service possible and it is clear that, in your case, we failed.  Please feel free in contacting me if I can be of any further assistance.  Thank you.  Bill Reider General Manager Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary Heading: I won't ever stay here again
Summary: Wow...worst Doubletree, no worst Hilton I've ever stayed in. Room was gross and missing TP and towels. No coffee available in the lobby and seeing that the room was so gross there was no way I was using the in room maker. Nice little crack in the sink on top of that. The people were nice at least ... If I wasn't exhausted I would've asked for my money back and found a different hotel. DON'T STAY HERE!
Manager Response: I apologize for the condition of your room and take your comments very seriously.  I am sorry that we were unable to address them while you were here but understand that you were tired and didn't want to report them.  You will, however, be happy to know that we now have coffee in the lobby in the morning.  We do hope that you give us another opportunity in the future.  Please feel free to contact me directly.  Bill Reider General Manager Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary Heading: Great Hotel but they get you on the parking
Summary: It was a surprise to find out they charge for self parking.  That being said, I won't go with this hotel again.  Rooms were clean.  Location is a little loud being at the intersection of two roads.  Short trip to the beach.
Manager Response: Thank you for giving the hotel a 4 star review.  We appreciate your business and look forward to seeing you again at our beach front location.  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Doheny Beach - Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary Heading: Not sure where all the money goes?
Summary: Two friends and I just stayed in this hotel for the weekend for a bridal trip for my friend so she could try on wedding dresses. We drove for 6 hours from Arizona and we were anxious to unpack and relax for a bit in the room before heading across the street to the beach and to eat dinner. Immediately upon walking into the room it smelled strongly of rotten eggs/sulfur, we thought no big deal we just need to open the balcony door and let the room air out. We showered and got ready to go to dinner, one friend wanted to blow dry her hair and the hair dryer was covered in some kind of sticky stuff, we called and asked for a new one, it never came after 20 minutes so we called again and they woman told us it would be right up, still after another 20 minutes no hair dryer so we just
Manager Response: Thank you for your candid review.  Based on your experience I sincerely apologize.  There is no excuse for you being placed in rooms that are not up to our standards and I will address these issues with the staff.  The lack of empathy that you encountered is not acceptable, nor common, for our property.  I take your comments very seriously and assure you that I, personally, will be addressing your concerns.  As you mentioned, the recent, heavy, rains have caused leaks at the hotel. Roofers have been scheduled to determine the cause and solution for the leaking roof.  I would like to discuss this with you further.  Please contact me directly at your convenience. I want to again apologize and look forward to hearing from you. Thank you.  Bill Reider General Manager Direct: 949-234-4500 Cell:  310-420-0146 Bill.Reider@Hilton.com

Summary: For the price this hotel was not worth it.  The furniture in the living room needs updating.  The bed was good, but that 1950's retro aqua blue wool couch was embarrassing.  Also the breakfast was too expensive at $20 for mediocre food.  Although the valet guys were cute and friendly.
Manager Response: Your comments are appreciated and I apologize that you were not satisfied with your stay.  The hotel completed a full renovation earlier this spring and part of the new design is the retro look.  We strive to offer a breakfast menu that has value and we will be discussing your concerns with our culinary team.  We hope that you are able to visit us again soon.  Please feel free to reach out to me with any other concerns.    Bill Reider General Manager Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary Heading: Not a great stay for mant reasons.
Summary: Lets start with the good. Rooms are bright and clean. A nice sitting area in the room. Lobby area is fresh and open. That is pretty much it for the positive. Location not the easiest place to find. Hidden away in Dana Point not in a good spot to shops and pier. No recognition or benefits for being a Diamond  Honors member. Non ocean view rooms face the train tracks!!! Trains rumble by day and night! Three strikes for this hotel
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to comment on your recent stay with us. I am very happy that your guest room and hotel lobby experience was positive and that our recent renovations have hit the spot. As a Diamond Member myself, I appreciate the 250 "My Way" Bonus Points per stay with free breakfast and Wifi.  I too expect to be recognized for my loyalty when I stay and I am very sorry that our staff let you down. I have discussed this with our team so that they are more aware of this importance. You are correct that our standard rooms do face hillside and some are near the Pacific Surfliner Commuter Train tracks that run periodically throughout the day. As a Diamond Member, free upgrades should be offered based upon availability. I apologize that we let you down and please feel free to contact me directly if I can find a way to make up for the experience.   All the best!  Bill Reider  General Manager Bill.Reider@Hilton.Com

Summary Heading: Nasty coffee machines, no doors between rooms in suites
Summary: Beware if you expect to use the "suites" to let kids sleep while the adults stay up. Despite listing the rooms as suites with both a living and bedroom there is no door between the spaces after a recent remodel. The coffee machines spit it black gunk or mold - even after being replaced.
Manager Response: I appreciate you taking the time to share your experience with us.  You are correct that our suites do not have a dividing door.  We strive for transparency and hoped that the photos of our suites would have indicated the lack of a door. I apologize for the lack of clarity and any inconvenience  this might have caused you. There is absolutely no excuse for the issue with the coffee makers and I assure you that I will be looking into this to avoid this from happening again.    Bill Reider General Manager Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary Heading: Accounting, bar and restaurant were terrible!
Summary: Restaurant was super slow. Bartender was super lazy. Multiple random individual charges for the stay made throughout the stay without advance notice, rhyme or reason including one large (Over $700.00) pending charge made after we paid and checked out that took three days to drop off!
Manager Response: Very sorry to read that your stay was less than you deserve. I appreciate the comments and will review the service issues with the Food and Beverage Team. I would like to gather more information from you about your pending charges to find out what happened. I welcome the opportunity to discuss further and please feel free to contact me at Bill.Reider@Hilton.com or call at 310-420-0146.   Thank you and wish you all the best!  Bill Reider General Manager

Summary Heading: Do not leave anything in your room when you check out!
Summary: My daughter and I stayed here for 2 nights when she was moving from Dana Point.  We arrived after 4:00 and our room was not ready.  The lady next to us received vouchers for her inconvenience (her room wasn't ready either) but we didn't because we did not complain about it as she did.  The room we had definitely needed an update.  We were traveling with a small dog so don't know if that affected the room choice they gave us.   The morning after we left, I discovered I had left some of my clothes in one of the drawers in the room.  I called the hotel and told them the exact room and location of the missing clothes.  According to them, nothing was left in the room.  I know it was my fault for not checking the room better when we left but if you stay here, I recommend to really
Manager Response: Thank you for providing us with your honest feedback.  I apologize for the issues that you had during your most recent stay.  I have spoken to our front office team and discussed your concerns.  As a result we have implemented changes to our procedures so that this should not occur again. I'd be happy to follow up with you if your items are still missing.  Please feel free in contacting me directly.  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Doheny Beach - Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary: We never sleep as well away from home. The GOOD rate on sleep quality reflects this rating.  The cookies make that better!  We had breakfast twice and both times the food was good, the fresh salas was fantastic.
Manager Response: I am thrilled to hear about your stay and your good nights sleep. I am passing your positive comments on to the food and beverage team!  Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your experience and look forward to seeing you again in the future.

Summary: Wonderful hotel and even better staff!  We felt like the staff was extremely accommodating and did everything in their power to make sure we had everything we needed.  Also this is a great location.  Great freeway access and a fantastic Ocean view
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to comment on your recent stay with us and we appreciate your wonderful comments about our staff and the location of the hotel. We hope to see you ate the beach again soon!  Surfs Up!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Doheny Beach - Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary: We stayed in an ocean-view suite on the third floor. Our view was excellent and walk to actually get onto Doheny Beach was only around 100-yards.   The location is right at an intersection of CA 1, I-5 and an Amtrak line. Despite that, our room was quiet and comfortable.  The Surfside restaurant was excellent. We are Gold level with HiltonHonors, so we had breakfast included. It was an excellent buffet, including to-order eggs. The wait staff treated me as if I were ordering ala carte. We also had dinner there one night and found the food to be very good.
Manager Response: Greatly appreciate your business and the time that you took to comment on your recent stay with us. Thank you for pointing out just how special of a location this is and hope that you are able to visit us again soon. All the Best!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Doheny Beach - Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary: My entire family and several friends stayed here for a birthday celebration.  We were right across the street from the beach and within walking distance to several restaurants.  The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful.  The rooms and all other amenities were clean and well maintained.  The rooftop bar offers wonderful view of sunsets.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for the kind words about the staff and hotel. We are glad that you were able to enjoy the roof top lounge and beautiful sunsets. Hope to welcome you back in the near future.  Surfs Up!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Doheny Beach - Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary: Horrible ocean view blocked by palm trees.  Dollar value was not there too much money for what was offered.  Bathroom was very very small. Bed was great but just felt we didnt get the value for the buck.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback and I am sorry to hear about your obstructed view by the palm tree and the size of the bathroom. The trees are a very important part of the sustainability of the wildlife in the area. The next time that you stay at the hotel please feel free to contact me ahead of time so that I can personally select a room with a better view for you. I am glad to hear that you did enjoy the bed during your stay. We look forword to seeing you again soon.  Thank you!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree by Hilton Doheny Beach - Dana Point 310-420-0146 Bill.Reider@Hilton.com

Summary Heading: Perfect Orange County location away from some of the crowds
Summary: Double Tree Suites Doheny Beach in Dana Point was a wonderful surprise! The rooms were clean and comfortable. The location across from the campground and the beach was fabulous! The staff really made my extended stay very comfortable. Pamela and Erin at the front desk, Gabriele, Deneese and Lisa in the restaurant always welcoming and the valet team was friendly and quick. Walking to the Dana Point Harbor was easy and enjoyable. You can walk for miles on the beach or on the walking path. If you have a bicycle, I understand you can ride all the way to Camp Pendleton. Coming and going from the hotel sometimes felt like I was going in circles because of it's location, but once the hang of it, it is no big deal. I definitely recommend this hotel!
Manager Response: Thank you very much for providing us feedback on your recent stay. I appreciate hearing your many kind words about the team and will certainly relay your praise to each of them. We are very fortunate to have such wonderful team members that have been at the hotel many years. It is nice to hear that we were able to provide you a great experience away from all of the crowds. We hope to see you again and please feel free to contact me directly if I can be of any assistance. All the best!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree by Hilton Doheny Beach - Dana Point 310-420-0146 Bill.Reider@Hilton.com

Summary Heading: Nice facility but in transistion and a real challenge establishing a wedding room block
Summary: Utilized the DoubleTree for a wedding room block plus a Brunch in mid October. Good news:   used rooftop bar area for brunch-- worked out wonderfully;  Karen and Lucy took good care of us;  food was good; nice buffet and nice area for the morning after wedding buffet;  Nice property with the oceanview rooms having a view across the road to Doherty beach.  Not a lot of shops/eating establishments in walking distance.  Parking was $22/night (whether valet or self park)  Room block Process required significant effort. Were ransition between multiple event coordinators (with things lost in transition) 4 different people between July and October. Should have summarized each conversation with email to ensure consistent understanding over the timeframe. Most of the staff is in
Manager Response: It was a pleasure meeting you in person and we appreciate your honest feedback. I apologize for not getting back to you however my impression was that we had resolved the issues during our meeting . We did share your comments with the team as a means to improve future experiences. I am encouraged that your stay with us turned out to be positive and appreciate the many kind words about the individual team members who took care of  you and your family while you were here. We wish you and your family all the best and hope that you visit us again!   Bill Reider General Manager Bill.Reider@Hilton.com

Summary: Parking $22, Breakfast $19+Tax+Tips Kind of pricy, if you are in a budget, maybe not a good choice.  The location is very close to the beach, 5minites walk, but not many attractions around that you can see
Manager Response: Thank you for providing your feedback and your comments about your your stay.  We pride ourselves on being the best alternative to other resorts in the area. I would like to mention that some of the attractions in the area include whale watching, charter fishing, paddle boarding, jet skiing and surfing as well as a beautifully redeveloped downtown Dana Point with many new restaurants. We are just a short distance from historic San Juan Capistrano Mission and San Clemente with many more restaurants and shopping. If you are ever back in the area please let me know because I would enjoy showing you around the area with many points of interest. I look forward to hearing from you.   Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree by Hilton Doheny Beach - Dana Point 310-420-0146 Bill.Reider@Hilton.com

Summary: The staff were very helpful and happy.  I did have partly used toiletries left in the room from a previous guest which made it seem as though the room may not have been as clean as it looked. Otherwise, the stay was great.  (And only the one set of elevators makes some rooms a long walk to get to)
Manager Response: Thank you for so much for taking the time to provide us with your feedback. I apologize that our housekeeping team did not provide you with a fresh set of toiletries and have spoke to them to ensure that these missteps do not happen in the future. Again, glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay and have shared your feedback about "helpful and happy staff" with our team.
