Please feel free to contact me directly if I can be of any further assistance.   Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree by Hilton Doheny Beach - Dana Point 310-420-0146 Bill.Reider@Hilton.com

Summary: Booked an ocean view room when I arrived the room I pick when checking in online bathroom was dirty with someone's body hair on the floor, was changed to a different room with the view of the camp site across the street Balcony was right in front of a busy street. Not what I paid for.
Manager Response: Thank you for providing us feed back during your recent stay. I understand that checking into a hotel with an unclean bathroom is not the best representation of our hotel and unacceptable. I certainly can understand your frustration and would certainly not want this happening to me. We did not exceed your expectation and would appreciate the opportunity to discuss with you further when you are available. Thank you.  Bill Reider General Manager 310-420-0146

Summary Heading: Across the street from state beach
Summary: This hotel is first class, the rooms are large with a sofa, refrigerator, desk and two televisions. There is a restaurant and roof top bar.  The bar overlooks the ocean and the happy hour specials at sunset are special.  There is a pool but not a jacuzzi, and the weight room superior. The only negative is the high parking fee of $22. A night.
Manager Response: We appreciate your comments and I am glad that you enjoyed our hotel and location. I agree that our roof top bar is a very special place and good to hear that you were able to experience this first hand. Wish you all the best!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree by Hilton Doheny Beach - Dana Point 310-420-0146 Bill.Reider@Hilton.com

Summary Heading: Reasonable hotel but with very poor quality patio doors in the rolm
Summary: Huge gap between the patio doors and frame, meaning all traffic noise flowed straight in to the room all night. I can't really imagine how the hotel has let it remin this bad - surely other people must have complained about it
Manager Response: Thank you for bringing this to my attention and we will make it a priority to locate and fix the issue. I appreciate your business and especially for taking time to let us know where we can do better. If I can be of any further assistance please feel free to contact me directly. Thank you again and wish you all the best!   Bill Reider General Manager Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary: A perfect spot to wind down after driving up the coast from San Diego.  A great Patio with firepit to relax and then kick back in your room or watch the ocean from your own balcony.  Wake up to the sound of the peaceful ocean waves and the swish of the train passing by while the sun shines through the sliding glass doors.  Worth coming back for!
Manager Response: I am so glad that you enjoyed the tranquility of our hotel. Thank you for taking the time to share comments about your recent stay  and hope to see you again soon!   Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree by Hilton Doheny Beach  Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary: Had a business trip here and it was a pleasant place to stay. The hotel was quite spacious, with two double beds and a couch/desk area and a balcony.  The location is interesting; it's kinda right between PCH and train tracks, like it's a little island. This means you have to cross streets to get off the property and it requires a little bit of walking to get anywhere. One of my favorite features of the hotel was the 4th floor bar. The view was great, there was a lovely fire pit and good service.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to comment on the positive virtues of our hotel... we think it's a very special island too! Glad to hear that you enjoyed the 4th floor lounge and it's spectacular views and service. Wish you all the best and hope to see again soon!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree by Hilton Doheny Beach - Dana Point 310-420-0146 Bill.Reider@Hilton.com

Summary: beautiful hotel and remodeled rooms! Service was amazing and hotel is right near beach a short walk! For that reason alone it is all worth it! Many terraces with ocean views and fun restaurant on rooftop, and appetizers at restaurant poke, mussels were absolutely delicious. We will be back for sure great stay. I am a Hilton honors and this is a great property.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback and many kind works about the Hotel, Food and Services. We appreciate your loyalty and look forward to welcoming you back to the beach soon. Surfs Up!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree by Hilton Doheny Beach - Dana Point 310-420-0146 Bill.Reider@Hilton.com

Summary Heading: Cooking smells through hotel. Snouty check in staff
Summary: Looks good from outside But not so good inside.  One front staff seemed offended when we asked to see room.   He walked in front of us way ahead, no conversation etc Also told me they had cheaper rooms-and I felt insulted and wanted to let him know I am a doctor!!!!! Anyway there was strong odor thru halls, room etc and seemed marginal overall for Doubletree
Manager Response: I greatly appreciate your feedback on your recent stay. I am very sorry about the  way you were treated by our team member when showing you rooms and will review your comments with the front office. As the hotel does not have any cooking facilities in the guest rooms I can only assume that the smell of food may have been due to a delivery of a room service meal during your visit. Again I would like to apologize for not meeting your expectations and would like the opportunity to discuss further in an effort to make it night. Please feel free to contact me at your convenience. Thank you.  Bill Reider General Manager 310-420-0146

Summary Heading: Prices are way too high for what you get!
Summary: They are understaffed, over priced and nickel and dime you for everything. The rooms are okay..3 star but you are paying for more than what you bargained for. The restaurant is priced like a 5 star.After you pay for parking and all the add on room service charges you might as well stay at the Ritz Carlton. It is next to a freeway that is loud and for 200 plus a night not a great view! Nothing great about this place!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to review your recent stay and we value your opinion. I apologize that your stay was not to your satisfaction. While we would aspire to be a Ritz, we pride ourselves on providing value to all of our guests. I would appreciate the opportunity to discuss the concerns about your stay further and please feel free to contact me at 310-420-0146. Thank you!  Bill Reider General Manager

Summary: First off the staff was the best part. Everyone we encountered was very friendly and exceptionally helpful. We spoke to the valet for a good 20 min getting recommendations and directions. He even suggested ways that were safer (with sidewalks) to go seeing we had little kids.  Breakfast was included with our stay and they had a nice spread of food. I would not have paid the $19 for it however. But it was tasty and no complaints on the quality. Kids were only $10 which was nice.  The rooms, which I was told were recently all renovated, were a little disappointing. While clean they were getting worn very quickly. Our sink had so many cracks in it and the shower door hinge was broken. They were however spacious and had a nice seating area. There was also a fridge in the room and we
Manager Response: Appreciate your feedback and especially enjoyed hearing that the "staff made it great" during your recent stay. I am sorry to hear about the condition of your sink and shower doors. We have a preventative maintenance program in place for the guest rooms and the items that you have mentioned will be reviewed and addressed with our team to ensure that we do better. Thank you again for your business and especially for taking time to let us know how much you enjoyed your stay. All the best!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree Doheny Beach - Dana Point 310-420-0146 Bill.Reider@Hilton.com

Summary: Very nice hotel, I upgraded my room for an additional cost to a room with a view of the beach/ocean and got a room with a highway view - BIG DIFFERENCE.  Although the room was nice, the bathroom was a bit small and toilet paper roll was literally installed right over the toilet making it hard use the facilities (Rm #429).
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments I apologize that your room assignment was incorrect. I will discuss this lapse with our team to ensure that we do better next time. We greatly appreciate your business and if I can be of any further assistance please feel free to contact me directly. Thank you!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree by Hilton Doheny Beach - Dana Point 310-420-0146 Bill.Reider@Hilton.com

Summary Heading: Meh. Nothing Special, not worth the $$'s
Summary: Great location that no one should pay the premium for a hotel/restaurant that doesn't deliver. Elevators don't work. Internet for $13/day! Ouch. Parking for $20/day. Don't drive there. $2 breakfast food for $20 price. Bring a fan to keep cool. Bring cash, because if the bar gets busy, you can't run a tab or pay with a card.
Manager Response: Hello Robert and thank you for sharing your experience with us. I can understand your frustrations and this is certainly not how I would like to be treated if I were staying at the hotel. I would appreciate the opportunity to speak to you about this in more detail when you get the chance. I look forward to hearing from you.  Bill Reider General Manager 310-420-0146

Summary: Food at the restaurant is pretty good, would absolutely recommend the chicken and quinoa salad, ate it several times, but they really nickel and dime you with room service.    A $34 meal cost us $49, between the delivery fee and the included gratuity.
Manager Response: Good Day Kelsey and thank you for taking time to comment on your recent stay with us. I am sorry that service charges for room service upset your stay and on the other hand I am happy to hear that you enjoyed the food and service. I will review your comments with the food and beverage team. Thank you again and we greatly appreciate your business!  Bill Reider General Manager 310-420-0146 Bill.Reider@Hilton.com

Summary: A recent one week training session led me to a paid stay at the DoubleTree by Hilton Doheny Beach.  Here is a quick breakdown of the main components of this hotel:  LOCATION: The hotel is located off of PCH near the beach.  You must make a U-Turn to access a one way street to enter the property, which takes a little getting used to.    PARKING: Valet and underground self-parking is available.  I had no problems with accessing my vehicle or the elevator.    LOBBY VIBE: Large clear glass doors and windows led to the hotel lobby.  The lobby was painted with mostly whites and blues and had modern furnishings mixed with surf-related decor, which created a modern beachy vibe.  A small pool (did not use) can also be seen from the lobby.     CHECK IN: Check in was fast, easy, and the
Manager Response: Hello Greg and thank you for taking time to review your recent stay with us. I appreciate your attention to details with describing your stay. Glad to hear that you enjoyed the hotel overall and that our Stone Fire Pizza was a big hit! I am sorry to hear about the issues with cleanliness in your room and will be headed over to the morning housekeeping meeting with staff to review your comments with them immediately. If I can ever be any further assistance please feel free to contact me directly. Thank you again and all the best!  Bill Reider DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Doheny Beach - Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.Com 310-420-0146

Summary: I have been at this hotel numerous times for business.  The views are excellent, the hotel is always very clean and the staff couldn't be better.  I love the location with easy access to the beach and walking/riding trails.
Manager Response: Hello Jennifer and thank you for your business and especially nice review of our property and team. We enjoy having you as our guest and I would like very much to meet you on your next visit so please ask for me at the desk if you have the time.  Wish you all the best!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Doheny Beach - Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.Com 310-420-0146

Summary Heading: Fantastic Stay at a great beach Hotel
Summary: Last minute stay at the Doubletree and was I pleasantly surprised!! All of the staff were very helpful and accommodating during my 3 night visit. I want to give a HUGE shout out to Anthony at the front desk. He went above and beyond to listen to my needs and give me the room I was looking for. On top of that he helped me ship a big box home to Michigan for half the price UPS quoted me. I will definitely be staying at the Doubletree from now on thanks to the fantastic service I received from ANTHONY!!! Box arrived in 1 day!  PS Scott at valet was also awesome!
Manager Response: Thank you for you very nice comments Gale and I greatly appreciate you choosing us for your last minute getaway. I will let Anthony and Scott know how much you appreciated their assistance and the great service rendered. Glad to hear that you will be staying at DoubleTree thanks to the "fantastic service received"!  If I can be of any future assistance please feel free to contact me directly. All the best!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree by Hilton Doheny Beach - Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary Heading: Sorry, but what a subpar experiece
Summary: I'm checking out today and this place has left a fairly bitter taste in my mouth. First, I am here on a multi night stay paid for by another company.  When we booked the place, I requested a King room. It was confirmed. Before arriving, I called to reconfirm a King room an it was. When I arrived, we were handled by a man with the Supervisor titled on his badge, I don't remember his name, I don't want to remember his name. His condescending tone was rather upsetting. He acknowledged the Company that paid for the room and subsequently put us in the worst room in the building which also had 2 double beds. I am not stretching this out of proportion. I was irritated, but decided to walk away.  A little while later, I go to use the Internet, I plug my old Hilton number in and nothing.
Manager Response: I apologize for the way that you were treated and want to thank you for bringing this to my attention. There is no excuse and take full responsibility.  I will be looking into this immediately and it would be most helpful if you could call me directly at a time convenient so I can get more information that will assist with my follow up. Again I want to sincerely apologize and hope to hear from you soon. Thank you.   Bill Reider General Manager 310-420-0146 Bill.Reider@Hilton.com

Summary: I stayed for three nights. Check in was smooth, and the staff are very friendly. My third floor ocean view double room had a small balcony, comfortable bedding, a nice-sized sitting area and two televisions, and a refridge and coffee maker. Climate control was very good.   I really liked this property, but the layout of my room was a little odd: when the armoire doors are open, they block the pathway to the other side of the room, because they are very close to the foot of the bed. The bathroom has a sliding door, which doesn't exactly close all the way. It looks like the bathroom was renovated to include a glass panel tub enclosure, which opens out in the bathroom, but prevents you from reaching the towel rack when exiting the tub (plan ahead!) The vessel style sink allows for
Manager Response: none

Summary: Very Good Hotel.  Great cookies.  Pleasant and helpful staff.  Worth the stay, and I would definitely stay again.  Good location and good alternative to the luxury hotels in the area. Only downside is the open patio space adjacent to the 2nd floor rooms.
Manager Response: Thank you for your business Jamelle and for taking the time to comment on your recent stay with us. Glad to hear that our staff was pleasant and helpful and that we are a great alternative to other luxury hotels in the area. Hope to see you again soon and please feel free to contact me directly if I can be of any future assistance. All the best!  Bill Reider Bill.Reider@Hilton.com General Manager  DoubleTree Suites Doheny Beach - Dana Point 310-420-0146

Summary: Horrible room with no view facing the 5 freeway. Asked Front Desk Manager to upgrade and was told I was "out of luck" because I was using a Diamond Resorts International gift presentation certificate. Terrible customer service.
Manager Response: I greatly appreciate you bring this to my attention.  The way you were treated at check in is totally unacceptable and can assure you that I will be addressing with the individual responsible. Again I want to apologize and please feel free to contact me directly if I can be of any further assistance. Thank you.   Bill Reider Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary: I'm a fan of the Hilton hotels, but this hotel is a little overpriced. The valet and checkin process was very good, upon entering our room i soon discovered that floor didn't appear to be vacuumed as there was tooth picks scattered all over the floor (gross). We had a few hours to kill before our dinner reservation so we turned on the TV and was greeted to a poor picture on all channels. Front desk stated that they had a call in to the cable provider, but i would think that they would maybe give a slight discount due to the floor not being cleaned and a poor picture to watch. Overall the place is great, except for the noise of the PCH driving by outside the hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for providing me your feed back about your recent stay with us. I appreciate your kind word about our valet team and will share your positive comments with them today.I am very sorry to hear that your room was not cleaned properly and will be reviewing this with the housekeeping team as this is unacceptable. Thank you again for your business and if I can be of any further assistance please feel free to contact me directly.   Bill Reider Bill.Reider@Hilton.Com  310-420-0146

Summary: This is not the walk across the road to the beach hotel that one might think from looking at the map.  Parking is a bit of a hassle with a garage under the hotel.  There is a 1 way that you have to take to get to hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for your business and I am sorry to hear that the parking and walk to the beach did not meet your expectations. If I can be of any further assistance please feel free to contact me directly. We appreciate your business.   Bill Reider Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary: average experience definitely not worth what we paid. Had problems with our ac unit so we called a few times and after a few hours they were able to come a fix the problem. however it was an extremely warm day and my kids were hot! unlikely to stay again.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to comment about your recent stay with us. I apologize for the trouble with your air conditioning while you were here and want to let you know that we are making significant improvements to the systems hotel wide. We appreciate your business and if I can assist in any way please feel free to contact me directly. Thank you.  Bill Reider General Manager 310-420-0146 Bill.Reider@Hilton.com

Summary: Fairly decent rooms and comfortable beds. The plumbing was horrible. Super slow draining bathtub and sink. The corridors look very old active the carpet inside the room. You could hear everything you could hear people walking upstairs and through the hallways. The bathroom had a weird sliding door that had a gap and you could hear virtually everything the person is doing inside the bathroom. It is a convenient walk to the beach but you have to go through a campsite. Do not eat at the hotel Diner. It was horrible service 40 portions and did I say horrible service? I probably would not stay again
Manager Response: Thank you for providing feedback on your recent stay with us and I apologize that we did not provide the services that we normally pride ourselves on. I take these comments very seriously and will be reviewing with the department heads in charge of the areas mentioned. If I can be of any further assistance please feel fee to contact me directly. Thank you.  Bill Reider General Manager Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary: Awesome location. Nice ocean view! Great staff and good food. This time we tried the breakfast, the skirt steak, chicken nachos. Everything was very good and they have some pretty nifty cocktails on the menu. Will recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the area.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to comment about your recent stay with us. Greatly appreciate your comments about Great Staff, Good Food and Nifty Cocktails. We appreciate your business and if I can be of any assistance in the future please feel free to contact me directly.  Surfs Up!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Doheny Beach - Dana Point 310-420-0146 Bill.Reider@Hilton.Com

Summary Heading: Fantastic property!  Hard to get to at first but really an ideal location!
Summary: This was my second time staying at this property and we were very impressed with everything.  I did miss the turn the first time (watch for the signs I cannot stress that enough) but once we got in, everything was great.  We went to the front desk and the room I had pre-selected wasnt ready so they upgraded us to an even better room on the top floor (I am a Hilton Diamond member).  The front desk staff were so kind and they gave us breakfast vouchers and drink vouchers.  And of course the famous doubletree cookies.  The rooms were fantastic.  Very beachy feel to them, new, clean, spacious.  Just wonderful.  The hotel itself is great with a rooftop restaurant and bar and of course a pool.  The parking is $22/night valet or self parking.  I would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Great to hear that you enjoyed your recent stay with us and want to recognize you for being a Loyal Hilton Diamond Member. I appreciate hearing that you enjoyed our Roof Top Bar, Fantastic Beachy Feeling Rooms and our Wonderful Staff. If I can be any assistance with future stays with us please feel free to contact me directly.   Surfs Up!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Doheny Beach - Dana Point 310-420-0146 Bill.Reider@Hilton.com

Summary: I had a week long business trip and decided to stay near the beach. The location of this hotel does not disappoint you do have to cross a somewhat busy street and walk through a campground to get to the beach. The beach itself is pretty nice a lot of surfers on the beach. This hotel is located in awkward corner almost, the pool is not that big and its located in front of the hotel which is understandable because the freeway is in the back.  I also did not see a hot tub. I did experience some inconveniences during my stay the a/c is my room was not working at all, thankfully they did come and fix it. Also after coming back from training all day I returned back to my room and noticed they had switched out the door key card panel. Which I have to go back down to the front desk and
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to comment and I do apologize for the inconvenience on the day that we upgraded our guest room door locks to the new Digital Key Platform by Hilton.  As a Hilton Hhonors Member you can now reserve your room on line using the Hilton App and go directly to your room using your smart phone as your key without having to check in at the desk. We appreciate your business and hope to see you again soon!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Doheny Beach - Dana Point 310-420-0146 Bill.Reider@Hilton.com

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, friendly staff, beach and restaurants
Summary: This hotel was very nice.  Staff was exceptional - very friendly and helpful.  Can walk to the beach which was really nice and there were many restaurants (fast food and upscale) in the immediate area.  It has a rooftop bar and seating area with large fire pit. Pool was a bit small and there was some construction going on which was noisy but from the looks of it, it didn't appear to be an ongoing situation. Parking was good and very easy access to freeways.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to comment Mary and we greatly appreciate your business. The repairs to the parking lot were only for that day and work has been completed. Very nice of you to recognize our team members and roof top bar with fire pit overlooking the ocean! A very special team and hotel. Thank you again and please feel free to contact me directly if I can assist in the future. All the best!   Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Doheny Beach - Dana Point 310-420-0146 Bill.Reider@Hilton.com

Summary: - We tried to check in using the Hilton mobile app but all of the rooms show as SMOKING rooms. Not wanting that, we had to wait to check in. At the hotel we were told it is a smoke-free property and they know the mobile app is wrong but haven't fixed it. Ok...? - The pool is in the parking lot/driveway area. Terribly uninviting. - The room is fine but the bathroom is unacceptably small and dark. I've never seen anything like it at a major brand in the US. - The wifi didn't work in room 355. - We left for breakfast and sight seeing before 9 am and when we returned at 2:30 our room hadn't been cleaned yet. The book in the room says housekeeping might be as late as 5 but not having cleaned it by 2:30 is terribly inconvenient. - Speaking of the book, it doesn't mention where the
Manager Response: Thank you for letting me know about your recent experience Michael and I apologize for not meeting your expectations during your stay. I appreciate you pointing out the problem with the Hilton App showing that all of our rooms are smoking when in fact we are 100% non-smoking hotel. We believe this was caused during our recent installation of the new Digital Key System and have corrected the issue. We have recently hired a new Executive Chef and new menus were placed into service just last week. The comments we are receiving have been very positive. Again I am sorry that we disappointed you but do appreciate your feedback because it helps me tremendously with improvements. Wish you all the best!  Bill Reider Bill.Reider@Hilton.Com

Summary: The remodeling of this hotel is amazing. The service was great. The associates that worked in the hotel were excited to serve the customer. The rooms were spotless. The food was great, fresh and delivered on time.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to comment William and especially for the recognition of our recent renovations. I appreciate hearing that we provided great service, spotless rooms and fresh food delivered on time. I will be sharing your kind words with the staff and know how much they will appreciate hearing that their hard work and attention to detail is paying off. Wish you all the best and if I can be of any future service please feel free to contact me directly.   Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Doheny Beach - Dana Point 310-420-0146 Bill.Reider@Hilton.com

Summary: The staff was very friendly and met my expectation!  I went to Dana Point for a little R & R and this was certainly the hotel to do it with.  Had an excellent view of the ocean and with it being just across the street, it was convenient to get to.  The rooms were clean and beds were very comfortable.  I would definitely recommend to others.
Manager Response: Dear Bridgette, thank you for your business and especially for your kind words about our staff and your stay. I greatly appreciate you taking time to let us know how much you enjoyed your recent visit and will be sure to share your comments with the team!  Wish you all the best and hope to see you again soon.   Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Doheny Beach - Dana Point 310-420-0146 Bill.Reider@Hilton.com

Summary: Everything was great with the exception of the bar..slow slow service if you even get served and quality of food I hear from my son and daughter in law (bride and groom) was not good made them feel ill. but besides that the place was great..Valet guys were wonderful!
Manager Response: Congratulations to you and your family on the recent wedding and I greatly appreciate your taking time to comment. I apologize about the slow service in the bar and will be reviewing with our Food and Beverage Team in an effort to find out what happened so that we can make sure this improves immediately. If I can be of any further assistance to you or your family please contact me directly. Thank you again and wish you all the best!  Bill Reider General Manager Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-4200-0146

Summary Heading: Good hotel by the beach--terrible wifi
Summary: Nice clean room and good service in an odd location nearby the beach. Wifi was awful and we barely could connect in our room and was kicked off constantly Using our Verizon data didn't work consistently either
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to comment about your recent stay with us and I am sorry to hear that the internet was intermittent. We have reported the internet issue to AT&T, our provider, and they are adding additional equipment to our system that will greatly improve reception so that your next visit will be a 5 out of 5. If I can be of any further assistance please feel free to contact me directly. Thank you again and wish you all the best!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Doheny Beach - Dana Point 310-420-0146 Bill.Reider@Hilton.com

Summary: This hotel is located in a very convenient place, near Doheny Beach and Dana Point. But there were problems. We were in the room about 5 min when another couple came to the door as the room had been assigned to them too. (We got some drink coupons as an apology). The room had a whistling toilet, which kept us up most of the night. Food in the restaurant and rooftop bar was good, not outstanding. Overall great location but not impressive.
Manager Response: Thank you for your business and I want to apologize for the problems that were experienced during your recent stay with us. With our brand new key system scheduled to be installed next week, we should not have what happened to you repeat itself in the future and I am very sorry that this happened. If I can be of any assistance please feel free to contact me directly. Thank you.  Bill Reider General Manager 310-420-0146 Bill.Reider@Hilton.com

Summary: We have been staying here for ten years and always received a very warm welcome. The staff over the years has changed but several still remain, Wesley, BJ, Gloria and Lisa. The food year was the best in nine years. The hotel has wonderful views of the ocean and received a make over this year. I think anyone would be pleased with the hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you Willis and it was great meeting you. We are very fortunate to have team members like Wesley, BJ, Gloria and Lisa continuing the long tradition of genuine hospitality.  Glad that you stayed with us again and will have your room and paddle board parking space ready for you next year upon your return. If I can be of any assistance with your future plans please give me a call. Keep in touch and wish you and your wife all the best!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree by Hilton Doheny Beach - Dana Point California Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary Heading: Nice property & location to tour the area
Summary: My wife and i stayed here for 3 nights and were very impressed with this hotel. Parking is limited in the front and the courteous valets do a great job taking care of you. Checking in was fast and easy with nice staff at the front desk and they have warm cookies! We found the room to be very clean, the king sized bed SUPER-comfortable, the bathroom nice and all recently renovated. Our room had a large patio that looked out to the trees in the back with a little view of the beach. The bar has a great tequila selection and there are fire pits all around to gather at night.  Really enjoyed the stay and the location is a perfect take off point for touring around or just going to the beach right out back.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and greatly appreciate your comments. Glad you enjoyed your stay and will forward your positive comments on to our staff. We will always have a warm DoubleTree by Hilton Chocolate Cookie waiting for your return!  All the Best Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree by Hilton Doheny Beach - Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary: We stayed one night at the Doubletree Dana Point in August 2016. Was a nice hotel, across one street from State Beach camping/park. You can definitely walk to the beach from the hotel, which is a plus, no need to drive OR look for non-existent parking in So Cal beach areas. Room was a bit musty smelling when we arrived, it is on the ocean so I guess that can go with the territory, but reminded me of hotels in Mexico somewhat with the smell. Had modern updated room décor which was nice, bathroom was very small, no two people sharing in this one. Standard doubletree sitting area, which is always a plus - nobody wants to sit on bed all the time while in room. Parking under hotel was good, roomy, gate is always open yet they ask you if you parked there, should have said no, since
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to comment about your recent stay with us. You are correct that there is a uniqueness to staying on the beach and the fresh ocean breezes being natural to the environment. A good suggestion about the possibility of opening the roof top lounge for lunch and something we will look into. We greatly appreciate your business and please let me know if I can be of any assistance in the future.   Surfs Up!  Bill Reider General Manager Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 31-420-1046

Summary: Great People, Nice Hotel Property, OK location.  First let me say that the staff at the DoubleTree at Doheny Beach were Great! They put the Hospitality in the hospitality industry, and I can not say enough about the great reception my wife and I got from Allele at the Front Desk. Second, the hotel is California, with a touch of modern elegance, and a hint of Mediterranean.  The Lobby was fun, the upstairs outside bar was excellent, and the room was a nice size and very clean. My only criticism and why I didn't give it a excellent review was its location. The hotel is next to everything but close to nothing.  It is very easy to walk to the beach but getting to shopping and restaurants a little more challenging. Also the view of the Pacific is there, but a little obstructed do to
Manager Response: Hello John, I appreciate you taking time to write and thank you for staying with us.  I greatly appreciate your comments about our staff putting the "hospitality in the hospitality industry". I will  certainly  share your comments with all of them today. I also wanted to mention that Dana Point has a free trolley system that stops directly across the street from the hotel during season. It takes you into town and all the way to Laguna Beach where you can pick up the Laguna Beach Trolley for free and explore this area of interest as well. I apologize if we did not make this information available to you during your stay. We hope to have you back with us in the future and if I can assist in any way please feel free to contact me. Thank you!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree by Hilton Doheny Beach - Dana Point 310-420-0146 Bill.Reider@Hilton.com

Summary: We were surprised that the hotel room was very spacious. It was really clean and it felt really homey/relaxing. The front desk was very helpful, especially Christine/Kristine (if i remember correctly). I love the overall look of the hotel room.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to comment on your recent stay with us and we greatly appreciate your business! I also appreciate you pointing out the exceptional service from our staff and in particular, Christine. If I can be of any assistance in the future please feel free to contact me directly. Wish you the Best!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree by Hilton Doheny Beach - Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary: Very quiet place for how many rooms they have. The suites have 2 separate rooms with sliding glass doors that opens to a sit down balcony. The rooms have plenty of outlets which is aways problem at even the more expensive hotels. Staff is excellent we arrived at noon and they let us have our room because it was already available. Small pool and no jacuzi but the beach is right cross the street. The food was great and the lounge on the 4th floor was amazing you could sit inside or outside. Bartender was great.
Manager Response: Dear Sandra, thank you for staying with us and for taking time to comment. I greatly appreciate hearing that you enjoyed your accommodations, our staff, food and the 4th floor Ocean view Deck for dining. Hope to see you again soon!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree by Hilton Doheny Beach - Dana Point 310-420-0146 Bill.Reider@Hilton.com

Summary: The location of the hotel is very convenient. It is across from the beach. Room was spacious, but double beds were too small, they were full size. We were expecting queen size beds. So for family of three, it was uncomfortable for two adults to sleep on one bed. We had issues with bathtub leaking. .. I hope they fix it for the next guests.
Manager Response: Thank you for your business and for pointing out the leak in your sink. If this was reported during your stay I am sure that we have sent out engineering team to repair. If this was not reported during your stay, I would greatly appreciate a call or email with the room number so I can address immediately. Thank you again and wish you the best!  Bill Reider General Manager Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary Heading: Open Breezy Lobby, Need Top Floor for Better view
Summary: It's very easy to get to this hotel from the I-5 Interstate Freeway/Highway.  Basics: slept well and ate well. The lobby has lots of open space and seating inside and outside for a relaxed meet-up. The pool is small, but you're at the ocean!  Details: Everybody charges for parking these days. So does the Doubletree. It's not cheap. There isn't really any easy place as an alternative. Price is the same for Valet or Self-Park, so I did Valet. They were quick, helpful and courteous.  My room was ocean view, but Doheny State Beach is across the street, which has tall trees, so my 2nd floor room had some ocean view, but lots of tree tops in the way (plus the hotel's palm trees). It was nothing to write home about. The killer for the "ocean-ness" is the traffic sounds. Though the
Manager Response: Thank you for your business and especially for taking time to comment about your recent stay with us. Glad to hear that we were easy to find and that you slept and ate well and enjoyed the ocean. With the summer season behind us, the traffic has slowed considerably along with the noise. Hope to see you again and until then wish you all the best!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree by Hilton Doheny Beach - Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hiton.com 310-420-0146

Summary: Great staff, friendly, helpful. But the hotel is directly adjacent to the train tracks. Last train at night is at 1:30am and first one is 6:30am. No sleep at this hotel. Room was good and facility has recently been remodeled with new carpet. Just don't plan on any sleep.
Manager Response: Dear Elizabeth, I am sorry to hear that the train ruined your stay however I was pleased to hear  about our "great staff, friendly and helpful". If I can, I would be happy to assist with a  room in a different location on your next visit. Please contact me in advance so I can help. All The Best!  Bill Reider General Manager 310-420-0146 Bill.Reider@Hilton.com

Summary: We've stayed here three times. Love the location right across from the beach! I really enjoy the long rounds I can take along the beach. They've done a great job with the remodeling. Staff are friendly and helpful.
Manager Response: Dear Ken, thank you very much for your business and greatly appreciate hearing that you approve of our wonderful renovations and our friendly/helpful staff! Look forward to seeing you again and until then, if I can be of any assistance please feel free to contact me directly. Surfs Up!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree by Hilton Doheny Beach - Dana Point 310-420-0146 Bill.Reider@Hilton.com

Summary: Overpriced for the service and ammenaties offered for hotel like this and it's location. The reservation department basically is offsite and will say anything to book you, upon arrival the staff makes excuses about the reservation department and are arrogant in their responses and handling of this situation which I know to be occurring with regularity because it's happened to me twice.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to comment on the reservation department and letting us know about your concerns. I will be passing on your comments to the Central Reservations Department. I apologize for the front desk staff member and would appreciate knowing more details so that I can address their handling of your situation. If you would please call me to discuss or email me details so that I can respond accordingly it would be greatly appreciated. Thank you!  Bill Reider General Manager Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary: We recently stayed at this DoubleTree in Dana Point and followed up when we received the survey request and subsequently sent a letter to Bill Reider, GM of the hotel. Not having heard anything back I am sharing our experience.  Dear Mr. Reider,   I pulled your name and email off a review you responded to on TripAdvisor.com.  I stayed at the DoubleTree at Dana Point along with my girlfriend at the end of July. I responded to an email from your hotel after our stay regarding our experience but never heard from anyone so I thought I’d reach out to you.  We are two women in our mid-50’s and were in town to attend a wedding in San Juan Capistrano.  I made reservations for a Deluxe Ocean View Double on June 18, 2016 for two nights … July 29 and July 30, for a total of $598.56.  I
Manager Response: I appreciate your feedback and I am terribly sorry that I missed your email. We clearly  failed to deliver exceptional services during your stay and I apologize for letting you and your girlfriend down. I would like the opportunity to make it right. If you decide that you would like to discuss your stay further, my direct line  is 949-234-4500. Again my sincerest apologies and hope to hear from you.  Bill Reider General Manager

Summary: We wanted a short getaway to breathe in some ocean air and being loyal Double Tree/Hilton members decided to check it out.    Like most trips there will be hiccups with the room, guests, etc...   The shining star of this trip was the AMAZING front desk staff, valets and general manager Bill!!!   Their attention to detail and swift resolution to any issues was great.   We will be returning to the DoubleTree Suites soon because of the staff.   In a world where good customer service is dead, we truly appreciate their care and concern for their guests.
Manager Response: Thank you "Loyal DoubleTree/Hilton Members" and greatly appreciate hearing about our "Amazing Staff"! I'm a lucky guy and glad we were able to make your stay memorable and especially to hear that you will be back in the future. Please feel free to contact me at any time if there is any need for assistance and until I see you again Wish You All The Best!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree by Hilton Doheny Beach - Dana Point 310-420-0146 Bill.Reider@Hilton.com

Summary Heading: Did not meet expectations for price
Summary: OK- We booked this not knowing that the Ohana festival across the street had likely driven up the price.  This hotel is very average, and not worth $300 a night.  The saving grace for this place is the staff - shout out to the valet guys (they will lend you beach toys/chairs, plus have good local recommendations).  The restaurant staff were also quite friendly but the food was below the standard of many other Hilton property buffets.  The hotel itself is sandwiched between highways (loud!), and we had some issues with the room (broken air conditioning), a loud compressor noise that ran all night, and a balcony door that would open itself.  Not to mention some billing inaccuracies...  The front desk did eventually attempt to smooth things over with a price reduction, but at this
Manager Response: I appreciate your kind acknowledgements of our staff during your resent stay and for taking time to let me know where we let you down. Unfortunately we have no warning when a guest room air conditioning unit is going to fail but we do have a replacement program in place that we know will result in much better reliability. I will double check our Wake Up DoubleTree breakfast buffet to see that we are 100% compliant with the Brand requirements. Again I want to apologize for not meeting these standards and greatly appreciate you letting me know about your stay. Thank You.  Bill Reider General Manager Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary: Walks distance to the ocean, location is awesome, and staff was great overall. Hotel upgrade was awesome with ocean view, A/C units are old so they are very loud. The A/C units need to be upgraded. loved it.
Manager Response: Congratulations on your Anniversary and glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us! Sorry to hear that you had a loud air conditioning unit and know that this is a #1 priority of ours being addressed currently. If I can be of any further assistance in the future please feel free to contact me directly. Thank you and hope to see you again. All the best!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Doheny Beach - Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary: This was my 5th stay at this hotel in 2016. The staff is always helpful and ensures that my needs are met. I have brought several groups here and everyone loves this hotel. It can get hectic at the front desk when lots of people are checking in and out at the same time - it is a relatively small lobby with lots going on!   Be sure to spend some quality time enjoying the view from Moquila terrace bar. The ahi poke appetizer is excellent, and my colleagues raved about the wings. I love the breakfast at this hotel - Lisa and Raul brighten my mornings.  I want to thank Anthony and Molly for all of your hospitality and flexibility with the (sometimes totally frustrating) needs of our groups! Your staff does an amazing job and we look forward to next year!
Manager Response: Thank you for your business and especially for the kind word about our team members. We are truly fortunate to have a tremendous group of folks leading the service at out property and I am very grateful for all they do for our guests. Our roof top bar is one of a kind and appreciate your mention of what a "special place" it is. Hope to meet you on your next visit and until then wish you all the best!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree Suites Doheny Beach - Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary: Room was clean. Had air conditioner malfunction twice but maintenance came quickly and resolved even in the evening. Front desk was great and friendly.  Breakfast was very good both buffet and fresh eggs cooked to your request. Very friendly wait staff.  Room on 4th floor next to outdoor bar but music on Friday night was not a problem.   Good service from valet. Enjoyed bar with bar menu on 4th floor.
Manager Response: Thank you for your business and especially for taking time to comment. We are glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay and I will be sharing your comments with the team. If I can be of assistance in the future please feel free to contact me directly. Wish you all the best!  Surfs Up!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree by Hilton Doheny Beach - Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary: I was in town for meetings and couldn't have picked a better spot to lay my head at the end of the day. The beach is RIGHT ACROSS THE STREET! So after a long day sitting in meetings I could take a quick walk and clear my head. The rooms are nicely set up, clean & the bed was really really comfy. The staff was great too even helping me with directions to the same place twice! The breakfast staff in the restaurant is awesome! I don't eat sugar and they found plain unsweetened yogurt for me both mornings. The second morning I didn't even have to ask for it they just brought it to me! I will definitely be back
Manager Response: none

Summary: Check in process went smoothly, was upgraded to a room with a view. Big thanks to Orlando and Kimberly for recommending some great locations to visit. Overall great hotel great service plus. By the way breakfast was AMAZING!! Thank you Lisa for being very helpful and attentive.   P.S Gotta love those Chocolate Chip Pancakes.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to write about your recent stay with us and especially for recognizing Orlando, Kimberly, Lisa and the Chocolate Chip Pancakes! We appreciate your business and will share your comments with the team. Hope to see you again soon and wish you all the best!  Surfs Up  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree by Hilton Doheny Beach - Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary: This is my second time staying at this property. Returned because of great location, rooms and stellar staff. The manager Anthony was extremely kind and helpful. Pamela and Kim's helpfulness at the front desk also made for a great stay.   The views from this hotel are stunning. The hotel is very nice and peaceful, directly across from the beach.   Rooftop bar on 4th floor has great sunset views. Also great at night to sit by the fire and have some drinks.   Overall great stay and will return to this property again. It is a great getaway from LA.
Manager Response: none

Summary: A nice place to stay. My only criticism is that the guacamole at moquilla was awful. Please have a Hispanic chef show these people how to do it correctly, it's not supposed to look like green mayonaise
Manager Response: none

Summary: I'm going to recommend this place despite the mixed experience. We checked in after a long day, a long flight from EWR, and a late drive. 9:45. They were working on one of the elevators. When we got to our room it was warm, but we admired the efficiency and turned the thermostat down. We complained; they responded immediately. Fixed? Nope. It actually started blowing hot air. We complained; they responded. Now the room was in the high 80's. Around midnight it started to cool. We dealt with it because both the desk clerks and the engineer were concerned and engaged.  Now for the good parts. They moved us to an upgraded room the first thing the next day even though our ac was working. Breakfasts were wonderful. Chicken enchiladas on the buffet. Great omelettes from the kitchen. A
Manager Response: Thank you for your business and especially for providing your feedback to us. Glad to hear that our staff went above and beyond by upgrading your room and that you enjoyed your visit. We have recently installed many new air conditioning units in the guest rooms and will continue doing so until we have this resolved. You are very right when you say the view was great and location to the harbor and Lantern District convenient. Hope to see you again in the future!  All the Best!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree by Hilton Doheny Beach - Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary: Too many problems within the hotel rooms.  Management isn't helpful or nice.  Vacation cut short because I couldn't spend another night enduring the problems within my first or second room.  Air conditioning breaks down during summer, plumbing was a big issue and then when corrected, no one bothers to check for leaks.  Big mess from the leaks and ultimately, no toilet paper because it was saturated.
Manager Response: Dear Cheryl, I am very sorry to hear that we let you down during your recent stay. We have made significant progress with air conditioning issues over the past 2 months but unfortunately yours was not a room with a new unit. I am also very concerned about your comment about our management team and would be grateful if you could contact me to share your experience. Again, I apologize and look forward to talking at a time convenient. Thank you.   Bill Reider General Manager Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary: Very displeased with hotel, rooms hot, hallway had no ac, no cold water from faucet. Very small queen beds. Stayed here as part of Diamond Resort International package so we got crappy room by the pool with no balcony. Kept trying to charge account different amounts everyday and then final day said we owed full amount. Enjoyed Dana Point but not hotel. Food at restaurant expensive for the quality.
Manager Response: Very sorry to hear that we let you down. I will look into the billing issues for you if there is still anything outstanding. Please reach out to me if I can help. Again I apologize and know we can do better.  Bill Reider General Manager Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary: I am a Hilton Diamond member (highest membership for Hilton)  I got treated as if I was stepchild.  I ask for room upgrade, they said they did not have any.  I looked at my Hilton App on my cell phone and it was clearly available.  They told me that Diamond members get have better access to deals.  Come on, this was a App, everyone has access to this.  Rooms where small for a resort, they did upgrade me after I paid a $30 charge.  This place was ridiculous!!  Stay away and go elsewhere!!!
Manager Response: I am sorry to hear that we were unable to upgrade your stay and know how disappointing this can be. I will use this letter for training purposes with the team in order to find ways so that this does not happen again. I appreciate you bringing this to my attention and if I can be of any further assistance please contact me directly. Thank you!  Bill Reider General Manager Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary: We had previously used the hotel and had quite a few issues so we were wary of returning but they've turned things around and all of the renovations look great! The location was perfect and right in front of the free trolly which took us around town. Room service was quick and the staff was friendly. We'll definitely be back!
Manager Response: Thank you for your business and a second chance to show our improvements! So happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay and coming back in the future. If I can assist in any way please feel free to contact me directly.   Surfs Up!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree by Hilton Doheny Beach - Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary: This was the only hotel we got short term and close to the beach. The room had a great view, the beds were clean but the bathrooms would need a little bit more attention. The staff was extremely friendly and attentive. Despite the beach proximity it takes about 10 minutes to get there because there is a camp ground in front of the hotel one cannot pass. However, there is a station for the free tram in front of the hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments about your recent stay and happy to read your very kind words about our staff. Glad to see that you tried the Trolly, it's one of the best kept secrets that just started this year. Although it only runs during the summer we hope someday that the park will extend the service. Until next time, we wish you all the best and hope to see you again soon!   Surfs Up!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree by Hilton Doheny Beach - Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary: We were so excited to stay here but for the amount of money we paid it was not worth it. Not as clean as it should have been. Dirty floor- had to wear socks, hair on bathroom floor, tub did not drain, urine on toilet, sliding door to balcony was broke, beds were full size - to small for me ad hubby. There was a train that went by periodically but it was not that bad. The staff was nice and approachable. Valet was nice. On check which in the morning the front desk guy was sleep. Had to call him several times to help us. The area is wonderful. I will be back but will try a different hotel.
Manager Response: I appreciate your feed back and I am very sorry to hear that we let you down. I will be following up with the departments mentioned above about their responsibility to provide clean rooms 100% of the time and our night front desk team member. I do hope you will give us a second chance because I know we can do better. Please feel free to contact me directly if I can be of any further service or assistance. Thank you!  Bill Reider General Manager Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary: We stayed at this hotel about 20 year ago when it was a Hilton.  We had two suites and they were ocean view. Yes you do see the highway but it was not a big deal.The recent updated rooms and lobby look very nice and relaxing. I love the little "beach" cushions on the beds and the coffee table by the sofa was the perfect height for using the laptop. The blue and white color in the rooms, lobby and outside building create a cool, clean and beachy feel. Magaly at the front desk was the best and very helpful - she was the one that made our trip!  The valets were so cheerful and helpful - we were able to borrow chairs and an umbrella for the nearby beach (just across the street)  One thing that could be improved is the warm and humid temperatures in the hotel corridors - either the
Manager Response: Thank you for writing about your recent stay with us as well as your kind words about the staff. Yes you hit the nail on the head, Magaly is a Rock Star and we too are greatful that she is here. Glad you enjoyed and hope you do not wait another 20 years before you return. My contact information is below and please feel free to contact me directly if I may assist further. Thank you again!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree by Hilton Doheny Beach - Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hlton.com 310-420-0146

Summary: My husband and I stayed here on a combined business/personal trip, and it was lovely. The beachy hotel decor is crisp and clean, and very appealing. While we didn't make use of the amenities (restaurants or pool), we enjoyed the short walk to the nearby beach area, the hotel service (front desk and valet, particularly) and the bed--which was so amazing that I went to sleep the first night with an all-day backache and woke up the next morning pain-free and completely refreshed.   My one not-really-a-complaint-more-of-an-observation, which extends to all Doubletrees I've stayed at in the past two years (8+) is the silly little in-room coffee makers. I've soaked countless hand towels mopping up from having selected one-cup when I meant to brew two in the little side-by-side coffee
Manager Response: Great to here that you and your husband enjoyed your recent stay with us, We appreciate the kind words about the staff and especially glad to hear that out famous DoubleTree by Hilton bed took you backache away :) Thank you for your business and please feel free to reach out to me if we can be of service to you and your family in the future. Surfs Up!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree by Hilton Doheny Beach - Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary: Parking at this location was terrible and to be charged $22 to park your own car is not what anyone would expect from Hilton DoubleTree.  The breakfast food was good but is was grossly understaffed. The waitress visited our table TWICE, once to take our order and once to drop off the check. The busboy brought the food. We were on our own. The bathroom in room 383 was the worst part of the stay. No vanity surface to place grooming items. The tub area was dark and dirty. The hot and cold water on the sink are on opposite sides of what they should be.  This is not Hilton experience I'm accustom to receiving.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to respond about your recent stay with us and I apologize that we fell short on our services. I am new to the hotel but know how important good service and clean rooms are for our valued guests.  Your input is valuable and I will be reviewing your comments with our Food and Beverage and Housekeeping teams in order to improve in these areas. If I can be of any further assistance please feel free to contact me directly. Thank you again and wish you the best!  Bill Reider General Manager Bill.Reider@Hilton.Com 310-420-0146

Summary: Overall I was pleased with my stay. Nice, clean room. Staff was courteous but not overly friendly, the exception being the valet staff who were excellent. Speaking of valet, it's $22 to park yourself or valet and parking is sparse so I'd recommend just going with valet. Only major issue was mosquitos which were everywhere. At one point a small swarm appeared in our room. The staff was prompt about moving us to another room (had us out and moved in 20 mins). I'd stay there again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your business and especially for recognizing the staff for their help while you were here. I am sorry to hear about the mosquitos, I know that the fish love them but I, like you, am not a fan and will try my best to see what the County can do to help rid the problem. If I can be of any help in the future please feel free to contact me any time. All the best.  Surfs Up!  Bill Reider DoubleTree by Hilton Doheny Beach - Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary: My room was quite large with bedroom & TV and living area with TV. There was a view of the ocean. There was a road between the hotel and the ocean but the room was very quiet. I was only there for one night but wishing I had more time to stay and explore.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to share your "room with a view" experience. Awaiting your return when you have the time to explore. Take care and all the best!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree Suites be Hilton Doheny Beach - Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary: Only one employee at front desk, resulting in long wait to check in.   Paid the large parking fee only to see massive empty lot as my view from my room.   I could also see and hear the freeway.    Mold and dirt in the bathroom, small flying bugs in the room.   A/C never cooled the room but ran on and off loudly.     Disappointed in the facility.
Manager Response: I am sorry to hear that we let you down during your recent stay. I am new to the hotel and your comments help provide me with direction on what we need to focus our attention towards immediately. The Air Conditioning issue is being addressed and all rooms that were identified with problems have been taken out or order and new units are being installed. I appreciate your business and greatly appreciate you making me aware of what I need to take care of immediately. If I can be of any further assistance please feel free to contact me directly. Thank you again!  Bill Reider General Manager Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary: The 4th floor bar is cool overlooking the ocean and the staff is very friendly and helpful. Be ready to spend $22 per night if you park a car. The rooms are clean but dated. The bathroom needs a lot of work. It is very small with zero counter space. I would come again for the location and price.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and positive comments about the Staff and our Roof Top Bar. I will be forwarding your comments regarding the size of the bathroom on to the owners for review and appreciate your input. We greatly appreciate your business and If I can be of any future assistance please feel free to contact me directly. Thank you and all the best.  Surfs Up!  Bill Reider General Manager Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary: Over priced...just look at Yelp reviews, all true. Terrible place to stay Mold in bathroom, noisy, started gardening at 8am on a Sunday ,room wasn't ready upon arrival. Just completely disappointing. They ran out of the sparkling wine we were having and The food was the same at both the restaurant and the roof top lounge even tho the menus on line are different. And it wasn't good!!! It was over priced and strange. Staff was friendly but there was a lot wrong for a 300$ room. There was only one ice machine all the others were broken. It was just kind of a bummer
Manager Response: I am very sorry to heat that you did not enjoy your stay with us. I am new to the property and your feedback provides me with great information on where to work on improvements. The ice machines were all replaced a couple of days after your visit and know how frustrating this must have been. We have a new chef starting September 5th and one of his first priorities will be revamping the menus and putting out a consistent quality meal. If I can be of any further assistance please feel free to contact me directly. Thank you again.  Bill Reider General Manager Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary: Beds & pillows uncomfortable, carpet was dirty stepped in something brown wet & gross in room, bathroom tiny, staff enters room even with the do not disturb sign! Pool is a joke pool chairs not adj, breakfast terrible!
Manager Response: I am very sorry to hear that we let you down during your recent stay with us. I am new to the property and working with housekeeping to improve on cleanliness and to honor the Do Not Disturb signs on guest room doors as this is most important. If I can be of any further assistance please feel free to contact me directly. Thank you.  Bill Reider General Manager Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 410-420-0146

Summary: Unfortunately everything from the room location to the wait staff service was poor at this location.  They put us in a room with a window that did not have any window covering - so we had the nice, bright Doubletree sign shinning in the room along with car lights all night long.  The air conditioning was extremely loud and sounded like an alarm or foghorn.   Asked to change rooms but because we wanted a king and ocean view there were no other rooms available - except those that had views of the busy road and also had road noise.   Waited 1/2 hour to get food service at the pool (doors open from the restaurant to the pool)  - even though I went in twice and asked for someone to wait on us.  Told twice that someone would be right there - they were NOT busy.  I will say that once
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to let me know about your recent stay with us. I am new to the property and greatly appreciate your help pointing out where we need to focus attention. While it was good to hear that you enjoyed the food and Roof Top Bar, I am very sorry to hear that we let you down with service at the pool and conditions with your room. I can assure you that we are working on all of these items that you mention in your post and appreciate you letting me know. If I can be of any further assistance please feel free to contact me directly.Wish you all the best!  Bill Reider General Manager Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary: We stayed for three nights. It is a Nice location, love the roof top bar. Beach is walking distance but not the greatest beach. Its a good place to have as a  base point. Many beaches are short drives away. Service is good.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to comment on your recent stay with us. Great to hear that you enjoyed our roof top bar, I agree with you, very special and unique. If I can ever be of service in the future please feel free to contact me directly. Wish you all the best.  Surfs Up!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree by Hilton Doheny Beach - Dana Point Bill.eider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary: I had the pleasure of staying in this hotel several years back and before the remodel.  It was great then and is great now.  The room was spacious and comfortable.  Customer service, from the valet, front desk, and maid service was exceptional.  This hotel will be on my short list for places to stay in Dana Point.
Manager Response: Thank you for your positive comments and especially for revisiting us after our recent renovations. I am new to the hotel and although I would like to take the credit for your great stay, I owe it all to the hard work of the team members and the owners commitment to maintaining very high qualities for making the difference. Please let me know if I can ever be of assistance and wish you all the best.  Surfs Up!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree by Hilton Doheny Beach - Dana Point 310-420-0146 Bill.Reider@Hilton.com

Summary: great location,clean room,staff friendly but totally non active with follow thru on complaints,maintanace on air conditioning,electrical nonfunctioning outlets totally ignored great valet staff,maid service sloppy
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know about your recent stay and I apologize that our team failed on following up with your needs while you were here with us. I take this very seriously and know how I would feel if I my requests went unanswered. I am new to the hotel and your input provides me with excellent information where we need to focus our attention. If I can be of any father assistance please feel free to contact me directly.  Thank you Again!  Bill Reider General Manager Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary: Room wasn't as promised via website, no dividing door.  Since sold out, no other options.  Pool is tiny and underground parking stinks like trash.  Ants in room.  Bed is comfortable. Pull out couch no good.  Room faced freeway and was noisy,  Room also faced construction...
Manager Response: Very sorry to hear that we were unable to meet your expectation with the room description. I am new to the hotel and have already begun working on getting the web site room descriptions rewritten since the newly renovated rooms no longer have doors between the sleeping and living areas. I appreciate you pointing this out to us and hope we can someday earn your business back.   All the Best  Bill Reider General Manager Bill.Reider@Hilton.com310-420-0146

Summary: Hilton's claim that they have completed a multi million make over is incorrect. The room we were given was appalling. The bathroom was so small, the shower was over the bath it was impossible to turn shower on and not get drenched. I am not a big person but there was barely room to move in the shower. This bathroom was not renovated it was old and unclean. The worst aspect of this room apart from how old and run down it is was the air conditioner. The constant noise was intolerable and we had to turn it off in order to get some sleep. We asked at reception to have it fixed they said they would get someone to look at it but it was not attended to throughout our stay. It is my opinion that the staff from valet to bar staff to front desk are not trained at all. The front desk staff
Manager Response: none

Summary: We chose this hotel because it is close to the beach, and we were looking for a beach get-a-way. Our room was noisy as it faced the freeway, but it appeared that all rooms either face the freeway or the PCH. Our room was not ready at 4 PM when we arrived and we were told it would be just a few minutes and we would be texted when the room was ready. After about 45 minutes and no text, I checked back at the front desk. The room was ready but they just forgot to text me. The website states that check in is at 3 PM. Be ready to be nickled and dimed. It costs to park and to use the internet.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to provide your feedback about your recent stay with us. I apologize that we were unable to get you to your room immediately upon arrival and know how frustrating this can be after a long drive. Being new at the hotel myself, your comments provide me with important areas of focus and I greatly appreciate your help! If I can be of any future assistance please feel free to contact me directly at any time. Thank you again and enjoy the summer.  Surfs Up!  Bill Reider General Manager Bill.Reider@Hilton.Com 310-420-0146

Summary: Since we live close, we just wanted to get away for a couple of days and enjoy the beach.  The location of this hotel was great and the view is amazing.  The service was ok.  If you are going to stay at the hotel I would recommend eating off-site.  there are many great restaurants close by.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to provide feedback on your recent stay with us and great to hear that you enjoyed the beaches and many places to eat in the nearby areas. Please let me know if I can ever be of assistance planning your next Staycation!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree by Hilton Doheny Beach - Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary Heading: Not perfect, but a great location
Summary: We've stayed at the Doubletree twice. It's a fantastic location, nice surf theme, across the street from the beach and an easy drive down to San Clemente or to other Dana Point beaches - which we love - and up to Laguna Beach. The room space was nice, and the room was recently renovated and very clean. It's great for the 4th of July as you can see the fireworks directly from the property, and even from some of the rooms. The staff was very friendly, especially to my 8 year old daughter which she appreciated. There's not a lot of affordable options in this area, but this is, even though there are some cons. With a pool-facing room or an ocean-facing too, we didn't hear traffic or train noise, so get one of those. The pool is small and gets crowded quickly, although it's still a
Manager Response: Thank you for your business and especially for your comments about your recent stay with us. I am new to the hotel and your feedback helps me determine the direction that I need to focus on. That said, we are currently reworking the menus on property along with food quality so that next time you visit with us we will be able to show you our improvements.  If there is anything else that I can assist with in the future please feel free to contact me directly. Wish you all the best.  Surfs Up!  Bill Reider General Manager Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary Heading: DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL!
Summary: I'll start with I love Hilton and have stayed at many different properties incl multiple DoubleTree hotels but this hotel is the worst. I'm just list the issues: Dirty room Flying insects, (mosquitos I believe. Killed 3 in room before I bailed, w/ more flying by.) Crawling insects (couldn't ID) crawling on bedside tables and bath mirror.  Malfunctioning ac Traffic noise so loud from highway you think you're sleeping on an underpass.  Located so close to train track that the Bldg shakes when trains go by. It's 11:29p.m. as I'm writing this as a train is going by so don't believe them when they tell you trains stop at 10 pm. Thought it might be isolated thing until I overheard another guest at front desk saying they were leaving this hotel because of bad conditions.
Manager Response: Dear Maryann, I am very sorry to hear that we were unable to provide you with a great experience during your recent visit. I appreciate you letting me know about the issues experienced during your stay and have had our pest control company here to inspect and treat the rooms. We will continue to work on improvements and hope to earn your business back in the future. Thank you!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree by Hilton Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com

Summary Heading: Cute and comfy. Pay for the valet service!
Summary: We stayed here last weekend.  I'm going to start out the review with stating the valets were the best.  We dealt with four of them and everyone was fantastic.  It was well worth the $22 a day.  We got to our room and saw we were extremely close to PCH.  Don't let it scare you, the rooms are very well insulated and we didn't hear the road noise.  Doheny Beach is right across the bridge and restaurants are nearby in addition to their cafe on the first floor and tequila bar on the fourth.  The food comes from the same kitchen, but you have to go to the top floor to enjoy the view, the breeze and the music.  We will be staying there again soon.  We highly recommend this place if for the service alone.
Manager Response: Thank you for your business and especially for taking time to respond about your positive experiences. I greatly appreciate the kind words about the staff and will be sure to share your comments with all of them. If I can be of any further assistance please feel free to contact me directly. Wish you the best!  Surfs Up  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree by Hilton Doheny Beach - Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary Heading: A real mixed bag, but a great location for the beach
Summary: Overall the hotel was just okay, although there are some nice touches.  Room sizes are good, the bed is comfortable, the shower has good pressure, the restaurants nice and all the staff are quite wonderful.  I can't imagine the hotel before the renovation, since the screen door was ripped, the air conditioning control unit flopped on the wall, the ice machines didn't work on floors two and three and the internet was almost non existent in the room.  The in lobby computers were down the entire four days we stayed at the hotel.  I would spring for the ocean facing rooms, since the other rooms have no view at all.  We waited for about one hour to check in, since the room wasn't ready.  The roof top deck/bar is nice.  We'd probably not stay there again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Right next to the beach, and great hotel!
Summary: We had a family vacation at this hotel, with five rooms between the group. I couldn't be more favorable about this hotel… The rooms, the staff, the service, the proximity to the beach -  all were outstanding. The only complaint, which would not deter me from returning next year for a repeat vacation, is the small bathroom.   But don't let the bathroom size keep you away from this gem. You can walk to Doheney Beach, and the hotel has a wonderful ambience to it.   The staff was so friendly and accommodating to our large family.  Highly recommend!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Want to go back ! Very clean nice people loved the view and hotel great expense and experience glad I booked my stay at that location I hope it doesn't hang there prices to be to high so I can go again
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to write about your recent stay with us. I greatly appreciate hearing how much you enjoyed the experience! If I can be of any further help please feel free to contact me directly. Wish you all the best.  Surfs Up!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree by Hilton Doheny Beach - Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com 310-420-0146

Summary: I was a little timid to stay here based on other Trip Advisor reviews.  When I first got to the hotel, there was definitely an issue with the A/C.  The hallways were hot and muggy.
