However, later on in the week, this problem seemed to be solved.  This hotel is I'm an odd location-surrounded by busy roads; close to the beach but not the easiest access to the beach.  It seems that there have been some renovations but they appear incomplete.   In my room there was definitely a mold issue in the bathroom and twice I found ants in the room.  Housekeeping appeared to be minimal-there was routinely crumbs all over the hall and room service trays with food on them are left in hallways for hours.  The parking garage is dark, damp, and cramped-for $22 per day!  The front desk staff was
Manager Response: I'm sorry to hear that your stay with us did not meet and exceed expectations. The points that you have mentioned in your review will greatly help me with addressing the problems that you experienced.  I am new to the property and can see that we have some work to do and appreciate your insight and time that you have taken to notify me. If I can be of any further assistance please feel free to contact me directly. Thank you and All the Best! Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree by Hilton Dana Point bill.reider@Hilton.com

Summary: I was excited to try this hotel again as I stayed about a year ago during their renovation.  The hotel has had a complete physical make-over.    Unfortunately, as nice as the make-over is, the hotel is still just so-so.    The rooms are large and comfortable.  I like the benefit of the sitting area.  It makes the hotel more comfortable.    The bathrooms are larger and updated.  The water pressure is pretty poor.  My biggest complaint is the noise at this hotel.  I'm not sure what the people above me were doing but it sounded like a constant game of shuffle board up there.  And the noise level late at night and early morning (12-3am) is completely unacceptable.    The restaurant does a nice job and the roof top deck is lovely.  I think there are better values in the Dana Point
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is fair and certainly fit our needs for three nights this week.  Although it is somewhat dated, it is clean and well maintained.  The staff is very friendly. It is on a busy roadway, and across the street from the beach.  Really across the street from the beach campgrounds... So the view is certainly nothing special.  There is a nice breakfast offering daily, buffer or to order.  There is a decent bar on the rooftop offering happy hour. The servers are very nice, but service is very slow.  If you're looking for a moderate, clean place to stay, I'd recommend . If you're looking for amenities, this probably is t for you
Manager Response: none

Summary: The staff was friendly and helpful.  The suite we had was nice, clean and roomy.  The view was great as well.  It was nice to wake up and to be able to see the surf.  The Moquela bar has great drinks, comfortable couches and great atmosphere.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good Accomodations, Across from the Beach
Summary: Dana Point is a beautiful town, and this hotel gives you a good location to enjoy it from.  You are a short walk from the beach and a short drive from all the great restaurants in Dana Point.  The rooms are comfortable, and the staff is very friendly.  I recommend it.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is just south of Dana Point on Doheny Beach. As others have mentioned, the hotel is across a major street from a campground that is on the beach, which makes it a 5-10 minute walk. The beach here is beautiful. The hotel is easy to miss, as you need to be in the left side of the southbound lane, and turn left into it. Be careful turning in, the valets are right there moving cars and do not always expect someone to pull in. You need to valet or self park. When we self parked only one elevator was working(the front desk was not told by maintenance) so it took about 10 minutes to go up 1 floor to the lobby. Do not take the stairs up from the garage as they end up outside at an unattended locked door. No signage. The room was nice, but tiny counters in bathrooms, and 2
Manager Response: none

Summary: Horrible.If you don't mind ants all over your belongings then stay here.If you don't mind horrible customer service stay here.The pool is nice,the location is great.Do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else. did I mention ants!We didn't get our room at the agreed time and now I know why.......We also had to pack up our belongings and move.You guessed it more ants,everywhere!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Run down and not well maintained
Summary: This is an older property that has not been well maintained. It is fine, but no better than that. I was staying for business and was only there from late at night until early each morning. I would have been very disappointed to spend any more time than that in the hotel. The AC didn't work at all and only 1 of the 2 TVs in the room worked. It appeared that I was only one of many having these issues as the list was already over a page in length when I reported the issues.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to review us Kimberly W and I apologize for the air conditioning and TV not working in your room. I am the new General Manager at the DoubleTree Suites Dana Point (1 week) and have already begun an intensely focused study of the air conditioning issues that appear in these reviews. We will get this issue fixed and hope we can earn your business back in the future. If I can be of any further assistance please do not hesitate contacting me directly.  Thank You and All the Best!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com

Summary: We stayed in a ground floor room. It was very convenient. We took kids to the beach. It was an easy walk and easy access to the beach. The decor of the rooms and the hotel is really pleasant.  There are plenty of thing to do and places to eat within minutes.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Pretty nice hotel but front desk service could have been better
Summary: We chose this hotel primarily because it allowed pets.  We spent one night with our puppy.  The room itself was pretty nice but the AC was too loud and disturbing - and those fans in the bathroom are always too loud.  Since we were only there one night, we didn't complain.  When I first checked in, I asked the front desk clerk if there was an animal hospital near by in case of emergency.  She wasn't aware of one but we later discovered one minutes from the hotel.  I also asked if she could recommend some dog-friendly restaurants.  Again, she said she didn't know of any but could look into it.  Then she basically told me to google the information myself.  She wasn't rude but for a dog-friendly hotel, I expected it to feel more dog-friendly - that was a little disappointing but
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: This Comedy of mis-communications wore thin quickly . . .
Summary: Driving South from LA in the evening I was excited to find an availability at this Doubletree Suites, located across the street from a beach in Dana Point, as I always try to stay in Hilton Hotels when possible.  I was resigned to paying the high $22.00 overnight parking rate, and looking forward to a comfortable night in a stylish 2-room suite.  Upon arrival around 9PM, I utilized digital check-in, selecting the room pre-assigned to me.  I asked the front desk person if they had a quiet room, not facing the adjacent busy highway, but was told no, as the hotel was full, so off to my Suite I went, discovering that it indeed faced the noisy highway.  The room was very stylish, but it was NOT a two room suite.  It was really no larger than most hotel rooms, but did have two TV's, a
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and I am very sorry about the air conditioning not working as well as the several other areas where we failed to meet expectations. I am new to the property and have already begun an intensely focused initiative with the air conditioning issues and we have also order new ice machines. Your comments will help me with improving services and I greatly appreciate your time and effort letting me know about this. If there is anything else that I can do for you in the future please feel free to reach me directly.  Thank You and All the Best!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree Suites Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com

Summary Heading: No A/C Ruined a Possibly Great Experience
Summary: I took the family to the L.A. area for a mini vacation and to visit family for the 4th of July holidays.  The first part of our trip, we stayed at a Homewood Suites in Agoura Hills (fantastic experience there - 5 star review) for a few days and then the wife had work in Aliso Viejo on the following Tuesday, so we decided to book a place on the beach.  This property is located right across the street from the beach in Dana Point, which was the primary selling point for me.  You do have to cross a street and a small camp area to get to the beach, but this really is not a big deal compared with fighting for parking at a busy location elsewhere in L.A.  I am a Gold Member and was able to select my own room.  I choose an "ocean view" and ended up with a room facing the drainage
Manager Response: Thank you Robert O and yes I agree with you that air conditioning is expected and required. I want to apologize for not being able to meet expectations and for the sir conditioning not working properly in your room. Having just started working here on July 5th and reading the review on line, my #1 priority is for me to get to the source of what is causing  the air conditioning issues and to correct immediately. We greatly appreciate your business and  Hhonors Loyalty as a Gold Member. If  I may be of any further assistance please feel free to contact me directly.  Thank You and All the Best!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com

Summary: If you've stayed at a Hilton Hotel and/or Double Tree, this is different and small. They've updated it, but the hotel itself is cramped against the freeway. The first room we checked into that was "Ocean View" was in the back facing the freeway and a gross green canal, you had to lean out over the balcony to see the OCEAN. I did call and we received another room in the front of the hotel. View is of the street, campers, and then the ocean; but didn't mind. It was still awesome. I see why other reviewers complained about the AC, it's just not strong enough and the room and hallways were  warm for the beach.The roof top bar is short staffed and service is lacking. Drinks and food were good, but they ran out of Bud Light and Grenadine. Ice machine only worked on one floor and only
Manager Response: none

Summary: Due to a change in plans we had to find a hotel in the area as part of our road trip to San Diego. The hotel has been refurbished and is fresh with a beachy feel. We had a nice view and as a Hilton Gold Card the usual perks. Yes there were negatives but the major difference was the fact the GM reached out to me after our stay for feedback. What a refreshing change!! I don't like being negative on trip advisor , I would rather address  issues during the stay so I appreciated this contact. There was nothing major to complain about but it was nice he had taken the time to do this. The response I had was positive and encouraging, hopefully it will go some way to making someone else's stay even better than ours. Try the hotel, we enjoyed our one night stay, it is well situated and
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Priced too high for the quality.
Summary: I would not recommend this hotel for the price of the rooms. The maids did not clean our room, we had to get up in the middle of the night several times to turn the air conditioner on because it would not stay on on auto. The cafe located in the restaurant had terrible service and the price of the food for the quality was awful. The only good thing about this motel was the valet. The gentlemen were very helpful and informational.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words regarding the Valet Team and I apologize for the service short falls in housekeeping and the restaurant. I also appreciate you letting me know about the air conditioning unit not staying on through the night as this will help us to fix the many air conditioning issues that our guests have brought to my attention. If there is anything else that I may assist with please feel free to reach out to me directly.  Thank You All the Best!   Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com

Summary: We really enjoyed our visit. Very clean and friendly place with a great rooftop bar! Only complaint is the bathroom is very small for what they call a suite. Will book the 4th floor room which are larger suites next time.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had a fun family getaway over the 4th of July with the dogs and 2 kids. The pool is small but kids had lots of fun. Beach was across street but did not allow dogs. We drove to a beach that did after 4:30pm and before 10am (Corona Del Mar). The room service was good but breakfast was less quality and very crowded on a busy weekend. Overall a great stay and would recommend. Very expensive area and nice to have 2 big very well behaved dogs with.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel is close to the beach though you have to walk through a camp ground to get there. Clean, nice decor but some short ups eye made during remodel. Our room had a pull out bed in the sitting area but no screen of privacy door that is shown in the website pictures. Hotel restaurant had pretty good food but priced for upper scale. Lastly, parking at $22.00 a day when we stayed over 5 days is ridiculous. For some of those small reasons we will think twice about returning.  Staff was great!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Overall ok stay. The hotel is a bit dated, yet the location is nice. The 5th floor was a nice add. The rest area was good as well.  Close to the beach. Recommend they update the rooms with s bit fresher look.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel served the purpose of what we wanted. It was near San Clemente (we were visiting family) and it was clean and the bed was comfy. I enjoyed the cookie at check in and I'm sad we didn't get to check out the 4th floor bar. I love that you can text the front office if you have any issues. We had a drainage issue which they addressed within 24 hrs, so that was great. The valets are super helpful for anywhere you need to go and they have great recommendations. Parking/valet is pretty steep at $22 per day, but it was nice to not have to scramble for a parking spot. Also, we had an "ocean view." We were on the 2nd floor so we had a stellar view of the street and RV park and a hint of ocean...lol. Beach access is right across the street as well, so that is pretty convenient.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I'm not a huge fan of DoubleTree as you really don't know what you're going to get. I don't mean that in a Forrest Gump kind of way. For example, this DoubleTree is so different than the one in Austin, and so different than others I've stayed at. I don't believe DT is meant to be all about unique properties, but anyway, just noting that there's not much you can count on when it comes to appearances.  That said, this hotel looks very well, at least from the inside. Things are modern, and generally felt solid. Unfortunately, the service at this hotel was very lacking, and inconsistent.  First, I was appreciative of a pre-arrival upgrade to a Surfside Suite. However, at check-in, I was told that I was in a standard room. Two things here - the most obvious one is that they failed to
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and appreciate your time, effort and detail of your recent stay. I am the new General Manager at this property and even though I didn't start until after the 4th of July weekend, I take full responsibility! I apologize for the many failures and inconsistencies with service and especially for the grumpy engineer. I plan to review these comments with the team members and ask for their input on what they need from me in order to perform consistently great service to the guest so that some day we can earn back your trust and business. Thank you again and please feel free to contact me directly if I may be of any future service.  All the Best!  Bill Reider General Manager  DoubleTree by Hilton Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com

Summary: I checked-in my mother-in-law into the hotel for the July 4th weekend and she stayed for a total of six nights. The first day she checked in, we were greeted with a very rude front desk employee. There were issues with the cash/credit card system on payment of the hotel. I was expecting to pay a certain amount that I booked on the hotel's website, but it turned cost a lot more money to stay there. With taxes, incidentals, and parking fees...I shelled out another $500.00.  The lady at the front desk was not courteous or friendly. It was stressful to check-in the room for my mother-in-law, and the hotel front-desk did not make it any easier.   Finally we get into the room and it had a weird odor coming from the bathroom area. I decided to buy a lot of Febreze to cover up the bad
Manager Response: Dear SSCapo, I am so sorry to hear that the front desk team being rude to your Mother In Law this past Holiday Weekend as well as the other issues with your room. I appreciate you taking time to notify me so that I can address with the team in order to fix so this does not happen to others in the future. If there is anything else that I may assist with please feel free to contact me directly.  Thank You and All the Best!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree by Hilton Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com

Summary: a week before the 4th of July weekend I booked a room at the Doubletree suites Doheny beach for the 4th of July. For the last 18 years we have camped across the street at Doheny camp grounds every year and decided to do the doubletree this year. Man did i screw up. i booked a room and was asked to pay an extra $26 for an oceanfront  view. So I did. wife and kids pretty excited only to find out upon checking in that they said there were no ocean view rooms available? why would they offer to me a week earlier and hold it for me for the $26 only to tell me its not available at check in??(they put me in a corner room on the backside looking at the freeway) and by the way, no working ice machines on amt floor. next I decided to take my wife up to the rooftop bar for cocktails before
Manager Response: Thank you for your time and effort that you took to let me know about your recent stay over the Holiday Weekend. I'm the new General Manager who takes full responsibility! I am so sorry about the many service failures and greatly appreciate the details so I can focus my attention into these areas for immediate improvements. If there is anything else that I can assist with in the future please reach out to me directly. Thank you and All the Best!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree by Hilton Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com

Summary: Hotel is conveniently located off the PCH.  Close to the beach, whale watching and all sorts of restaurants.  Don't pay extra for the 4th floor rooms with a view.  Palm trees block most of your view to the ocean.  Room was clean.  AC worked well.  Plenty of room for 2 people.    3 warnings:  1.  There is a commuter/Amtrak train that runs right behind the building.  If you face the tracks you will hear the train.  Commuter train stops around 10 pm.  Then there is the 1 freight train that comes through nightly...times vary.  2.  Don't waste your time or money at the 1st floor restaurant.  It is over priced and the food is not that good.  3.  If you want a late night cocktail or snack, both the restaurant and rooftop bar close at 10 pm.  Did not use the pool.  Too many kids for my
Manager Response: none

Summary: Yes, the hotel has been recently remodeled.  Yes, the beach is an easy walk.   Friends of our were also staying here.  They're AC did not work.  Maintenance came to fix it soon after check in.  In our room - the access panel to HVAC was in the bathroom almost exactly over the toilet.  My son had no sooner finished using the restroom when the panel fell off nearly hitting him.  I called the front desk.  They apologized profusely and sent someone to fix it while we were at dinner.  Upon our return - I was then using the restroom and the panel fell again!  I called once again and they comped our parking fee and sent someone up to stick a few screws into the panel.  It did not fall again, but I fear that it's just a matter of time before those screws give out.  I hope no one is
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Not Great But Nicer Than Some
Summary: We stayed here for a special occasion thinking it was right on the beach.  It's NEAR the beach--across a busy street--but not on.  Our ocean view room was mostly a view of trailers parked across the street with a strip of blue.  The room was nice & clean.  The best part of the place is the rooftop bar, which has spectacular views but it was very short staffed and people were getting mad at the poor bartender.  This DoubleTree is much nicer than some beach hotels, but it's not a place I'd want to stay again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Had stayed at this property several years ago and it was awful but I was told it had been remodeled and the pictures look nice. The check and experience was so so not very friendly. The bathroom I had mold on the The ceiling, the shower wouldn't drain properly, and there was never any hot water the whole two days I was there, just lukewarm. There was a slimyfilm left  in the tub. Our friend stayed in another room and have the same experiences. I was contacted by Ingrid from the staff via text and complained and was told someone from engineering would come up but that never happened. Worst Hilton Hotel I have ever stayed at by far extremely disappointed
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent comments and I am very sorry to hear that we let you down during your recent stay. I do appreciate you letting me know about this so that I can focus attention into the areas that you mentioned above. Thank you again and please let me know if there is anything else that I can assist with in the future.  All the Best!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree by Hilton Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com

Summary: This hotel is not a 4 star accommodation. So many things went wrong and the staff are not trained to deal with problems in a satisfactory manner. Run down and not on the beach at all. Stay away and give your money to someone else.
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent comments and I am very sorry to hear that we let you down during your recent stay. I do appreciate you letting me know about this so that I can focus attention into the areas that you mentioned above. Thank you again and please let me know if there is anything else that I can assist with in the future.  All the Best!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree by Hilton Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com

Summary Heading: A wonderful getaway to a beachside paradise!
Summary: If you want a peaceful getaway overlooking palm trees and the waves of the Pacific, the DoubleTree by Hilton at Doheny Beach-Dana Point is the place!  From the friendly and helpful valets like Jack and Scott, to the accommodating front desk personnel and beautiful suites, this place is a true gem!  With a spacious and comfortable mini-living room, comfortable beds with lots of pillows and a delicious breakfast buffet, it's easy to not want to go anywhere and just relax on a balcony and watch the world go by.  Close to everything in the Dana Point-San Juan Capistrano area, you can catch a free trolley that will take you from the Harbor to the shops in Dana Point to the Mission and and back.  Or you can cross the street and hit the waves at Doheny, or simply swim in the pool at
Manager Response: none

Summary: Nice location and the hotel seemed ok from the outside but had to change rooms the first night because the AC was so loud and it broke down on the second night (in another room). To top it all off - they charge me for the same stay , twice. Now I have to go through the hassle of getting that straightened out. Not fun.
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent comments and I am very sorry to hear about the air conditioning and billing issues during your recent stay. I do appreciate you letting me know about this so that I can focus attention into the areas that you mentioned above. Thank you again and please let me know if there is anything else that I can assist with in the future.  All the Best!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree by Hilton Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com

Summary: Be very specific when you book to ask for a room that doesn't face the freeway. Also, since the hotel is dog friendly, which is fine if you are going with a dog, ask that you not be placed in adjoining not rooms if you are not looking to share your expletive with canine neighbors. Pool and staff are good. Perhaps the rooms above the second floor
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent comments and I am very sorry to hear that we let you down during your recent stay. I do appreciate you letting me know about this so that I can focus attention into the areas that you mentioned above. Thank you again and please let me know if there is anything else that I can assist with in the future.  All the Best!  Bill Reider General Manager DoubleTree by Hilton Dana Point Bill.Reider@Hilton.com

Summary: The room was comfortable, but in my particular room the bathroom sink faucet was leaking and one of the stand up lights was about to die out. Excellent room service. Decent gym. Cute pool. The hotel has a little convenient store. So-So customer service. The location is perfect.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: My guest was injured due to negligence on the part of the hotel. Exposed glass on the shower due to a worn seal.
Summary: The hotel manager was indifferent and unprofessional during check out!! Apparently business as usual. He never asked about the injury or his welfare. The Supervisor was great she offered to comp the room after being told of the loud noise (broken compressor) in the bathroom and the injury to my guest.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel itself is very clean, modern, and the location is nice and convenient. I booked the hotel via Expedia, and this was my birthday gift to myself (cerebrating alone….) So I called into the hotel beforehand asking if there would be anything they could do to make this day special. I was told that since I booked via Expedia, I had to make request via Expedia, so I did. Expedia people was so nice and called into the hotel, and I was told that hotel people were all aware of my birthday. I was hoping that, at least, I could get the ocean view room. Upon arrival, to check in, waited quite a while. The front desk was very busy, and the lady was on the phone, talking during the most of my check in. And well, there was absolutely NO mention about my birthday, and I was very very
Manager Response: none

Summary: We enjoyed our one night stay at the location.  At first we were disappointed.  Our "ocean view" room was not what we expected at all.  But after talking to the manager who was very nice and understanding we were moved to a room with a real view of the ocean. (Thanks for the quick and helpful response!)  After that, our visit was great.  The room was spacious (separate sitting area) and the balcony had enough room for a small table and two chairs.  The rooftop lounge was great.  A great view and nice set up.  However, it is only open in the evening.  It would have been a nice location to set and enjoy the view during the day (even without bar service), but you couldn't get in.  The location was an easy walk to the beach, however, you do have to cross a street (with a light) and
Manager Response: none

Summary: A family celebration that Hilton/DoubleTree has helped complete. I booked five rooms, service was great. Close to beach and other amenities, San Juan Capistrano is a fabulous city to explore and enjoy!
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was a very nice property with picturesque views of Doheny Beach and it's surrounding areas.  Doheny Beach is actually right across the street.  The hotel's rooftop bar area provided even more spectacular sights of Dana Point.  Our room with a king, sitting area, and patio was pleasant.  Bathroom was a bit tiny, however.  I'd recommend this hotel to others.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Had issue with AC. Nit what I expect from a Hilton property. Restaurant and rooftop bar were great. Location close to beach was exactly what I wanted. Staff accommodated room change in middle of night but it was apparent other rooms had faulty AC as well
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had a terrific visit.  The location is very convenient to the beach and the marina.  We walked most places - restaurants, etc.   Also they take dogs which is a big plus for us.   The staff was very helpful and the recent renovation was very nice.
Manager Response: none

Summary: When we arrived the toilet was clogged. The staff was very quick to help us ou with the problem and offer free wifi. The wifi was very inconsistent. The cost seemed reasonable, but then once I arrived I had to pay $22 for self park or $22 for valet. So that ended up adding another $100 to my stay. The rooftop bar is very nice and the beach across the street was great.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here one night whilst driving from LA to San Diego. The room was one of the best I have experienced at a DoubleTree in the US, modern, fresh and updated to a good standard.  The roof top terrace was nice, we finished our evening there for a drink.  The marina area is workable, probably a 10 minute walk.  The a/c in the lounge area of the 'suite' was a little lacking and the service at reception was not the best, but overall it was a nice experience.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We brought our 3 children to Dana Point to see the beach. This hotel has the perfect location right on the beach. We were able to walk and watch a surfing contest and we enjoyed close by whale watching. The hotel has a small pool, but it is very clean and looks updated. There is a rooftop bar on the 4th floor with a beautiful view of the ocean. The two rooms we had were clean and looked updated. Check in was seamless and we even got extra cookies since they saw we had 3 kids.
Manager Response: Dear Diana,  Thank you very much for sharing your review! I am glad to read that you and your family enjoyed your stay with us! Your kind recognition related to cleanliness and registration have been shared accordingly, thank you very much for making time to mention these.   Thank you very much for staying with us, I look forward to welcoming you and your family back soon.   Richard Uribe General Manager richard.uribe@Hilton.com 949 234 4500

Summary: First, the positives. The rooms are very quiet, the location is very convenient to both activities and places to eat, and the valet staff is super. Once we learned how to make the turn on Pacific Coast Highway, we figured out the one-way street in front of the hotel. However, this could not compensate for serious shortcomings. We had to get new keys to our room door every day. The bathroom sink was stopped up. One of the two elevators was not working, and the working elevator was so slow, it was always faster to take the stairs.
Manager Response: Greetings,  Thank you so much for your review! Your recognition of the efforts of our valet team has been shared. Thank you! I understand your frustration with the keys not working properly, I have shared your feedback with our Chief Engineer and our Front Office Manager as we focus on improving this while we await for our schedule upgrade to "Digital Key" where guests will be bale to open their guest room door with their smart phones or by simply waving a card by the door handle. I anticipate this project to be completed by end of September this year. Thank you for brining this to our attention. The elevator that had a burned motor has been fixed and its back up and running, I am sorry for the extended wait times you experienced. We continue focused on working toward improving our operation, your feedback is valuable and appreciated. I hope to welcome you back to our hotel soon. Best regards,

Summary Heading: Friendly Helpful Staff, Family friendly atmosphere
Summary: Location is right across the beach campgrounds.  I think that is an important distinction to make.  It was quite easy to look beyond all the beach campers, and tents, but just note that little detail.  Personally, it was not a big deal, but the walk with  two small kids  (2 & 3 yo) to the beach took about 10 minutes. You will have to cross the street to get to the beach, and from there, there isn't a pedestrian path dedicated to getting to the beach. We had to walk on the curb (which the kids found to be tons of fun).  Now, about the property, the staff was extremely helpful and genuinely kind.  Everyone from the front desk to housekeeping staff greeted us with a smile.  At breakfast the the next morning, we were pleasantly surprised the host knew our family name.    The rooms
Manager Response: Hello,  Thank you very much for sharing your review. I am delighted to read that you and your family enjoyed your stay and our city. Your kind recognition related to our service levels has been properly shared, thank you very much!  Your loyalty to our hotel means very much to us all here, thank you very much for staying with us. We look forward to welcoming you back soon!   At your service,

Summary: Upon arrival we discovered our room was covered in ants. Thankfully we were quickly places in another room. We were very unhappy to wake up and find the new room had ants covering the bathroom and as a result getting into our belongings.  Restaurant experience was poor. Lacked customer service. Staff basically ignored us. Several food items on buffet weren't available or were unappealing.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great location but Hotel has fallen apart
Summary: Bad experience on my recent visit. AC wasn't working in room or retaurant. Service was bad in bar they didn't have basics like grapefruit juice, took a half an hour to get a drink. Room wasn't properly stocked...no blow dryer, refrigerator wasn't working. Had to sleep with windows open and traffic noise kept us up all night. Overall seems like management isn't doing a good job.
Manager Response: Greetings,  Thank you very much for your candid feedback. I have shared it with the managers responsible for the areas mentioned. Since your stay, we have been working together on identifying action steps in an effort to better serve you next time you visit our hotel. Please accept my most sincere apologies for the inconveniences you experienced during your stay, we all truly hope to welcome you back during your next visit to Doheny Beach.   We are all at your service here at the hotel, today and in the future. Please feel free to reach out any time.  Thank you very much for staying with us and for your review.  Richard Uribe General Manager richard.uribe@Hilton.com 949 234 4500

Summary Heading: I Don't Even Know Where to Start...
Summary: I was referred by a Hilton associate to check out this particular hotel, and thought the place would be worth it to check out for two reasons: its dog-friendly, and I've had very good experiences with Doubletree hotels elsewhere.  I was expecting an awesome stay, but to my surprise, that wasn't the case.  Firstly, the valets are awesome.  The front desk sucks. There was an Asian guy at the front desk named Anthony (I think), who was not particularly friendly. It's very uncomfortable for a guest to ask the front desk a question, no matter what its about, only to get a nonverbal response. Anthony is very good at answering your questions without opening his mouth, or even looking at you. Also, there is a small room that acts as the "gift shop," and it was a mess.   At night, the
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had an awesome time. Location was excellent , able to take long walks to the beach  as beach is just across the street. clean rooms , friendly staff . There is a $22 charge for parking daily , that's the only set back  They are a dog friendly facility
Manager Response: Dear Edward,  Thank you very much for sharing your review. I am delighted to read that you all enjoyed your stay and our location. Your recognition of cleanliness and friendliness has been and will continue to be shared with the team members as I visit their areas. Thank you very much, it truly means a lot to us all.   I hope to welcome you back soon .   Best regards,  Richard Uribe General Manager richard.uribe@Hilton.com 949 234 4500

Summary: We were very disappointed in this Hilton property. The room was dirty. The bathroom was small and had zero counter space. The staff was not very friendly or helpful. The valet staff was wonderful, front desk not so much.
Manager Response: Dear Kerry,  Thank you very much for your review. Your valuable feedback has been shared with the department managers responsible for the areas mentioned, we will work together in improving so that we may better serve you next time you visit us. Please accept my apologies for the inconveniences you experienced during your stay.   We are all at your service, please feel free to reach out.   With warm regards,

Summary: We left another property because we were unhappy with cleanliness, view, environment and safety in Dana Point in search of something better.  We truly stumbled upon Doubletree.  When we walked in we were greeted by the front desk clerk and Director of Housekeeping, Elvia.  From the moment she greeted us, everything was first class. Elvia took a personal interest in finding an appropriate room, making sure we were satisfied with everything and checked on us regularly.  The service could not be duplicated.   Our room was clean, great view and very comfortable.  Breakfast, rooftop bar, pool and other amenities were awesome.  We have everything positive to say and will definitely return to Doubletree Doheny.  And the warm cookies were the BEST.  Thank you, Elvia, for a wonderful
Manager Response: Dear Caroline,  Thank you very much for sharing your review. I am delighted to read that Elvia and our team took great care of you during your stay with us. Your kind recognition has been and will continue to be shared as I visit the various areas of the hotel this week. Thank you!  We all appreciate you staying with us and also look forward to welcoming you back soon!   Warm regards,  Richard Uribe General Manager richard.uribe@Hilton.com 949 234 4500

Summary: I stayed at this property in May, 2016. I was looking for an inexpensive place in this area for business travel, and couldn't resist choosing this place based on the price. It was easily $50/night less than the equivalent, non-beach properties that were somewhat closer to where I needed to be, but being on the beach (well, across the street from it) for $50 less per night was a no-brainer.  Check-in: Efficient, was given a room upgrade, and the room was clean and fresh.  Daily housekeeping service was done in time (a pet peeve of mine), and everything was clean.  The location: Easy access, right on Pacific Coast Highway, easy access to everything nearby.  The property:  You can tell it's an older shell with renovated insides. It was fine though. The bath tubs were a little odd,
Manager Response: Hello Angelo,  I am delighted to read that you enjoyed your stay with us. Your recognition of the efforts of our team members has been and will continue to be shared as I visit the various departments in the hotel. Thank you very much for making time to mention them!   We are all very excited about our recent renovation being completed. I am glad to read that you noticed.   Thank you very much for staying with us, we are all at your service and look forward to welcoming you back soon.   Richard Uribe General Manager richard.uribe@Hilton.com 949 234 4500

Summary Heading: Great location and dog friendly but fix the elevator!
Summary: Pros: Walk to the beach Walk to restaurants Close freeway access Roof top bar Dog friendly  Cons: $22 for both valet and self parking Small pool No hot tub (spa) Slow elevators  My wife and I were looking for a Southern California Hilton Honors hotel for an anniversary getaway.  Our criteria included a reasonable rate as well as a place that allowed our dog.  We've stayed at Palm Springs hotels in the past but were looking for someplace with a little bit cooler weather.  The Doubletree in Dana Point fit the bill:  We found an affordable AAA rate of $134 (even better than the Hilton Honors rate) with a fairly flexible cancellation policy (72 hours prior to arrival).    We arrived on a Sunday afternoon with temperatures near triple digits (not that much cooler than Palm Springs).
Manager Response: Greetings,  Thank you so very much for your detailed review. Your feedback is valuable and very much appreciated!  I understand your frustration with our elevator breaking down during a high occupancy time for our hotel. Unfortunately, the motor burned out on us. It has been fixed and back in operation, I am glad to report. Please accept my most sincere apologies for the inconvenience.   I have shared your constructive feedback with the managers responsible for the areas mentioned so that we may work together on providing proper resolution and better serve you during your next visit to our hotel.   Thank you very much for staying with us, we all look forward to welcoming you back soon.   Best regards,

Summary: Parking is $22/ day No free wifi Noisy. Poor soundproofing Access to the beach is not safe . No sidewalk. Poor AC . Asked for an upgrade in my booking and was not informed that I was not getting it until after I checked in and was told the hotel is fully booked the following day  already .I felt so entrapped .
Manager Response: Greetings,  Thank you very much for sharing your review. Your candid feedback has been shared with the department managers responsible so that we can work together and improve in an effort to better serve you next time you visit our hotel.   During the summer time, our ability to offer upgrades at check in is very slim. These room types are booked in advanced. I hope you understand our position with this important matter.   Our additional fees are posted in our website in an effort to make our future guests aware of them in advance, I am sorry we missed you. Complimentary wifi is available to HHonors members, please let me know during your next stay and I will be happy to personally assist you in signing up, its fast and simple to do and all the other benefits are magnificent.   Thank you very much for staying with us, I look forward to welcoming you back soon.  Richard Uribe General Manager richard.uribe@Hilton.com 949 234 4500

Summary Heading: Not a luxury hotel but delivers very well for its class
Summary: Our extended family of eight just came back from a weekend getaway to Dana Point to escape the weekend heatwave. Let me start off by saying that Dana Point has some of the best beaches in the OC and beats anything in LA. They are clean and not crowded and have some great learning experiences for children. Our kids love the Ocean Institute. That being said, this area does not have a large number of hotels to choose from as compared to Huntington Beach or Newport Beach. There are very high end places like the Ritz Carlton and then there are a few lower end places like independent motels but not too many intermediate four star hotels. In fact, the only one that really fits that category is the Marriott Laguna Cliffs and it is priced much higher than a typical four star hotel due to
Manager Response: Greetings,  Thank you very much for your detailed review! I am delighted to read that you and your family enjoyed our hotel and your stay with us. Your recognition has been shared with the team members as I visited their areas, thank you very much!   Our server's name is Tri, thank you very much for mentioning his efforts individually, he is great!  I look forward to welcoming you back soon!   Warm regards,  Richard Uribe General Manager richard.uribe@Hilton.com 949 234 4500

Summary: Stayed at the hotel for a weekend to attend a charity run/walk in Laguna Nigel Park. Rented two rooms on the third floor one with a king size bed and ocean view the other with two double beds and ocean view. The room with two double beds actually had no ocean view since the palm trees blocked all of it.   This is a pet friendly hotel and our king bed room smelled like pet urine the entire time very overwhelming. The bathrooms are small and the shower door opens out so you end up flooding the bathroom floor. Rooftop bar had a great view, staff was friendly, the drinks were awful, margaritas are weak and no flavor.   Good stuff: beach is across the street but you have to walk through a campground to get to it. Valet staff outstanding! Gave us directions, helped us rent a pedal
Manager Response: Greetings,  Thank you very much for sharing your review. I sincerely appreciate you highlighting our location, views and the friendliness of our staff as well as the efficiency of our valet team, I have shared your recognition with them all. Thank you!  I have also shared your candid feedback related to the margaritas and cleanliness of your room with the appropriate managers so that we can work together on improving and better serving you next time you visit our hotel. Please accept my apologies for having experienced these inconveniences.   I look forward to welcoming you back soon, thank you very much for your review and for staying with us.   Richard Uribe General Manager richard.uribe@Hilton.com 949 234 4500

Summary: We are loyal Hilton Diamond members, and were visiting friends in Southern California. It felt it was time for a private retreat, to relax and rest, going from Orange County to San Diego. Wow! This Double Tree filled the bill and turned out to be perfect for our needs. It felt like a boutique hotel, with very warm and friendly staff, high quality service. The meals were great, restaurant quiet, so it was a romantic getaway.
Manager Response: Hello,  I am glad to read that you enjoyed your stay with us. Thank  you for sharing your review.   Your DIAMOND Status with HHonors is greatly appreciated by us all here at the hotel, thank you very much for your loyalty to our brand.  Your kind recognition has been properly shared with the team members as I visited their areas, thank you very much!   I look forward to being of service to you again in the near future.   Best regards,  Richard Uribe General Manager richard.uribe@Hilton.com 949 234 4500

Summary: My dog and I had a great time at the Dana Point Doubletree.  The location and the ocean view room with balcony was extraordinary.  It is across the street from Doheny Beach and in walking distance to restaurants and shopping.
Manager Response: Dear Donna,  Thank you very much for your review. I am delighted to read that you enjoyed your stay with us!   From all of us here at the hotel, thank you very much for staying with us! We all look forward to welcoming you back soon!  Warm regards,  Richard Uribe General Manager richard.uribe@Hilton.com 949 234 4500

Summary Heading: Worst Hilton Hotel experience in Souther CA
Summary: Pictures of room and hotel quality on Hiton site is very deceiving.  Property is surrounding by highways not beach.  Food service in restraunt was extremely poor.  This is not an All Suite hotel, it is small rooms with a couch.  Save your $ and stay elsewhere!
Manager Response: Dear Ryan,  Thank you very much for your review. Your candid feedback has been shared with the appropriate members of our leadership team so that the proper steps are taken in an effort to improve our operation. I am truly sorry we did not meet your expectations and sincerely hope to welcome you back during your next trip to Dana Point. I am at your service today and in the future, please feel free to reach out any time.  Richard Uribe General Manager richard.uribe@Hilton.com 949 234 4500

Summary Heading: Best Beach Location in Dana Point!
Summary: This hotel is about as close to the beach in Dana Point as you can get. The decor is upbeat and very beachy. The beach is right across the street and you can hear the waves.They have a great down to earth vibe going. We ate in the restaurant and it was really good. The rooms are very well appointed and the beds were super comfy. I'll go back for sure!
Manager Response: Greetings,  I am glad to read that you enjoyed your stay with us, thank you very much for sharing. I have shared your kind recognition with our Director of Housekeeping, Chef and Culinary team as well as the serving staff in the restaurant.   Your willingness to return means so very much to us all here at the hotel, thank you so much for staying with us and for your loyalty to our hotel!  We look forward to welcoming you back soon.  Richard Uribe General Manager richard.uribe@Hilton.com 949 234 4500

Summary Heading: Awful customer service, poor quality rooms, surprising for a DoubleTree
Summary: Right off the bat checking into the hotel was a disappointing experience the front desk was very rude and showed little interest that I was a guest of the hotel. I had to call American Express to get the room that I had requested that had a  guaranteed noon check in. The front desk told me that I would be lucky to get a room by 4pm. After American Express called the hotel amazingly a room was available. BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE #1 lying to the guest. I stay at Hilton hotels all the time I am an Hhonors Gold Member. When trying to link my account so I didn't have to pay the $12.95 daily internet fee the front desk told me that I can't use my Hhonors account because I booked the travel through American Express. So what is the point of the Hhonors account?? This hotel stay has made me
Manager Response: Dear Clint,  Thank you very much for your review. Your valuable feedback has been shared with the department managers responsible for the areas mentioned. Please accept my most sincere apologies for the inconveniences you experienced during your stay with us. We will be working together on identifying resolutions in an effort to prevent reoccurrence going forward. Thank you very much for your feedback.   Your GOLD Status with HHonors means very much to us, thank you for your loyalty to our brand. I am at your service in the event you would like to further discuss your stay. Please feel free to reach out any time.   Thank you for staying with us, I look forward to welcoming you back.   Richard Uribe General Manager richard.uribe@Hilton.com 949 234 4500

Summary: This is a nice hotel.... the pool is a little on the small side, but it it adjacent to Doheny Beach. Our room was nice and clean. Ice machine on our floor was broken. Near to Laguna and Dana Point Harbor. They charge for parking and Wifi which is ridiculous in this day and age.
Manager Response: Dear Stephanie,  Thank you very much for sharing your review! I am delighted to read that you enjoyed our hotel! I'm glad to say that the ice machine is back in operation, I am sorry it was out of order during your stay.   I appreciate your candid feedback related to our parking and wifi fees, these are common practice in the full service hotels in our market. I hope you understand our position with this important matter as your complete satisfaction is very important to us all here at he hotel. Please stop by the registration area during your next visit so that we can enroll you in our Hilton Honors program, all HHonors members receive complimentary wifi as part of their standard benefits.   I look forward to being of service to you in the near future. Thank you very much for your review and for staying with us during your most recent trip to beautiful Dana Point.   Warm regards,  Richard Uribe General Manager richard.uribe@Hilton.com 949 234 4500

Summary: wanted to spend a little more for the perfect get away.  Opted for the room with a private balcony and fireplace.  The fireplace did not work; the screen door on the balcony fell off; and there were cob webs in the bathroom.  The hotel staff was great; and the hotel did take a percentage off my room, however, the weekend never was what it could have been.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great location! Our family stayed here for a quick stay and enjoyed the experience. The room was clean, the view was nice and the food was great! The computer area was down and not working but I really needed an email printed so the front desk receptionist was more than willing to help me out. Friendly people, also the wait staff at the restaurant was also very friendly!
Manager Response: Dear Andrew,  I am so glad to read that our team members showed you our appreciation for staying with us. Your feedback will be shared during the course of the week, thank you so much for sharing.   We all value your loyalty to our hotel and look forward to welcoming you back soon.   I am at your service today and in the future, please feel free to reach out any time.   Warm regards,

Summary: Very nice room with a couch and sitting area and a beautiful ocean view.  It is a very modern hotel.  Wonderful made to order breakfast and great service.    I would definitely stay here again and recommend to friends and family!!!
Manager Response: Dear Dawn,  Your willingness to recommend us to friends and family means so much to us all here at the hotel, thank you much!  I am so glad to read that you enjoyed your guest room and view as well as our breakfast and service. Your kind recognition will continue to be shared during the week. Thank you!  Thank you very much for staying iwth us, I look forward to welcoming you back soon!  Best regards,  Richard Uribe General Manager richard.uribe@Hilton.com 949 234 4500

Summary: The location of the hotel is great.  Nice walking distance to stores and restaurants. The valet staff is amazing.  The rooms are spacious and the outdoor seating area is so relaxing.  Checking in and out was easy.  Loved the noon checkout time.
Manager Response: Dear Lenorah,  Thank you for your kind recognition! We are all very excited to read that you enjoyed your stay with us. We are all at your service today and in the future, please feel free to reach out any time!  From all of us a the DT Dana Point, thank you very much for staying with us! We look forward to being of service to you again in the near future.   Warm regards,

Summary Heading: may as well be a roadside motel
Summary: May as well be a roadside motel with decent rooms. Service was mediocre, pool was tiny, cold, filled with children. Breakfast was good. Don't expect anything romantic. The hotel is crammed into a tiny area between several roads. Surrounded by RV parks and highways, 15 minute walk to shops.
Manager Response: Greetings,  Thank you very much for sharing your review and your candid feedback. I have shared your valuable information related to service with our leadership team as we all focus our efforts in improving and better serving you next time you visit us. I've also asked our maintenance team to double check the water temperature in the pool and adjust as needed, I am truly sorry about the inconvenience you experienced with it. Thank you for bringing this to our attention!   From all of us here at the Doubletree DP, thank you very much for staying with us and we all look forward to welcoming you back soon.   Warm regards,  Richard Uribe General Manager richard.uribe@Hilton.com 949 234 4500

Summary Heading: Good value and a relaxing home base
Summary: I researched numerous hotels looking for an ideal place to stay near the ocean, and am very happy we chose this DoubleTree property. From the moment we arrived, each staff person was super-friendly and accommodating. The suite worked perfectly for me and my two older kids, and since the room has a sleeper sofa (which was surprisingly comfortable) we each had our own bed. The room has blackout curtains, and we all slept great every night. There is a road that runs in front of the hotel, but we never heard noise at night.  Our room was located on the third floor with an ocean view, and we enjoyed sitting on the balcony drinking morning coffee or watching the sun set in the evening. We appreciated having a coffeemaker and refrigerator in the room, and there are several grocery
Manager Response: Hello,  Thank you very much for your valuable feedback, I have also enjoyed our email communication, your recognition means so much to us all here at the hotel. Your candid feedback and suggestions are greatly appreciated by us all too!   I am delighted to read that you enjoyed your stay and that you will return to stay with us during your next trip to Dana Point, this is so important to us and we all appreciate your loyalty to our hotel. We look forward to being of service to you again in the near future :)   I am at your service, please fell free to reach out any time.   Richard Uribe General Manager richard.uribe@Hilton.com 949 234 4500

Summary: Double tree was a bit pricey, but worth it!! Hotel was clean, room service was great, rooftop bar was awesome!! Ocean view could have been a bit nicer, but all in all.. I would definitely go back again! Doheny beach was super easy to access & beautiful!! This hotel was right in the center of San Clemente & Dana Point, which was a huge plus!!
Manager Response: Greetings,  Thank you very much for sharing your review. Your recognition has been and will continue to be shared with the team members as I visit their areas this week.   Your loyalty and willingness to return to our hotel mean so much to us all here at the hotel. We all look forward to welcoming you back soon!  Best regards,  Richard Uribe General Manager Richard.uribe@hilton.com 949 234 4500

Summary: Wonderful helpful staff.  Great rooms, comfy beds and awesome views.  Good location close to the Harbor with some good restaurants. Walking distance to the beach.  I would highly recommend this property.
Manager Response: Dear William,  Thank you very much for sharing your review, I am glad to read that you enjoyed your stay. Your willingness to highly recommend us means so much to us all, thank you!   We look forward to being of service to you during your next visit to Doheny Beach, thank you very much for staying with us!   With warm regards,

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel - Next to Doheny State Beach
Summary: I stayed here for business. Check-in was fast and easy.  Staff was nice and polite.  Hotel was clean.  Parking was plentiful underground, but very expensive at about $25 a day.  They have an on-site restaurant, and a bar that is open at night.  Room was nice and clean, with a mini-fridge (no microwave).  The front door opens out for some reason, instead of opening in, like normal.   The beach is across the street, but you must cross PCH to get there.  There is plenty of chances to cross, but you have to pay attention.  There are quite a few homeless transients that like to hang out at the beach, so use common sense and pay attention to your surroundings.  Also, if you park in the underground garage, take all of your valuables with you, or at least keep them out of plain view, as
Manager Response: Greetings,  Thank you very much for sharing your review. I am glad to read that you enjoyed your stay and that our team members showed you our appreciation for being pour guest. Your kind recognition is greatly appreciated by us all. It has been and will continue to be shared as I visit their areas this week.   We understand the importance of keeping our hotel secure with the local circumstances by having high levels of awareness amongst the management team during the course of the day as well as having an overnight security officer on duty nightly who patrols our grounds to include our parking garage. Thank you very much for sharing your comments related to this important subject.   I truly appreciate your loyalty to our hotel and look forward to welcoming you back soon!   Warm regards,

Summary: Just checked in... Motel 6's have bigger rooms. It's our anniversary, I requested extra pillows, towels and chocolate covered strawberries. Of course, nothing came. The balcony is about 30 inches deep, so I have to sit sideways. It's a "deluxe ocean view room", except all I can see is trees. I'm a Diamond Member, the top tier, and I stay at Hilton brands all the time. This is by far the most disappointing place I've been. What a disappointment for our 27 year anniversary.
Manager Response: Hello,  Thank you very much for sharing your review. I can completely understand your frustration, your comments and feedback are valuable to us all here at the hotel and we all appreciate you making time to share them.   I have communicated with the individuals responsible for the items mentioned so that we can work together on identifying the proper steps to be taken in order to prevent reoccurrence moving forward. Your DIAMOND Status with HHonors is greatly appreciated, thank you very much for your loyalty to our hotel and to our brand.   Please feel free to reach out to me (my contact information is below) as I would like to pursue opportunities in order for me to make things better. Your anniversary is a special occasion, I am honored that you chose to spend it with us, your complete satisfaction is very important to us all here at the hotel. I look forward to hearing from you.   With warm regards,

Summary Heading: Great staff and awesome texting service
Summary: I have stayed at this hotel multiple times now, and I have had a great experience every time! The location is amazing with beautiful views of the beach. One of my favorite spots to hang out in the evenings is on the rooftop patio near the bar and fireplace - would definitely recommend checking it out. The rooms are very nice and clean, and the staff of this hotel is a definite highlight. Magaly was stellar to work with at check-in and made us feel very welcome. Kim is also super helpful and friendly. Another awesome feature of this hotel is their texting system with the front desk. It is WAY more convenient than having to be in your room and pick up the phone to reach housekeeping. You can just send a text and they will reply to your request right away. For example we texted
Manager Response: Hello,  I am delighted to read that you enjoyed your stay again with us! We've had this texting system for a few months now and we are all so excited about its effectiveness and our ability to communicate with our guests so much better. Thank you for mentioning Kim, Magaly and Ingrid! They will be properly recognized :)   Your continued loyalty and complete satisfaction are both very important to us all here at the hotel.   Thank you very much for staying with us, we look forward to your next trip to Dana Point.   Warm regards,

Summary: This is a great location for enjoying some quite time at the beach. Front desk staff do an exceptional job, Magali made sure to expedite a few requests. The suite was very spacious and clean. Restaurant service was a little slow considering that there wasn't anyone else there.
Manager Response: Dear Daniel,  I am glad to read that Magaly did a great job for you and that she showed you our appreciation for being our guest! Your kind recognition has been shared with her as well as with our housekeeping department, thank you! As well, I have shared your comments related to our restaurant with the leadership there as we work together on proper resolutions.   Thank you very much for staying with us, we all look forward to welcoming you back soon!

Summary: Be aware of hidden charges and don't count on promises when it comes to self parking or valet.  I would go to the restaurant/bar down the street instead of the 4th floor.   Service there last 2 hours one evening and 1 hour the next evening. It trully ruined the trip.  Is like we were invincible.
Manager Response: Dear Raul,  Thank you very much for your review. Your valuable feedback has been shared with our Food and Beverage leaders so that the proper steps are taken in an effort to prevent reoccurrence. Please accept my most sincere apologies for the inconvenience you experienced with timeliness there.   I am fully available if you would like to further discuss your folio and the proper charges in it. Your complete satisfaction is very important to me as we as to our entire team. I look forward to hearing from you. My contact information is below.   I am at your service today and in the future, pesae feel free to reach out any tiem.   Best,  Richard Uribe General Manager Richard.uribe@hilton.com 949 234 4500

Summary: Wow!  We loved everything about our stay at the Doubletree at Dana Point!!  The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, the rooms were clean, brightly decorated and comfortable and the location could NOT have been better.  The
Manager Response: Dear Robert,  Your kind recognition has been shared, I am delighted to read that our team members showed you our appreciation for being our guest! Thank you so much for your review!  We all look forward to welcoming you back soon. Thank you for staying with us.   Warm regards,  Richard Uribe General Manager Richard.uribe@hilton.com 949 234 4500

Summary Heading: Poorly trained Front Desk Staff with Bad attitude
Summary: I do not recommend this particular Hilton Property for Business travelers. After spending nearly $2,000.00 during a 3 day stay, I was asked to pay for a small bottle of water, just prior to my departure.
Manager Response: Dear Ranjith,  Thank you very much for your review. I can understand your frustration with the charge for a bottle of water, please know our team member was just following procedure and doing their job to the best of their ability. I truly hope you understand our position with this important mater. Your feedback has been shared as we use it for training in our efforts to serve you better next time you visit us.   I trust that your stay was pleasant and that our team members showed you our appreciation for staying with us during the course of your 3 nights here. Thank you very much for staying with us.   I am at your service today and in the future, please feel free to reach out any time.   Best regards,  Richard Uribe General Manager Richard.uribe@hilton.com 949 234 4500

Summary Heading: Just OK - Nothing fabulous to see here...
Summary: Husband and I recently stayed here while in town for a wedding.  This was actually our second time staying here (the first time was several years ago) and both times we had a decent experience.  The hotel was recently refreshed so the colors, finishings, etc. looked pretty well up to date.  Check in was fine (the cookie however was amazing!) and the front desk staff was very nice.  We were on the top floor with a ocean view so that was pretty nice.  The room itself was pretty good - the suite setup was nice and would definitely be great if you're travelling with a family or group.  Extra space is always a bonus!  The biggest downfall of the room was the bathroom.  I hate to be picky here but the bathroom was just dismal.  No counter space, the sink splashed everywhere, the
Manager Response: Greetings,  Thank you so very much for your detailed review. Your recognition of the efforts of our team members has been shared as I visited their areas.   I am so glad to read that you enjoyed our new colors and new furnishings. We are all very excited with our recent refresh being completed!   Your candid feedback related to our bathrooms is also greatly appreciated. Please accept my apologies for the inconveniences you experienced with it. We have added extra shelving on the walls as well as replaced the traditional door with a barn style door in our efforts to making the bathroom roomier. We will continue making improvements in an effort to better serve you next time you visit our hotel as the valued guest that you are to us all.   Thank you very much for staying with us, I hope to welcome you back soon.  Best regards,

Summary Heading: Great stay, wait staff needs help
Summary: Upstairs lounge has a beautiful view of the ocean. Good luck getting a drink order. Forget a second cocktail unless you have all night. 3-4 wait staff and 6-8 couples and various tables. We could not figure out the cause in the lack of service, just slow and inattentive. Sorry folks, maybe it was just a bad afternoon?
Manager Response: Hello,  Thank you very much for your review! Your feedback is greatly appreciated by us all, we are addressing your comments as we work together in providing our team members with the necessary re training as well as implementing operational procedures in the bar. Please accept my most sincere apologies for the delay you experienced. I am confident that your next visit will be much better. Thank you very much for your candid feedback, it only makes us better as we all want to do a great job for you as our valued guest.   At your servie,

Summary: Weekend doheny Blues festival. Excellent location. Right across from beach. Staff very professional, courtesy, friendly. Rooms are clean, beds comfortable. Valet parking attendants were awesome. Very cool place to stay
Manager Response: Dear James,  I am so glad to read that you stayed with us again for the Doheny Blues Fest, thank you very much for your loyalty and for your kind recognition. They both mean very much to us all here at the hotel!  I look forward to your return as the valued guest that you are to us all .   Best Regards,

Summary: Very pleasant stay.  Great location and very helpful and friendly staff.  Right across from Beach which is where the festival was.  Roof top bar and restaurant were very nice.  Would recommend to anyone for good location
Manager Response: Dear Bruce,  It was a true pleasure having you as our valued guest during the Doheny Blues Festival. Thank you very much for sharing your review and for your kind recognition of our efforts, this truly means very much to us all.   We all look forward to welcoming you back soon!

Summary: The renovated hotel is a joy for Blues visitors...thanks!  Very comfortable bed and room in general.  The view is spectacular.  Don't stay on the main floor if the sound of traffic bothers you.  The walk was easy.  The food was great and the valet/bellmen were rock stars.  Thank you!
Manager Response: Dear Misty,  Thank you very much for coming back to us this year now that our renovation has been completed. We are all so very happy with how our hotel looks and feels now!   I am glad to read that you enjoyed your stay, your continued loyalty means so much to us all here at the hotel, thank you!  I look forward to welcoming you back soon.   At your service,

Summary: We came here for the Doheny Blues Fest and loved this hotel.  We had booked a hotel in Laguna Beach for our anniversary in a couple weeks, but canceled it to stay at this hotel again.  The hotel staff really goes out of their way for you. The service was excellent!
Manager Response: Dear Kimberly,  I am delighted to read that our team members showed you all of our appreciation for being our guest during the Dohney Blues Festival. Your loyalty to our hotel means so much to us all!   I hope to welcome you back very soon.   With warm regards,

Summary: We went for anniversary and the trip was wonderful. The place is clean and the employees are really nice and helpful.  The room was more than what we expected and view was wonderful and beautiful  Dohney beach is rocky but still nice and serene
Manager Response: Dear Laura,  Happy Anniversary!!! Thank you very much for spending it with us, this means so much to us all here at the hotel. We all hope to welcome you back soon and truly appreciate your loyalty to our hotel.   At your service today and in the future,

Summary: Everything about this hotel was great!  Room, valet, food, rooms, all were excellent.  Cleanliness of the hotel was top priority and this exceeded it!  Cookies were a great night cap.  Would stay here again and again.  Hotel employees were always courteous and helpful.
Manager Response: Dear John,  We are all honored by your recognition, thank you very much! Your loyalty to our hotel means so much to us all, we look forward to your return.   With warm regards,

Summary: Great location to the area, good atmosphere for couples and super friendly staff throughout.   This place had all we needed and was a good fit for the activities we did in the area.  Easy parking or valet.   Go to Proud Mary's!  .........
Manager Response: Dear James,  We all appreciate you making time to share your review. Your recognition related to friendliness of staff means very much to us all and has been shared. Thank  you!  We look forward to welcoming you back in the near future.

Summary Heading: Awesome staff, dirty run down property
Summary: I really want to start with the positives, but I"m sitting here thinking about all the germs that may be crawling on me as I type this.Ok, the staff are amazing. Lisa in the restaurant. Luis in the rooftop bar. Anthony and Alea at the front desk. I mean attentive, genuine and helpful.   Obviously the location is stellar. Perhaps they bank on that and just let the property go to hell. I mean I was cleaning my room every time I turned around.....because I kept finding nastiness....
Manager Response: Greetings,  Thank you very  much for your recognition, I have personally shared it with Anthony, Alea, Lisa and Luis. This truly means so much to us all.   I have shared your candid feedback related to cleanliness with our Director of Housekeeping. Unfortunately, we are not able to find your room number with the limited information listed in your review. If it is not too much to ask, it would mean very much to me if you send me your name and date of stay so that the room is identified and the proper steps taken in an effort to address the challenge. Thank you in advance for your participation, my contact information is below.   Thank you for staying with us and for sharing your review. I look forward to our communication.   Warm regards,  Richard Uribe General Manager Richard.uribe@Hilton.com 949 234 4500

Summary: While it was just one night, we enjoyed a great stay for our 21st anniversary. We were greeted with champagne and a nice note in the room and since we were HHonors members were treated to a great, ocean-front room on the top floor. They couldn't have done a better job meeting high expectations. We will be back!
Manager Response: Dear Mark,  Thank you very much for your review, we are honored to be the host hotel for such important event. Happy Anniversary!   I look forward to welcoming you back soon!

Summary: Stayed 2 nights the room was clean, Comfortable bed and view of the ocean. Close to Dana point and Laguna. In comparison this hotel was a good price, clean and a good location. It is hard to find the first time. Staff was nice and helpful. They have a diner type restaurant on site that I would skip next time. However I would stay at the hotel again. Good trip!
Manager Response: Hello,  I am glad to read that you enjoyed your stay with us. Your kind recognition of the efforts of our team members has been shared with them as I visited their areas. Thank you!    From all of us at the Doubletree DP, thank you for staying with us, we look forward to your return.  Richard Uribe General Manager

Summary: It was a pleasure to stay at this hotel. Very restful, nice balcony with a good view. The restaurant is on site and provides any meal one wishes as well as a great happy hour. Great location and easily accessible to every nearby attraction.  The warm cookies are yummy!
Manager Response: Dear Maria,  Thank you so very much for sharing your review. I am delighted to read that you enjoyed your stay with us! Your kind recognition has been shared with our food and beverage department, thank you!  From all of us here at the hotel, thank you very much for staying with us. We all look forward to welcoming you back soon!  Richard Uribe General Manager Richard.uribe@Hilton.com 949 234 4500

Summary Heading: Much Better Options Available - Campground View and Smells Dominate
Summary: The first impression is great as you drive up - architectural features and brightness would fit great on South Beach...  Ocean view rooms DO have a water view (stand on one leg and lean out), but the predominant view is of the campground between the hotel and the beach. Everyone cooks out there, so the smoke smell permeated my room and clothes.  When you walk all the way around the camp to find the beach, you'll find erosion has ravaged the area and major construction is in progress.  This hotel would be best served by rebranding to a different Hilton brand and price point. There are Choice brands down PCH with unobstructed ocean views.
Manager Response: Hello,  Thank you very much for sharing your review. I can completely understand your frustration with the smells of the cooking at the campgrounds. While it had not been mentioned in the past, I have shared with the team members as we work together on identifying potential solutions to the matter in the event it becomes repetitive. Thank you very much for bringing this to our attention.   We are all at your service, in the event that your next room is not to your complete satisfaction, please let us know and I promise we will do every thing we can to find the room that you are happy with. Your complete satisfaction is very important to us all.   Thank you very much for staying with us and for your candid feedback. I look forward to welcoming you back soon.  Richard Uribe General Manager Richard.uribe@Hilton.com 949 234 4500

Summary: Great rooms awesome staff. Would definitely recommend! Got an ocean view with balcony. Location and view were awesome. Love the bar upstairs very romantic and perfect view overlooking the ocean. Will go back for sure.
Manager Response: Greetings,  Thank you so much for your review. I am delighted to read that you enjoyed your room and our roof top Moquila Agave Bar. Thank you so much for your willingness to return to our hotel, your loyalty means very much to us all here at the hotel.   From al of us at the Doubletree Doheny Beach, thank you very much for staying with us and for sharing your review.   Richard Uribe General Manager Richard.uribe@Hilton.com 949 234 4500

Summary: Love the location of this DoubleTree property, right across the street from the beach BUT it is sandwiched in between two busy roads so expect noise. Be very particular when you request a room location. Rooftop bar was great. Pool was mediocre, but why hang at the pool when you have beautiful Doheny clean beach across the street. We drove to restaurants, etc... with it's local it is not entirely perfect for walking. The amenities were above average, you can tell they have recently updated a few aspects about the property. Loved the staff, super helpful with recommendations and we had a really lovely stay.
Manager Response: Hello,  I am so glad you enjoyed our hotel and your stay in general. Your kind recognition of our staff has been shared, thank you!   We look forward to welcoming you back soon!
